analyzed: gal te skad cig ma phyi ma skyes pa na snga ma 'khor ba yin no zhe na /

analyzed: gal te skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma gnyis gcig nyid du 'gyur na ni //
translated: If you say that the past and future exist because the past and future are mentioned in the sutra,

translated: we reply: No, because they are not established.🔽If you say that the past and future exist because the past and future are mentioned in the sutra,

original: gcig nyid du ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig nyid du ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: we reply: No, because they are not established.

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir / mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa dag bzhin no //

original: gzhan yang gcig nyid yin na ni skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi mar brjod par bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gcig nyid yin na ni skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi mar brjod par bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the past and future exist because the past and future are mentioned in the sutra,🔽we reply

original: dus gcig gi tshe lha mi rnams gcig snga ma dang phyi mar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni med de /🔽de bzhin du /
analyzed: dus gcig gi tshe lha mi rnams gcig snga ma dang phyi mar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni med de / de bzhin du /
translated: It is not said that at one time a god or human is the former and later.

original: 'dir yang gcig yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi mar bsnyad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang gcig yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi mar bsnyad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, here, because they are one, it is not said that the former and later moments are different.

original: gzhan yang skad cig ma snga ma zhig go zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang skad cig ma snga ma zhig go zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it would not be said that the former moment has ceased,

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir skad cig ma phyi ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir skad cig ma phyi ma bzhin no //
translated: because it is not different, like the later moment.

original: skad cig ma phyi ma skyes so zhes bya bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi ma skyes so zhes bya bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not be said that the later moment has arisen,

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir skad cig ma snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir skad cig ma snga ma bzhin no //
translated: because it is not different, like the former moment.

original: ci ste gzhan nyid yin pa na 'khor ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan nyid yin pa na 'khor ro zhe na /
translated: But if they are different, they would cycle.

original: de lta na ni gzhan so so'i skye bo 'khor bar skye ba yod pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa rnams kyang 'khor bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na ni gzhan so so'i skye bo 'khor bar skye ba yod pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa rnams kyang 'khor bar 'gyur la /
translated: If that were so, then because ordinary beings who are different cycle, arhats would also cycle.

original: mar me gzhan 'bar ba na shi ba'i mar me yang 'bar ro zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mar me gzhan 'bar ba na shi ba'i mar me yang 'bar ro zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would follow that when another lamp is lit, the extinguished lamp would be lit.

original: gzhan yang skad cig ma phyi ma skad cig ma snga ma zhig pa'am ma zhig pa'am 'jig bzhin pa zhig las skye grang /
analyzed: gzhan yang skad cig ma phyi ma skad cig ma snga ma zhig pa'am ma zhig pa'am 'jig bzhin pa zhig las skye grang /
translated: Moreover, would the later moment arise from the prior moment having ceased, not having ceased, or while ceasing?

original: de las gal te zhig pa las yin par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: de las gal te zhig pa las yin par 'dod na ni /
translated: If it is asserted that it arises from that which has ceased,

original: sa bon tshig pa las kyang myu gu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon tshig pa las kyang myu gu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then a sprout would arise from a burnt seed.

original: de'i phyir rgyu med par 'gyur ro //🔽ci ste ma zhig pa las so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med par 'gyur ro // ci ste ma zhig pa las so zhe na /
translated: Therefore it would be causeless.🔽But if it arises from that which has not ceased,

original: de lta na yang sa bon rnam par 'gyur ba med par yang myu gu skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de lta na yang sa bon rnam par 'gyur ba med par yang myu gu skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: then a sprout would arise from a seed without the seed changing.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis kyang dus gcig par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis kyang dus gcig par 'gyur la /
translated: Also, cause and effect would be simultaneous.

original: skye ba rgyu med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba rgyu med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And arising would be causeless.

original: gal te 'gag bzhin pa las skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gag bzhin pa las skye'o zhe na /
translated: But if it arises from that which is in the process of ceasing,

original: 'jig bzhin pa las kyang skye ba med de /🔽zhig pa dang ma zhig pa las ma gtogs pa'i 'jig bzhin pa med pa'i phyir dang / zhig pa dang ma zhig pa dag la yang nyes pa @95a * //
analyzed: 'jig bzhin pa las kyang skye ba med de / zhig pa dang ma zhig pa las ma gtogs pa'i 'jig bzhin pa med pa'i phyir dang / zhig pa dang ma zhig pa dag la yang nyes pa @95a * //
translated: then arising would not occur from that which is in the process of ceasing.🔽This is because apart from that which has ceased and that which has not ceased, that which is in the process of ceasing does not exist, and the errors

original: brjod zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: have already been explained in relation to that which has ceased and that which has not ceased.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma'i rnam par gzhag pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma'i rnam par gzhag pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the presentation of cause and effect and the presentation of prior and subsequent moments exist?

original: gang gi tshe skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par gzhag pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rgyun yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par gzhag pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rgyun yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: When the presentation of prior and subsequent moments and the presentation of cause and effect do not exist, then a continuum also does not exist.

original: de med pas 'khor ba yang med do //
analyzed: de med pas 'khor ba yang med do //
translated: And since that does not exist, samsara also does not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed mi rtag pa rnams la yang 'khor ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed mi rtag pa rnams la yang 'khor ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, impermanent compounded phenomena also do not cycle.

original: 'dir kha cig 'thad pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir na 'du byed dag mi 'khor ba ni bden te /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig 'thad pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir na 'du byed dag mi 'khor ba ni bden te /
translated: Here, someone might say, “It is true that compounded phenomena do not cycle because that contradicts reason.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But what then?🔽The self cycles.”

original: bdag 'khor ro zhes smra bar byed do //🔽brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag 'khor ro zhes smra bar byed do // brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: sems can la yang rim 'di mtshungs //
analyzed: sems can la yang rim 'di mtshungs //
translated: This same process applies to sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir sems can 'khor ro zhes smra ba /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can 'khor ro zhes smra ba /
translated: For what reason do you say that sentient beings cycle?

original: ci 'di rtag pa'am mi rtag pa zhig 'khor zhes rnam par dpyad pa na /
analyzed: ci 'di rtag pa'am mi rtag pa zhig 'khor zhes rnam par dpyad pa na /
translated: If one analyzes whether or not this self cycles,

original: 'du byed dag 'khor bar mi 'thad pa'i rim pa gang yin pa de sems can la yang mtshungs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir sems can yang 'khor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed dag 'khor bar mi 'thad pa'i rim pa gang yin pa de sems can la yang mtshungs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir sems can yang 'khor ba ma yin no //
translated: then just as it is not tenable that formations cycle, so too it is the same for sentient beings. Therefore sentient beings also do not cycle.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: 'du byed dag 'khor bar mi 'thad pa'i tshul ni sems can la yang mtshungs par 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed dag 'khor bar mi 'thad pa'i tshul ni sems can la yang mtshungs par 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: The mode of not tenably that formations cycle is not suitable to be the same for sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir 'du byed rtag pa dang mi rtag par gyur pa dag kho na la 'khor ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'du byed rtag pa dang mi rtag par gyur pa dag kho na la 'khor ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is said that only formations that are permanent or impermanent do not cycle.

original: zhes bya bar smras na /
analyzed: zhes bya bar smras na /
translated: If you say that,

original: bdag ni de ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni de ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: then the self is not like that, for it is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: 'di ltar phung po dag las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod du med par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po dag las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod du med par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Just as it is said that the self is inexpressible as the same as or different from the aggregates, so it is also established that it is inexpressible in terms of permanence or impermanence.

original: de'i phyir bdag kho na 'khor zhing sngar bstan pa'i nyes par yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag kho na 'khor zhing sngar bstan pa'i nyes par yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, only the self would cycle and the previously mentioned faults would not follow.

original: brjod par bya ste //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste //
translated: We respond:

original: gal te gang zag 'khor zhe na //
analyzed: gal te gang zag 'khor zhe na //
translated: If the person cycles,

original: phung po skye mched khams rnams la //🔽de ni rnam pa lngas btsal na //
analyzed: phung po skye mched khams rnams la // de ni rnam pa lngas btsal na //
translated: it is sought in the aggregates, bases, and constituents.🔽Since it does not exist in the five ways,

original: med na gang zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: med na gang zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: what cycles?

original: gal te gang zag ces bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni de 'khor bar 'gyur ba zhig na /🔽yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gang zag ces bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni de 'khor bar 'gyur ba zhig na / yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If something called a person exists, it would cycle.

original: gang gi phyir phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams la rnam pa lngas btsal ba na yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams la rnam pa lngas btsal ba na yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it does not exist because it is not found in the aggregates, bases, and constituents when sought in the five ways.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: shing nyid me ni ma yin te //🔽shing las gzhan la me yang med //
analyzed: shing nyid me ni ma yin te // shing las gzhan la me yang med //
translated: Fire is not the fuel,🔽nor is fire in the fuel,

original: me ni shing dang ldan ma yin //
analyzed: me ni shing dang ldan ma yin //
translated: nor does fire possess the fuel,

original: me la shing med der de med //🔽me dang shing @95b gis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: me la shing med der de med // me dang shing @95b gis bdag dang ni //
translated: nor is fire in fire, nor is it in both.🔽The self and all appropriated

original: nye bar len pa'i rim pa kun //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rim pa kun //
translated: are like fire and fuel.

original: zhes bya ba de bzhin du bdag phung po dang skye mched dang khams kyi rang bzhin can ma yin zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de bzhin du bdag phung po dang skye mched dang khams kyi rang bzhin can ma yin zhing /
translated: Just as the self is not of the nature of the aggregates, bases, and elements,

original: de dag las tha dad pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag las tha dad pa yang ma yin la /
translated: it is not different from them.

original: phung po dang skye mched dang khams dang ldan pa yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched dang khams dang ldan pa yang ma yin zhing /
translated: It does not possess the aggregates, bases, and elements.

original: bdag la phung po dang skye mched dang khams med cing /
analyzed: bdag la phung po dang skye mched dang khams med cing /
translated: The self does not have the aggregates, bases, and elements,🔽and the aggregates, bases, and elements do not have a self.

original: phung po dang skye mched dang khams la yang bdag med do zhes do zhes de ltar sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa lngas btsal ba na bdag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched dang khams la yang bdag med do zhes do zhes de ltar sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa lngas btsal ba na bdag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, as explained earlier, when the self is sought in the fivefold way, it does not exist.

original: gang zhig de ltar phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams la rnam pa lngas btsal ba na de ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ni de med pas ji ltar 'khor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams la rnam pa lngas btsal ba na de ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ni de med pas ji ltar 'khor bar 'gyur /
translated: How can that which does not exist in the fivefold way when sought in the aggregates, bases, and elements cycle in samsara?

original: de ltar na bdag la yang 'khor ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag la yang 'khor ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the self does not cycle in samsara,

original: mo gsham gyi bu ltar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu ltar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist, like the son of a barren woman.

original: gzhan yang bdag 'di //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag 'di //
translated: Moreover, this self

original: nye bar len nas nyer len par //
analyzed: nye bar len nas nyer len par //
translated: If one transmigrates from appropriating to appropriating,

original: 'khor na srid pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor na srid pa med par 'gyur //
translated: existence would not exist.

original: srid med nye bar len med na //
analyzed: srid med nye bar len med na //
translated: If there is no existence and no appropriating,

original: de gang ci zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de gang ci zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: what is it that transmigrates?

original: gal te yod ni nye bar len pa med par yang 'di 'khor bar rung bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te yod ni nye bar len pa med par yang 'di 'khor bar rung bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: If it is tenable that this transmigrates without appropriating,

original: bdag 'khor bar 'gyur la rag pa zhig go //
analyzed: bdag 'khor bar 'gyur la rag pa zhig go //
translated: then the self would transmigrate.

original: ji ltar de la nye bar len pa med pa nyid du thal bar bstan pa'i phyir //🔽nye bar len nas nyer len par //
analyzed: ji ltar de la nye bar len pa med pa nyid du thal bar bstan pa'i phyir // nye bar len nas nyer len par //
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is just untenable that it transmigrates without appropriating, he says:🔽If one transmigrates from appropriating to appropriating,

original: 'khor na srid pa med par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khor na srid pa med par 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: existence would not exist.

original: 'dir mi'i nye bar len pa nas lha'i nye bar len par 'gro ba na /🔽mi'i nye bar len pa btang nas lha'i nye bar len par 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: 'dir mi'i nye bar len pa nas lha'i nye bar len par 'gro ba na / mi'i nye bar len pa btang nas lha'i nye bar len par 'gro ba'am /
translated: Here, when one goes from the appropriating of a human to the appropriating of a god,

original: ma btang bar yin grang //
analyzed: ma btang bar yin grang //
translated: does one go from the appropriating of a human to the appropriating of a god having relinquished the former appropriating or not?🔽If one goes having relinquished it,

original: re zhig gal te yongs su btang nas 'gro'o zhes brjod na ni /
analyzed: re zhig gal te yongs su btang nas 'gro'o zhes brjod na ni /
translated: then the self would transmigrate.

original: de'i tshe nye bar len pa sngar ma btang ba'i phyir dang phyi ma ma blangs ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe nye bar len pa sngar ma btang ba'i phyir dang phyi ma ma blangs ba'i phyir /
translated: At that time, since the appropriated aggregates have not been relinquished previously and since the subsequent ones have not been appropriated,

original: de dag gi bar du srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi bar du srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: there would be no intermediate existence.

original: 'di la srid pa dang bral ba yod pas na srid pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la srid pa dang bral ba yod pas na srid pa med pa'o //
translated: Since this is devoid of existence, it is nonexistence.

original: srid pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: srid pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste /
translated: Existence is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de dag dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One would be devoid of them.

original: srid pa med cing nye bar len pa med pa gang yin pa de ni phung po lnga dang bral bas gdags pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir rgyu med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: srid pa med cing nye bar len pa med pa gang yin pa de ni phung po lnga dang bral bas gdags pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir rgyu med par 'gyur la /
translated: Since one would be devoid of existence and the appropriated aggregates, one would be devoid of the cause for the imputation of the appropriated aggregates, and thus would be causeless.🔽That which is devoid of the appropriated aggregates, devoid of manifestation, and unmanifest is causeless.

original: gang zhig nye bar len pa med cing gsal byed dang bral ba mi gsal ba rgyu med pa de ni gang ste /
analyzed: gang zhig nye bar len pa med cing gsal byed dang bral ba mi gsal ba rgyu med pa de ni gang ste /
translated: What is that?

original: de ni ci yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ni ci yang ma yin zhing /
translated: It is nothing at all.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is nonexistence.

original: de med pas 'byung bar 'gyur ba lha'i @96a * //
analyzed: de med pas 'byung bar 'gyur ba lha'i @96a * //
translated: Since that does not exist, the gods

original: nye bar len pa po med pa yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ci zhig tu 'khor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po med pa yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ci zhig tu 'khor bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since the appropriator does not exist, what would cycle?

original: gang du 'khor bar 'gyur ba de yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang du 'khor bar 'gyur ba de yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: And where would it cycle?

original: yang na ci zhig ces bya ba 'di ni bya ba 'khor ba'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: yang na ci zhig ces bya ba 'di ni bya ba 'khor ba'i khyad par yin te /
translated: Or, what is meant by “what” is the activity of cycling, which is a particular of the action.

original: de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pas 'khor ba'i bya ba byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pas 'khor ba'i bya ba byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it does not exist, it does not perform the action of cycling.

original: de ltar na re zhig nye bar len pa snga ma btang nas 'khor bar mi rigs pa yin no //🔽ci ste ma btang bar yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig nye bar len pa snga ma btang nas 'khor bar mi rigs pa yin no // ci ste ma btang bar yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, first, it does not make sense that one cycles after relinquishing prior appropriation.🔽But if one cycles without relinquishing it,

original: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: that also does not make sense.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: gang gi phyir snga ma ma btang ba'i phyir dang / phyi ma ma bzung ba'i phyir bdag gcig gnyis nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snga ma ma btang ba'i phyir dang / phyi ma ma bzung ba'i phyir bdag gcig gnyis nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: Because if the prior one is not relinquished and the later one is not appropriated, then a single self would be twofold.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir ma btang bar 'khor ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma btang bar 'khor ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore cycling without relinquishing it also does not exist.

original: ci ste srid pa snga phyi gnyis kyi bar na srid pa bar mdo'i phung po yod pas de dag gis de nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i phyir nye bar len pa nas nye bar len par 'khor yang srid pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe
analyzed: ci ste srid pa snga phyi gnyis kyi bar na srid pa bar mdo'i phung po yod pas de dag gis de nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i phyir nye bar len pa nas nye bar len par 'khor yang srid pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe
translated: But if you say that since the intermediate existence’s aggregates exist between the prior and subsequent existences, they appropriate the prior existence, therefore it is not the case that cyclic existence would be without beginning,

original: na / de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: na / de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that also is not tenable.

original: srid pa bar mdo'i phung por 'khor ba la yang srid pa snga ma gtong ba dang / mi gtong ba dag gi sgo nas thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa bar mdo'i phung por 'khor ba la yang srid pa snga ma gtong ba dang / mi gtong ba dag gi sgo nas thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the consequence that the prior existence would be relinquished or not relinquished would be similar in the cyclic existence of the intermediate existence’s aggregates.

original: cig car gtong ba dang len par byed pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: cig car gtong ba dang len par byed pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no error because the prior existence is relinquished and the subsequent existence is appropriated simultaneously,

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: then we would reply:

original: ci phyogs gcig gis nye bar len pa snga ma gtong zhing phyogs gcig gis srid pa bar mdo'i nye bar len par rgyu 'am /
analyzed: ci phyogs gcig gis nye bar len pa snga ma gtong zhing phyogs gcig gis srid pa bar mdo'i nye bar len par rgyu 'am /
translated: Is the prior existence relinquished by one part and the intermediate existence’s appropriated existence caused to arise by another part?

original: 'on te bdag nyid thams cad kyis yin grang /
analyzed: 'on te bdag nyid thams cad kyis yin grang /
translated: Or is it caused to arise by the whole?

original: de la gal te cha shas kyis so zhes bya bar rtog na ni //
analyzed: de la gal te cha shas kyis so zhes bya bar rtog na ni //
translated: If you think that it is caused to arise by a part,

original: de'i tshe bdag gnyis nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes nyes pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag gnyis nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes nyes pa bshad zin to //
translated: At that time, it would follow, absurdly, that there would be two selves.

original: ci ste bdag nyid thams cad kyis yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste bdag nyid thams cad kyis yin no zhe na /
translated: If you accept the original premise,

original: de lta na yang khyed cag la thal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang khyed cag la thal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows, absurdly, that the same consequence applies to you.

original: khyad par ni 'di tsam zhig yod de /
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di tsam zhig yod de /
translated: The only difference is that

original: srid pa bar ma dor rgyu ba na shin tu nye bas dus thung du zhig tu nye bar len pa med par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //🔽bdag nyid thams cad kyis gtong ba dang len pa dngos po tha dad pa'i yul can dag ni dngos po gcig la cig car mthong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma dor rgyu ba na shin tu nye bas dus thung du zhig tu nye bar len pa med par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o // bdag nyid thams cad kyis gtong ba dang len pa dngos po tha dad pa'i yul can dag ni dngos po gcig la cig car mthong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: the intermediate existence moves very quickly, so that it does not take long for it to be without appropriation.🔽It is not the case that the two actions of giving up and taking up, which are of different objects and which are done by the whole self, are seen simultaneously in one thing.

original: lha sbyin gcig pu khyim nas khyim du rgyu ba la dus gcig tu bdag nyid thams cad kyis gtong ba dang len pa'i bya ba gnyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lha sbyin gcig pu khyim nas khyim du rgyu ba la dus gcig tu bdag nyid thams cad kyis gtong ba dang len pa'i bya ba gnyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that Devadatta, who moves from one house to another, has the two actions of giving up and taking up at the same time and by the whole of himself.

original: ci @96b ste rkang pa gcig gis gcig btang ba'i phyir dang / gzhan len pa'i phyir cig car gtong ba dang len par rtog go zhe na /
analyzed: ci @96b ste rkang pa gcig gis gcig btang ba'i phyir dang / gzhan len pa'i phyir cig car gtong ba dang len par rtog go zhe na /
translated: If you think that the self simultaneously gives up and takes up a foot because it gives up one foot and takes up another,

original: de lta yin na rkang ba gnyis bzhin du bdag kyang gnyis nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na rkang ba gnyis bzhin du bdag kyang gnyis nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then just as there are two feet, the self also would be twofold.

original: cha shas kyis snga ma la gnas pa'i phyir dang / cha shas kyis phyi ma la gnas pa'i phyir cha shas du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha shas kyis snga ma la gnas pa'i phyir dang / cha shas kyis phyi ma la gnas pa'i phyir cha shas du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it would be based in part on the former and in part on the latter, it would follow that it would be manifold.

original: de'i phyir cig car yang gtong ba dang len pa yod pa ma yin pas 'di ni lan ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir cig car yang gtong ba dang len pa yod pa ma yin pas 'di ni lan ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since there is no simultaneous giving up and taking up, this is not a proper response.

original: de'i phyir srid pa bar ma do len pa la yang nyes pa de nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas rnam pa thams cad du bdag la yang 'khor ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa bar ma do len pa la yang nyes pa de nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas rnam pa thams cad du bdag la yang 'khor ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the same error would apply to the taking up of an intermediate existence. Thus, in every way, the self does not cycle.

original: gang gi tshe 'du byed dag dang bdag 'khor ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe 'khor ba med pa nyid do zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'du byed dag dang bdag 'khor ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe 'khor ba med pa nyid do zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: When the self does not cycle in the formations, then it is established that there is no cycling.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: 'khor ba ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Cyclic existence exists.

original: 'gal zla yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal zla yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its opposite exists.

original: 'dir gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni 'gal zla yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni 'gal zla yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which does not exist does not have an opposite,

original: dper na / mo gsham gyi bu'i dgra bo bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / mo gsham gyi bu'i dgra bo bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, the enemy of the barren woman’s son.

original: 'khor ba'i 'gal zla mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod na 'khor ba yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'gal zla mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod na 'khor ba yod par 'gyur /
translated: If nirvana, the opposite of cyclic existence, exists, then cyclic existence would exist.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba yang yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba yang yod do //
translated: Therefore, cyclic existence also exists.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te de'i 'gal zla mya ngan las 'das pa yod na /
analyzed: gal te de'i 'gal zla mya ngan las 'das pa yod na /
translated: If its opposite, nirvana, exists,

original: 'khor ba yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'khor ba yod par 'gyur na /
translated: then cyclic existence would exist.

original: yod pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: But it does not exist.🔽It is not tenable in any way

original: 'du byed mya ngan 'da' bar ni /
analyzed: 'du byed mya ngan 'da' bar ni /
translated: That compounded phenomena attain nirvana.

original: ji lta bur yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable in any way

original: sems can mya ngan 'da' bar yang //🔽ji lta bur yang 'thad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can mya ngan 'da' bar yang // ji lta bur yang 'thad mi 'gyur //
translated: That sentient beings attain nirvana.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba cung zad cig yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba cung zad cig yod na ni /
translated: If something called “nirvana” existed,

original: de rtog pa na 'du byed rtag pa'am mi rtag pa dag cig la rtog grang /
analyzed: de rtog pa na 'du byed rtag pa'am mi rtag pa dag cig la rtog grang /
translated: when it is analyzed, it would be analyzed as either permanent compounded phenomena or impermanent compounded phenomena.

original: de la rtag pa 'gyur ba med pa dag la ni mya ngan las 'da' bas ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la rtag pa 'gyur ba med pa dag la ni mya ngan las 'da' bas ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
translated: What would nirvana do for those who are permanent and unchanging?

original: mi rtag pa yod pa ma yin pa rnams la yang mya ngan las 'das pas ci zhig byed de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yod pa ma yin pa rnams la yang mya ngan las 'das pas ci zhig byed de /
translated: What would nirvana do for those who are impermanent and nonexistent?

original: thams cad snga ma dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: thams cad snga ma dang mtshungs so //
translated: Everything is the same as before.

original: ji lta bur yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In no way whatsoever means in no way at all.

original: ci ste sems can la mya ngan las 'da' ba rtog go zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste sems can la mya ngan las 'da' ba rtog go zhe na /
translated: But if you imagine that nirvana belongs to sentient beings,

original: de yang snga ma ltar rtag pa'am mi rtag pa las 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang snga ma ltar rtag pa'am mi rtag pa las 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is not tenable that nirvana belongs to either a permanent or an impermanent sentient being, as before.

original: ci ste rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med pa zhig la rtog go zhe na de lta na ni brjod du med pa'i phyir 'khor ba ltar mya ngan las 'das pa na yang bdag yod do zhes khas blangs par gyur pa @97a * //
analyzed: ci ste rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med pa zhig la rtog go zhe na de lta na ni brjod du med pa'i phyir 'khor ba ltar mya ngan las 'das pa na yang bdag yod do zhes khas blangs par gyur pa @97a * //
translated: But if you imagine that nirvana is inexpressible as either permanent or impermanent, then, just as in cyclic existence, you would have to accept that the self exists in nirvana because of inexpressibility.

original: ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma yin nam /
translated: How could that be?

original: gzhan yang brjod du med pa ni bdag nye bar len pa dang bcas pa kho na la rigs na /
analyzed: gzhan yang brjod du med pa ni bdag nye bar len pa dang bcas pa kho na la rigs na /
translated: Moreover, if the inexpressible self is only associated with appropriation,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa na ni nye bar len pa yod pa ma yin pas 'di la brjod du med pa nyid ga la yod /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa na ni nye bar len pa yod pa ma yin pas 'di la brjod du med pa nyid ga la yod /
translated: then since appropriation does not exist in nirvana, how could it exist there?

original: yang na bdag de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: yang na bdag de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med par 'gyur mod /
translated: Or, the self would be inexpressible as the same or different.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa yod dam 'on te med pa zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa yod dam 'on te med pa zhig yin /
translated: But is nirvana existent or nonexistent?

original: gal te yod na ni de'i tshe thar bar gyur pa na yang de yod pas rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na ni de'i tshe thar bar gyur pa na yang de yod pas rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it exists, then even when one attains liberation, it would exist, and so the self would be permanent.

original: 'on te med na ni de'i tshe bdag mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te med na ni de'i tshe bdag mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it does not exist, then the self would be impermanent.

original: de'i phyir bdag de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med pa ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod du med do zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med pa ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod du med do zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as the self is inexpressible as the same or different, it would not be inexpressible as permanent or impermanent.

original: ci ste mya ngan las 'das pa na bdag yod pa dang med pa nyid du yang brjod du med par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste mya ngan las 'das pa na bdag yod pa dang med pa nyid du yang brjod du med par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: But if you maintain that the self is inexpressible in terms of existence and nonexistence in nirvana,

original: de lta na yang ci 'di de'i tshe shes par bya ba zhig yin nam /🔽'on te ma yin /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci 'di de'i tshe shes par bya ba zhig yin nam / 'on te ma yin /
translated: then at that time, is it an object of cognition or not?

original: gal te shes par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is an object of cognition,

original: 'on te 'khor ba ltar mya ngan las 'das pa na yang shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag 'di nye bar len pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'khor ba ltar mya ngan las 'das pa na yang shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag 'di nye bar len pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: then just as in cyclic existence, the self would not be without appropriation in nirvana because it is an object of cognition.

original: 'on te mi shes na ni de'i tshe 'di shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te mi shes na ni de'i tshe 'di shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if it is not an object of cognition, then at that time it would not exist because it would not be an object of cognition by nature.

original: nam mkha'i me tog ltar med pas 'di brjod du med pa nyid du ga la yod //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ltar med pas 'di brjod du med pa nyid du ga la yod //
translated: Like a flower in the sky, how could it be inexpressible?

original: de'i phyir de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, in this way, nirvana does not exist.

original: de med pas 'khor ba yang med do //
analyzed: de med pas 'khor ba yang med do //
translated: And because it does not exist, cyclic existence also does not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma las /
translated: For this reason, the Mother of Conquerors says:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor mya ngan las 'das pa yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor mya ngan las 'das pa yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o //
translated: Venerable Subhūti, even nirvāṇa is like an illusion, like a dream.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, even the qualities of a buddha are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: rigs kyi bu gal te mya ngan las 'das pa las ches lhag pa'i chos gzhan zhig yod na yang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gal te mya ngan las 'das pa las ches lhag pa'i chos gzhan zhig yod na yang /
translated: Son of noble family, if there were any other phenomenon superior to nirvāṇa,🔽I would say that is also like an illusion, like a dream.

original: de yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o zhes nga smra'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las kyang /
analyzed: de yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o zhes nga smra'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the noble Sūtra of the King of Meditations says,🔽The ultimate truth is like a dream, and nirvāṇa is the same as a dream.

original: don dam bden pa rmi lam 'dra ba dang / mya ngan 'das pa rmi lam mtshungs par 'jug / gang gis mkhas pa de ltar 'jug pa yang //
analyzed: don dam bden pa rmi lam 'dra ba dang / mya ngan 'das pa rmi lam mtshungs par 'jug / gang gis mkhas pa de ltar 'jug pa yang //
translated: The wise who enter in this way

original: de ni yid kyi sdom pa'i mchog tu brjod /
analyzed: de ni yid kyi sdom pa'i mchog tu brjod /
translated: are said to have the supreme mental vow.

original: ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And,

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa rmi lam ji bzhin te //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa rmi lam ji bzhin te //
translated: The truth of cessation is like a dream.

original: mya ngan 'das pa'ang rmi lam ji bzhin du //🔽gang la byang chub sems dpa' @97b gang 'jug pa /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'ang rmi lam ji bzhin du // gang la byang chub sems dpa' @97b gang 'jug pa /
translated: Nirvana is also like a dream.🔽The vow of speech is said to be

original: de ni ngag gi sdom pa de zhes bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni ngag gi sdom pa de zhes bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: That into which the bodhisattva enters.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say:

original: gal te yang khyod kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis bkag mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang khyod kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis bkag mod kyi /
translated: Although you have refuted both cyclic existence and nirvana,

original: de lta na yang bcings pa dang thar pa dag ni yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang bcings pa dang thar pa dag ni yod pa yin no //
translated: still bondage and liberation exist.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin la ni bcings pa dang / thar pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin la ni bcings pa dang / thar pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For a non-existent entity does not have bondage and liberation.

original: de'i phyir bcings pa dang thar pa yod pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcings pa dang thar pa yod pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since bondage and liberation exist, the essence of things exists.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te bcings pa dang thar pa gnyis nyid yod na dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod par 'gyur na yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te bcings pa dang thar pa gnyis nyid yod na dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod par 'gyur na yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If bondage and liberation existed, then the essence of things would exist. But they do not exist.

original: zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: skye 'jig chos can 'du byed rnams //
analyzed: skye 'jig chos can 'du byed rnams //
translated: Compounded phenomena have the property of arising and ceasing.

original: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur te //
translated: Neither is there bondage nor is there freedom.

original: snga ma bzhin du sems can yang //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sems can yang //
translated: And likewise, sentient beings

original: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Neither are bound nor are freed.

original: 'di na 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gang dag bcing bar bya ba rnams rang dbang med par byed pas 'ching pa'o zhes bya bar bsnyad cing /
analyzed: 'di na 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gang dag bcing bar bya ba rnams rang dbang med par byed pas 'ching pa'o zhes bya bar bsnyad cing /
translated: Here, afflictions such as attachment are called “bondage” because they render those to be bound powerless.

original: gang dag gis bcings pas so so'i skye bo rnams khams gsum las mi 'da'o zhes bya bar rnam par 'jog na /
analyzed: gang dag gis bcings pas so so'i skye bo rnams khams gsum las mi 'da'o zhes bya bar rnam par 'jog na /
translated: And it is posited that because of them, ordinary beings do not transcend the three realms.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'ching ba nyid du brtags pa'i bcings pa de ni re zhig skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can 'du byed skad cig ma rnams la mi srid de /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'ching ba nyid du brtags pa'i bcings pa de ni re zhig skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can 'du byed skad cig ma rnams la mi srid de /
translated: First, bondage that is imputed as the bondage of afflictions such as attachment is impossible in the case of momentary formations that arise and disintegrate.

original: skyes ma thag tu 'jig cing brlag pa rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu 'jig cing brlag pa rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because those that arise and disintegrate and are destroyed immediately upon arising do not exist.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba rnam par chad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi thar pa yang mi srid de /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba rnam par chad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi thar pa yang mi srid de /
translated: Also, freedom, which is characterized by the severance of the bondage of afflictions such as attachment, is impossible.

original: 'du byed mi rtag pa rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed mi rtag pa rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because compounded phenomena, which are impermanent, do not exist.

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As before means in the manner explained above.

original: ji ltar sngar bshad pa'i rnam pas 'du byed rnams la bcings pa dang thar pa dag yod pa ma yin pa de ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar sngar bshad pa'i rnam pas 'du byed rnams la bcings pa dang thar pa dag yod pa ma yin pa de ltar /
translated: Just as bondage and liberation do not exist in relation to compounded phenomena in the manner explained above,

original: snga ma bzhin du sems can yang mi 'ching zhing grol bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sems can yang mi 'ching zhing grol bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: so too, as before, sentient beings are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de ltar na bcings pa dang thar pa yang med do //
analyzed: de ltar na bcings pa dang thar pa yang med do //
translated: Thus, bondage and liberation do not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te yang 'du byed dag dang sems can la bcings pa yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa nye bar len pa zhes bya ba 'ching bar gyur pa ni yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te yang 'du byed dag dang sems can la bcings pa yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa nye bar len pa zhes bya ba 'ching bar gyur pa ni yod pa yin la /
translated: “Even though bondage does not exist in relation to compounded phenomena and sentient beings, that which is called the appropriated, such as attachment, and so on, does exist as that which binds.

original: de yod pas bcings ba yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod pas bcings ba yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that exists, bondage also exists.”

original: brjod pa / gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig 'ching na ni /
analyzed: brjod pa / gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig 'ching na ni /
translated: We reply: If some thing were bound,

original: nye bar len pa 'ching bar yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'ching bar yang 'gyur na /
translated: then the appropriated would also be bondage.

original: 'ching ba yang ma @98a * //
analyzed: 'ching ba yang ma @98a * //
translated: Nor is he bound.

original: yin no // ji ltar mi 'ching ba de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: yin no // ji ltar mi 'ching ba de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that he is not bound, it is said:

original: gal te nye bar len 'ching na //🔽nye bar len bcas 'ching mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te nye bar len 'ching na // nye bar len bcas 'ching mi 'gyur //
translated: If he were bound, then he who has appropriation🔽would not be bound.

original: nye bar len med mi 'ching ste //
analyzed: nye bar len med mi 'ching ste //
translated: He who is without appropriation is not bound.

original: gnas skabs gang zhig 'ching bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnas skabs gang zhig 'ching bar 'gyur //
translated: In what condition would he be bound?

original: de la nye bar len bcas ni nye bar len pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: de la nye bar len bcas ni nye bar len pa yod pa ste /
translated: Therein, he who has appropriation has appropriation.

original: re zhig dngos po de ni 'ching bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re zhig dngos po de ni 'ching bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: First, that entity is not bound.

original: gang zhig nye bar len pa dang bcas pa de ni bcings par gyur pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig nye bar len pa dang bcas pa de ni bcings par gyur pa nyid yin na /
translated: If he who has appropriation is bound,

original: de la yang 'ching ba dang 'brel bas ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la yang 'ching ba dang 'brel bas ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
translated: then what would bondage do for him, since he is already bound?

original: gang zhig nye bar len pa med pa nye bar len pa dang bral ba de yang mi 'ching ste /
analyzed: gang zhig nye bar len pa med pa nye bar len pa dang bral ba de yang mi 'ching ste /
translated: He who is without appropriation, who is free from appropriation, is also not bound.

original: 'ching pa dang bral ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'ching pa dang bral ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because he is free from bondage, like the Tathāgata.

original: nye bar len pa med pa 'ching ba dang bral ba 'ching ngo zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir yang 'di mi rigs so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa 'ching ba dang bral ba 'ching ngo zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir yang 'di mi rigs so //
translated: It is also illogical to say that one who is unfettered by appropriation is bound, because that is mutually contradictory.

original: gang zhig de ltar nges par brtags pa na nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'am nye bar len pa dang bral ba yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar nges par brtags pa na nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'am nye bar len pa dang bral ba yin yang rung ste /
translated: When one is examined in this way, whether one is fettered or unfettered by appropriation,

original: mi 'ching ba de ni da gnas skabs gang zhig tu gyur pa zhig 'ching bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'ching ba de ni da gnas skabs gang zhig tu gyur pa zhig 'ching bar 'gyur te /
translated: what state of being fettered could there be?

original: gang zhig 'ching bar 'gyur ba de'i gnas skabs gzhan de ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'ching bar 'gyur ba de'i gnas skabs gzhan de ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that there is no other state of being fettered for one who is not fettered.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar gzhigs pa na 'ching bas ci zhig ltar yang 'ching bar mi byed pa de'i tshe 'ga' yang 'ching bar mi byed pa nye bar len pa 'dod chags la sogs pa 'ching ba nyid du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar gzhigs pa na 'ching bas ci zhig ltar yang 'ching bar mi byed pa de'i tshe 'ga' yang 'ching bar mi byed pa nye bar len pa 'dod chags la sogs pa 'ching ba nyid du ga la 'gyur /
translated: When one is examined in this way, since one is not bound in any way by that which is a fetter, then how could appropriation, such as attachment, which does not bind anyone, be a fetter?

original: de'i phyir bcings pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcings pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, one who is bound does not exist.

original: gzhan yang / gal te bcing bya'i snga rol na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te bcing bya'i snga rol na //
translated: If prior to being bound🔽The bound one exists, then he would be bound by the bond.

original: 'ching ba yod na 'ching la rag / de yang med de /🔽'di na 'ching ba lcags la sogs pa bcing bar bya ba las tha dad par lngar grub par gyur pas bcing bar bya ba lha sbyin 'ching ngo zhes bya bar mthong ba de bzhin du bcing bar bya ba 'du byed rnams sam gang zag gi snga rol du
analyzed: 'ching ba yod na 'ching la rag / de yang med de / 'di na 'ching ba lcags la sogs pa bcing bar bya ba las tha dad par lngar grub par gyur pas bcing bar bya ba lha sbyin 'ching ngo zhes bya bar mthong ba de bzhin du bcing bar bya ba 'du byed rnams sam gang zag gi snga rol du
translated: But that does not exist.🔽Here, since the bond, such as a rope, is established as different from the bound one, it is seen that the bound one, Devadatta, is bound.

original: 'ching ba 'dod chags la sogs pa grub par gyur na ni sngar grub pa des 'du byed rnams sa ma gang zag 'ching bar 'gyur la rag na /
analyzed: 'ching ba 'dod chags la sogs pa grub par gyur na ni sngar grub pa des 'du byed rnams sa ma gang zag 'ching bar 'gyur la rag na /
translated: In the same way, if prior to the bound one, such as the formations or the person, the bond, such as attachment, were established, then the one who is already established would be bound by the bond.

original: de ni yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But that does not exist.

original: rten med pas 'dod chags la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / sngar 'ching ba grub pa la phyis bcing bya dang lhan cig 'brel pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'ching ba las tha dad par grub pa'i bcings pa la yang 'ching ba dgos pa med pa'i phyir bcing @98b bar bya ba'i snga rol du 'ching pa grub pa med do //
analyzed: rten med pas 'dod chags la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / sngar 'ching ba grub pa la phyis bcing bya dang lhan cig 'brel pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'ching ba las tha dad par grub pa'i bcings pa la yang 'ching ba dgos pa med pa'i phyir bcing @98b bar bya ba'i snga rol du 'ching pa grub pa med do //
translated: Because attachment and so on are not established due to the absence of a basis, and because there is no need for a prior establishment of bondage followed by a later connection with that which is bound, and because bondage is not established as distinct from that which is bound, and because there is no need for bondage, therefore bondage does not exist prior to that which is bound.

original: de'i phyir 'ching bas ni 'ga' yang mi 'ching la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'ching bas ni 'ga' yang mi 'ching la /
translated: Therefore bondage does not bind anyone at all.

original: 'ga' yang mi 'ching ba ni 'ching ba nyid du mi rigs pas 'ching ba yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'ga' yang mi 'ching ba ni 'ching ba nyid du mi rigs pas 'ching ba yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: And since it is not tenable that that which does not bind anyone at all is bondage, bondage does not exist.

original: 'ching pa med pas bcings pa yang med do zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: 'ching pa med pas bcings pa yang med do zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: And because there is no bondage, that which is bound also does not exist.

original: gang zhig 'dir sun 'byin pa 'phrog gyur pa /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir sun 'byin pa 'phrog gyur pa /
translated: That which is refuted here is the opponent’s position.

original: lhag ma ni tshigs su bcad pa'i 'don pa go bsnor te /
analyzed: lhag ma ni tshigs su bcad pa'i 'don pa go bsnor te /
translated: The remainder of the verse is rearranged.

original: song dang ma song bgom pas bstan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: song dang ma song bgom pas bstan par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that it is taught by “gone,” “not gone,” and “that being gone over.”

original: re zhig bcings pa mi 'ching ste //
analyzed: re zhig bcings pa mi 'ching ste //
translated: First, that which is bound does not bind.

original: ma bcings pa yang 'ching mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ma bcings pa yang 'ching mi 'gyur //
translated: That which is not bound is not liberated.

original: bcings dang ma bcings ma gtogs par //
analyzed: bcings dang ma bcings ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the bound and the unbound,

original: 'ching bzhin shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ching bzhin shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no one who is bound.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to the bound.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gal te khyod kyis 'ching ba bkag mod kyi //🔽de lta na yang de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje chen po mnga' ba rnams kyis sems can 'khor ba'i btson rar bsdams pa skyob pa med pa rnams la tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can phung po gsum nye bar bstan pa gang
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis 'ching ba bkag mod kyi // de lta na yang de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje chen po mnga' ba rnams kyis sems can 'khor ba'i btson rar bsdams pa skyob pa med pa rnams la tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can phung po gsum nye bar bstan pa gang
translated: Although you have refuted bondage,

original: gi don du gsungs pa /🔽thar pa de ni re zhig yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gi don du gsungs pa / thar pa de ni re zhig yod pa yin la /
translated: nevertheless, the Tathāgatas, who possess great compassion, have taught the three trainings, which have the nature of moral discipline, meditative stabilization, and wisdom, for the sake of sentient beings who are imprisoned in the prison of cyclic existence and who have no protector.🔽Liberation exists.

original: ma bcings pa la ni thar pa med de /
analyzed: ma bcings pa la ni thar pa med de /
translated: There is no liberation for that which is not bound.

original: de'i phyir bcings pa yang yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcings pa yang yod do //
translated: Therefore, bondage also exists.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te thar pa nyid yod na bcing ba yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te thar pa nyid yod na bcing ba yod par gyur na /
translated: If liberation existed, then bondage would exist.

original: yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it does not exist.

original: 'dir thar pa 'di rtog pa na /
analyzed: 'dir thar pa 'di rtog pa na /
translated: When you imagine liberation,

original: bcings pa'am ma bcings pa zhig la rtog pa zhig go //
analyzed: bcings pa'am ma bcings pa zhig la rtog pa zhig go //
translated: It is a thought that a bound one is liberated or a non-bound one is liberated.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the consequence of that?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi rigs so zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi rigs so zhes bshad pa /
translated: It is explained that both are illogical:

original: re zhig bcings pa mi grol te //
analyzed: re zhig bcings pa mi grol te //
translated: First, a bound one is not liberated.

original: ma bcings pa yang grol mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ma bcings pa yang grol mi 'gyur //
translated: Also, a non-bound one is not liberated.

original: bcings pa grol bzhin yin 'gyur na //
analyzed: bcings pa grol bzhin yin 'gyur na //
translated: If a bound one were to be liberated,

original: bcings dang grol ba dus gcig 'gyur //
analyzed: bcings dang grol ba dus gcig 'gyur //
translated: then bondage and liberation would be simultaneous.

original: de la bcings pa la ni thar pa yod pa ma yin te bcings pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bcings pa la ni thar pa yod pa ma yin te bcings pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that regard, liberation does not exist for a bound one because of being bound.

original: ci ste bcings par gyur pa phyis thabs kyis thar par 'gyur ba'i phyir bcings pa nyid grol bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste bcings par gyur pa phyis thabs kyis thar par 'gyur ba'i phyir bcings pa nyid grol bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that a bound one later becomes liberated through a method, then a bound one would be liberated.

original: 'o na ni bcings pa grol lo zhes bya bar brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni bcings pa grol lo zhes bya bar brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: But in that case, it should not be said that a bound one is liberated.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: 'gro ba grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be said that a goer is liberated.

original: gal te da ltar ba dang nye bas de skad du brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te da ltar ba dang nye bas de skad du brjod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that way because it is related to the present,

original: gal te res 'ga' zhig na thar pa yod na ni de'i tshe de dang nye bar yod par 'gyur na /🔽gang gi tshe gnas skabs gang rung du yang thar 'dod pa na bcings pa la thar pa mi srid pas thar pa med par @99a * //
analyzed: gal te res 'ga' zhig na thar pa yod na ni de'i tshe de dang nye bar yod par 'gyur na / gang gi tshe gnas skabs gang rung du yang thar 'dod pa na bcings pa la thar pa mi srid pas thar pa med par @99a * //
translated: If liberation existed sometimes, then at that time it would exist in proximity.

original: ston par 'dod pa de'i tshe da ltar ba dang nye ba nyid ga la yod /
analyzed: ston par 'dod pa de'i tshe da ltar ba dang nye ba nyid ga la yod /
translated: But when liberation is not possible for one who is bound at any time, then at that time, how could liberation exist in the present or in proximity?

original: de ltar na re zhig bcings pa mi grol lo zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig bcings pa mi grol lo zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Thus, first, one who is bound is not liberated.

original: da ni ma bcings pa yang grol bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ni ma bcings pa yang grol bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Now, one who is not bound is also not liberated.

original: de ni grol ba nyid yin na de la yang thar pas ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni grol ba nyid yin na de la yang thar pas ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
translated: If he were liberated, then what would liberation do for him?

original: yang thar pa la ltos pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa grol bar gyur pa rnams la yang 'ching pa nyid yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang thar pa la ltos pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa grol bar gyur pa rnams la yang 'ching pa nyid yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, because liberation would depend on him, then even the arhat who has become liberated would have bondage.

original: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa yang bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa yang bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the arhat would also be bound.

original: de'i phyir ma bcings pa yang mi grol lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma bcings pa yang mi grol lo //
translated: Therefore, one who is not bound is also not liberated.

original: ci ste ma bcings pa la thar pa mi srid pa'i phyir bcings pa nyid grol bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste ma bcings pa la thar pa mi srid pa'i phyir bcings pa nyid grol bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that since it is impossible for one who is not bound to be liberated, therefore one who is bound is liberated,

original: de lta yin na bcings pa la grol bzhin par rtog pa na /
analyzed: de lta yin na bcings pa la grol bzhin par rtog pa na /
translated: then in that case, when one who is bound is conceived to be liberated,

original: bcings pa yin pa'i phyir dang / grol bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir bcings pa dang grol ba dag dus gcig tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: bcings pa yin pa'i phyir dang / grol bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir bcings pa dang grol ba dag dus gcig tu 'gyur na /
translated: because he is bound and because he is liberated, then bondage and liberation would occur simultaneously.

original: dus gcig tu bcings pa dang grol ba dag 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dus gcig tu bcings pa dang grol ba dag 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not tenable that bondage and liberation occur simultaneously.

original: phan tshun 'gal pa'i phyir snang ba dang mun pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal pa'i phyir snang ba dang mun pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they are mutually exclusive, like light and darkness.

original: de'i phyir de ltar bcings pa dang ma bcings pa dag la thar pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bcings pa dang ma bcings pa dag la thar pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, liberation does not exist for one who is bound or for one who is not bound.

original: de'i phyir thar pa yang med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir thar pa yang med la /
translated: Therefore, liberation does not exist.

original: de med pa'i phyir bcings pa yang med do zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir bcings pa yang med do zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: And because it does not exist, bondage also does not exist.

original: 'dir gal te de ltar khyod kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag bkag cing /
analyzed: 'dir gal te de ltar khyod kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag bkag cing /
translated: In this regard, if you refute cyclic existence and nirvana in this way,

original: bcings pa dang thar pa dag kyang bkag pas /
analyzed: bcings pa dang thar pa dag kyang bkag pas /
translated: and you also refute bondage and liberation,🔽then you are a nihilist.

original: 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa chen po ma rig pa'i mun pa mthug po can lta ba ngan pa sna tshogs pa'i 'khri shing shin tu sra bas lam dam par bkag pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa chen po ma rig pa'i mun pa mthug po can lta ba ngan pa sna tshogs pa'i 'khri shing shin tu sra bas lam dam par bkag pa /
translated: It is a great wilderness of cyclic existence, with the thick darkness of ignorance, blocked by the dense vines of various bad views,

original: phra rgyas kyi dug gi ljon shing rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal /
analyzed: phra rgyas kyi dug gi ljon shing rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal /
translated: and filled with the trees of the poisons of the latent potentialities, which yield the fruits of the sufferings of birth and so forth.

original: mtha' yas pa sna tshogs pa shin tu yid du mi 'ong ba rgya cher ster bas dkrigs pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri chen po rtse mo nyi shus ches mtho ba /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa sna tshogs pa shin tu yid du mi 'ong ba rgya cher ster bas dkrigs pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri chen po rtse mo nyi shus ches mtho ba /
translated: It is filled with the great mountain of the view of the transitory collection, which is very high with its twenty peaks,

original: te bor brling bas phyogs kyi ngos kun nas bskor ba /🔽sred pa'i chu klung gi 'obs chen po //
analyzed: te bor brling bas phyogs kyi ngos kun nas bskor ba / sred pa'i chu klung gi 'obs chen po //
translated: and is surrounded on all sides by the steep slopes of the mountain.🔽It is surrounded by the great moat of the river of craving,

original: yul gyi bde ba la re ba'i dogs shin tu 'dred cing yangs pa dang ldan pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'bab pas bskor ba las brgal bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: yul gyi bde ba la re ba'i dogs shin tu 'dred cing yangs pa dang ldan pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'bab pas bskor ba las brgal bar 'dod pa /
translated: which is very slippery and wide with the hope for the happiness of objects, and which flows without interruption.

original: thar pa 'dod pa rnams mchog tu dbugs 'byin par byed pa dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa chen po bdag na ma len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa rnams mchog tu dbugs 'byin par byed pa dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa chen po bdag na ma len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
translated: Those who desire liberation will be greatly disappointed, and their great aspiration for virtue will be meaningless, and they will not attain nirvana.🔽When will we attain nirvana?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa bdag gir nam zhig na 'gyur snyam pa gang @99b yin pa de don med pa kho nar 'gyur zhing de ltar dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa bskyed pa rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa dang bsam pa dang /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa bdag gir nam zhig na 'gyur snyam pa gang @99b yin pa de don med pa kho nar 'gyur zhing de ltar dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa bskyed pa rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa dang bsam pa dang /
translated: Those who generate the aspiration for virtue in this way will have no need to rely on a spiritual master, and the stages of generosity, ethics, learning, reflection,

original: bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim pa mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i dgos pa can gang yin pa de yang don med par 'gyur ro zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim pa mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i dgos pa can gang yin pa de yang don med par 'gyur ro zhes 'dzer to //
translated: and meditation and so on, which are necessary for attaining nirvana, will be meaningless.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond as follows:

original: gang zhig de ltar dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med de /
translated: You say that all things are essenceless.

original: gzugs brnyan dang / smig rgyu'i chu dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / mig 'phrul dang mtshungs shing /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang / smig rgyu'i chu dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / mig 'phrul dang mtshungs shing /
translated: They are like a reflection, a mirage, a circle of fire in the dark, a dream, an illusion, or a magical deception.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba dang bral bzhin du /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba dang bral bzhin du /
translated: They are devoid of a self and what belongs to a self.

original: phyin ci log gi rjes su song ba'i phyir nga dang nga'i zhes bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa kun du spyod pa yongs su 'dzin pas /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rjes su song ba'i phyir nga dang nga'i zhes bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa kun du spyod pa yongs su 'dzin pas /
translated: However, because of their pursuit of error, they are attached to the notion of “I” and “mine” and to the belief in a self and what belongs to a self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid bskyod nas /🔽bdag ni len med mya ngan 'da' //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid bskyod nas / bdag ni len med mya ngan 'da' //
translated: This belief in a self is the cause of the view of the transitory collection.🔽“I will attain nirvana without appropriation.

original: myang 'das bdag gir 'gyur ro zhes //🔽rlom par byed de /
analyzed: myang 'das bdag gir 'gyur ro zhes // rlom par byed de /
translated: Nirvana will be mine.”🔽They are conceited in this way.

original: de ltar gang dag 'dzin de yi //
analyzed: de ltar gang dag 'dzin de yi //
translated: Those who hold such a view

original: nyer len 'dzin pa chen po yin //
analyzed: nyer len 'dzin pa chen po yin //
translated: are greatly attached to appropriation.

original: bdag ni nye bar len pa med cing len pa dang bral bar mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: bdag ni nye bar len pa med cing len pa dang bral bar mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: “I will attain nirvana without appropriation and free from appropriation.”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni de ltar zhugs par gyur pa bdag gi yin par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar thar pa 'dod pa gang dag 'dzin par 'gyur ba de dag la ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni de ltar zhugs par gyur pa bdag gi yin par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar thar pa 'dod pa gang dag 'dzin par 'gyur ba de dag la ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta
translated: are attached to the view of the perishing aggregates,

original: ba nye bar len pa de nyid 'dzin pa chen po yin la /
analyzed: ba nye bar len pa de nyid 'dzin pa chen po yin la /
translated: which is called “the great attachment to self and mine.”🔽For those who are attached to such a great attachment,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'dzin pa chen po mngon par zhen pa rnams la ni zhi ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'dzin pa chen po mngon par zhen pa rnams la ni zhi ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: there is no peace,

original: 'dzin pa ma lus pa spangs pa kho nas thar pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ma lus pa spangs pa kho nas thar pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because liberation is attained only through the complete abandonment of attachment.

original: ji srid du bdag dang bdag gi'o snyam du 'dzin par mthong bar zhen pa dang / ji srid mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yod do zhes mngon par zhen pa dang / ji srid nye bar len pa btang ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa de srid du ni thabs ma yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyi rtsom pa thams cad nges par don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du bdag dang bdag gi'o snyam du 'dzin par mthong bar zhen pa dang / ji srid mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yod do zhes mngon par zhen pa dang / ji srid nye bar len pa btang ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa de srid du ni thabs ma yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyi rtsom pa thams cad nges par don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as one sees the grasping at “I” and “mine,” the clinging to “nirvana” as something existent, and the clinging to the relinquishment of the appropriated aggregates, and so on, all the endeavors of those who seek nirvana through the wrong means will certainly be pointless.

original: de'i phyir thar pa 'dod pas 'di dag thams cad yongs su gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thar pa 'dod pas 'di dag thams cad yongs su gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who desire liberation should give up all of these.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du don dam pa //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du don dam pa //
translated: Because in every way,

original: gang la mya ngan 'das bskyed med //
analyzed: gang la mya ngan 'das bskyed med //
translated: In it there is no creation of nirvana,

original: 'khor ba bsal ba'ang yod min pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba bsal ba'ang yod min pa //
translated: Nor is there any removal of cyclic existence.

original: zhes bya ba //
analyzed: zhes bya ba //
translated: Thus it is.

original: de la 'khor ba ci @100a * //
analyzed: de la 'khor ba ci @100a * //
translated: What is cyclic existence?

original: zhig yin // mya ngan 'das pa 'ang ci zhig brtag / don dam pa'i bden pa gang la ma dmigs pas mya ngan las 'das pa bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: zhig yin // mya ngan 'das pa 'ang ci zhig brtag / don dam pa'i bden pa gang la ma dmigs pas mya ngan las 'das pa bskyed pa ste /
translated: Since the ultimate truth is not observed, nirvana is not generated.

original: mya ngan las 'das par sgro btags pa med cing /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par sgro btags pa med cing /
translated: Nirvana is not imputed.

original: 'khor ba bsal ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba bsal ba ste /
translated: Samsara is not removed.

original: 'khor ba yongs su zad pa yang yod pa ma yin pa de la gang zhig zad par bya ba'i phyir brtags pa 'khor ba ci zhig yin la /
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su zad pa yang yod pa ma yin pa de la gang zhig zad par bya ba'i phyir brtags pa 'khor ba ci zhig yin la /
translated: Since the complete exhaustion of samsara does not exist, what is samsara that is imputed in order to be exhausted?

original: gang thob par bya ba'i phyir brtags pa mya ngan las 'das pa de yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: gang thob par bya ba'i phyir brtags pa mya ngan las 'das pa de yang gang zhig yin /
translated: What is nirvana that is imputed in order to be attained?🔽Moreover, since neither samsara nor nirvana are observed, no sentient being is brought from samsara to nirvana and is made to enter nirvana.

original: yang na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir sems can 'ga' yang mya ngan las 'das pa gang du 'khor ba nas bsal ba ste bkri ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bskyed par 'bad pa dang ldan pas kyang bya bar mi nus pa de la mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ci zhig brtag ste /
analyzed: yang na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir sems can 'ga' yang mya ngan las 'das pa gang du 'khor ba nas bsal ba ste bkri ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bskyed par 'bad pa dang ldan pas kyang bya bar mi nus pa de la mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ci zhig brtag ste /
translated: Since even one who strives to generate nirvana is not able to do so, what is nirvana that is imputed?

original: cung zad kyang brtag pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: cung zad kyang brtag pa mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to investigate it in the least.

original: mi rtog pa ni nges par ji skad smras pa'i 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa las 'da' zhing /
analyzed: mi rtog pa ni nges par ji skad smras pa'i 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa las 'da' zhing /
translated: The non-conceptual one will certainly transcend the wilderness of cyclic existence as it has been described and

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du yang phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du yang phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: will also arrive at the city of nirvana.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa bdud btul ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa bdud btul ba'i mdo las /
translated: For this very reason, the Subjugation of Mara Sutra says:

original: de nas de'i tshe 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas ji ltar bdud sdig can sgo mo'i them pa'i 'ching bas bcings pa ltar sa steng du 'gyel nas /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas ji ltar bdud sdig can sgo mo'i them pa'i 'ching bas bcings pa ltar sa steng du 'gyel nas /
translated: Then at that time, the youthful Manjushri imagined Mara, the evil one, to be like one bound by the bonds of the threshold of a door, fallen on the ground,🔽crying and lamenting, “I am bound by tight bonds!

original: nga ni 'ching pa dam pos bcings so //🔽nga ni 'ching ba dam pos bcings so zhes du zhing cho nges 'debs par gyur pa de lta bu'i gzugs su bsams so //
analyzed: nga ni 'ching pa dam pos bcings so // nga ni 'ching ba dam pos bcings so zhes du zhing cho nges 'debs par gyur pa de lta bu'i gzugs su bsams so //
translated: I am bound by tight bonds!”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Manjushri said,

original: sdig can gang gis khyod rtag tu bcings shing gzod bcings pa ma yin pa 'ching ba ches dam pa /
analyzed: sdig can gang gis khyod rtag tu bcings shing gzod bcings pa ma yin pa 'ching ba ches dam pa /
translated: “Evil one, by what are you always bound and not just now? By what are you bound by tight bonds?

original: 'ching ba 'di las gzhan pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: 'ching ba 'di las gzhan pa zhig yod de /
translated: Is there a bond tighter than this?

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: And what is it?”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:🔽the fetter of pride and the fetter of false views,

original: nga rgyal phyin ci log gi 'ching ba dang / srid pa dang lta ba'i 'ching ba ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal phyin ci log gi 'ching ba dang / srid pa dang lta ba'i 'ching ba ste /
translated: and the fetter of existence.

original: sdig can 'di ni 'ching ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sdig can 'di ni 'ching ba yin gyi /
translated: Evil One, these are your fetters.

original: 'ching ba 'di las gzhan ba 'ching ba ches dam por gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ching ba 'di las gzhan ba 'ching ba ches dam por gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other fetter that is more binding than these.

original: khyod ni des rtag tu bcings pa yin gyis gzod bcings pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod ni des rtag tu bcings pa yin gyis gzod bcings pa ni ma yin no //
translated: You have always been bound by them, and not just now.

original: gzhan yang sdig can mi khyod gal te slar bkrol na dga' bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gzhan yang sdig can mi khyod gal te slar bkrol na dga' bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Moreover, Evil One, if you were to be released, would you be happy?
