original: smras pa dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He said, “I would be happy.”

original: de nas lha'i bu rab 'thab bral pa zhig gis /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu rab 'thab bral pa zhig gis /
translated: Then a son of a god from the Heaven Free of Strife

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to Mañjuśrī, the youthful one:

original: 'jam dpal bdud sdig can thong shig @100b rang gi gnas su dong la rag go //
analyzed: 'jam dpal bdud sdig can thong shig @100b rang gi gnas su dong la rag go //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, let go of the evil Māra, so that he can return to his own place.”

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bdud sdig to can la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bdud sdig to can la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, said this to the evil Māra:

original: sdig can gang zhig btang ba khyod sus bcings /
analyzed: sdig can gang zhig btang ba khyod sus bcings /
translated: “Evil One, who is it that has released you? Who bound you?

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal bdag sus bcings pa mi shes so /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal bdag sus bcings pa mi shes so /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, I do not know who has bound me.”

original: smras pa / sdig can ji ltar khyod ma bcings pa las bcings par 'du shes pa de bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa /
analyzed: smras pa / sdig can ji ltar khyod ma bcings pa las bcings par 'du shes pa de bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said, “Pāpīyān, just as you, though not bound, think you are bound, so all foolish ordinary beings, in what is impermanent, think there is permanence;

original: sdug bsngal ba la bde bar 'du shes pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bde bar 'du shes pa /
translated: in what is suffering, think there is happiness;

original: bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa /
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa /
translated: in what is not a self, think there is a self;

original: mi gtsang pa la gcang bar 'du shes pa /
analyzed: mi gtsang pa la gcang bar 'du shes pa /
translated: in what is impure, think there is purity;

original: gzugs med pa la gzugs su 'du shes pa /🔽tshor ba dag med pa dang / 'du shes dag med pa dang / 'du byed dag med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la gzugs su 'du shes pa / tshor ba dag med pa dang / 'du shes dag med pa dang / 'du byed dag med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa la /
translated: in what is formless, think there are forms;🔽in what is not feeling, think there is feeling; in what is not perception, think there is perception; in what is not formation, think there is formation; in what is not consciousness, think there is consciousness.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes par 'du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes par 'du shes pa yin no //
translated: In what is not feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, they think there is feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: gzhan yang sdig can gang khyod grol bar 'gyur na gang las grol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang sdig can gang khyod grol bar 'gyur na gang las grol bar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, Pāpīyān, if you were to be liberated, from what would you be liberated?”

original: smras pa / bdag ni gang las kyang grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / bdag ni gang las kyang grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “I would not be liberated from anything.”

original: smras pa / sdig can de bzhin du gang dag grol bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang /
analyzed: smras pa / sdig can de bzhin du gang dag grol bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang /
translated: Objection: Just so, those who are liberated are also

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de yongs su shes pa ma gtogs par gang las kyang grol bar 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de yongs su shes pa ma gtogs par gang las kyang grol bar 'gyur ba med de /
translated: liberated from nothing other than the complete understanding of the false conception.

original: de yongs su shes nas grol ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de yongs su shes nas grol ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Having completely understood that, they are said to be liberated.

original: lung 'di las na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log tu rtog pa tsam gyis 'ching ba'i 'khri shing rnam par chad pa la thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lung 'di las na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log tu rtog pa tsam gyis 'ching ba'i 'khri shing rnam par chad pa la thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, from this scriptural passage, liberation—nirvāṇa—is the severing of the vines of bondage that are mere false, mistaken conceptions.

original: rmi lam du dmigs pa'i me 'bar ba chu dag gis bsad pa bzhin no //🔽slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: rmi lam du dmigs pa'i me 'bar ba chu dag gis bsad pa bzhin no // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: It is like the extinguishing of a fire that is perceived in a dream by water.🔽This is the commentary on the sixteenth chapter, having sixteen verses, called

original: bcings pa dang thar pa brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: bcings pa dang thar pa brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: “the examination of bondage and freedom.”

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: 'khor ba ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Samsara exists.

original: las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar gal te rgyun rnam par chad pa med pa'i rim pas skye ba dang 'chi ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'jug pas 'du byed rnams sam bdag 'khor bar gyur na ni /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar gal te rgyun rnam par chad pa med pa'i rim pas skye ba dang 'chi ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'jug pas 'du byed rnams sam bdag 'khor bar gyur na ni /
translated: Because it is the support for the connection between karma and its result.

original: de'i tshe las dang 'bras bu 'brel bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe las dang 'bras bu 'brel bar 'gyur na /
translated: In this way, if the continuum of karmic existence is not severed, and the connection between cause and effect is established through the continuity of birth and death, then the connection between karma and its result would exist.

original: ji skad smras pa'i 'khor ba med na ni /🔽sems ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir dang / las 'phen pa'i dus na rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir las dang 'bras bu'i @101a * //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i 'khor ba med na ni / sems ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir dang / las 'phen pa'i dus na rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir las dang 'bras bu'i @101a * //
translated: If cyclic existence did not exist as it was explained,

original: 'brel ba med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the connection between karma and its result would definitely not exist, because the mind is destroyed immediately after it arises and at the time karma is projected, it does not have karmic maturation.

original: 'khor ba yod na ni 'dir byas pa'i las tshe rabs gzhan du yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i phyir las rnams 'bras bu dang 'brel ba mi 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba yod na ni 'dir byas pa'i las tshe rabs gzhan du yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i phyir las rnams 'bras bu dang 'brel ba mi 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If cyclic existence exists, then the connection between karma and its result is not refuted, because the karma committed in this life is connected with the matured result in another life.

original: de'i phyir las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, samsara exists because it is the basis for the connection between action and result.

original: las de dag kyang gang yin zhing /
analyzed: las de dag kyang gang yin zhing /
translated: What are those actions?

original: de'i 'bras bu yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What are their results?

original: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba brjod par 'dod pas 'di skad du brjod do /
analyzed: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba brjod par 'dod pas 'di skad du brjod do /
translated: In order to describe their classification, he says:

original: bdag nyid legs par sdom pa dang // gzhan la phan 'dogs byams sems gang //🔽de chos de ni 'di gzhan du //
analyzed: bdag nyid legs par sdom pa dang // gzhan la phan 'dogs byams sems gang // de chos de ni 'di gzhan du //
translated: Self-restraint, the will to help others, and love

original: 'bras bu dag gi sa bon yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag gi sa bon yin //
translated: are the seeds of the results in this life and the next.

original: de la bdag tu nga rgyal ba 'di la gzhag cing bskyed pas bdag nyid do /
analyzed: de la bdag tu nga rgyal ba 'di la gzhag cing bskyed pas bdag nyid do /
translated: Here, self means that which is established and generated in the pride of self.

original: phung po la brten nas gdags pa'i gang zag la bdag ces bya'o //
analyzed: phung po la brten nas gdags pa'i gang zag la bdag ces bya'o //
translated: The person designated in dependence on the aggregates is called self.🔽Self-restraint is

original: bdag nyid yang dag par sdom zhing //
analyzed: bdag nyid yang dag par sdom zhing //
translated: the restraint of the self.

original: yul dag la rang dbang med par byed cing 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa zlog par byed pas na bdag nyid legs par sdom pa'o //
analyzed: yul dag la rang dbang med par byed cing 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa zlog par byed pas na bdag nyid legs par sdom pa'o //
translated: It is self-restraint because it restrains the self, which is designated in dependence on the aggregates, from engaging in objects without restraint due to the power of attachment and so on.

original: sog cing nye bar sogs la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnam par smin pa 'byin par nus pa la nges par byed pas na sems te /
analyzed: sog cing nye bar sogs la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnam par smin pa 'byin par nus pa la nges par byed pas na sems te /
translated: The mind is so called because it accumulates and determines the wholesome and unwholesome karma that is accumulated and stored.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rnam grangs dag go //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rnam grangs dag go //
translated: Mind, thought, and consciousness are synonyms for that.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid legs par sdom pa srog gcod pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa las bzlog pa dge ba'i sems de ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba las 'dzin par byed pas na chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid legs par sdom pa srog gcod pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa las bzlog pa dge ba'i sems de ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba las 'dzin par byed pas na chos zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the mind that is wholesome, which is the opposite of engaging in killing and so on, is called Dharma because it restrains one from going to miserable realms.

original: chos kyi sgra 'di ni gsung rab las gsum du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sgra 'di ni gsung rab las gsum du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: This term Dharma is established in the scriptures in three ways:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don dang // 'gro ba ngan par 'gro ba las 'dzin pa'i don dang / 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar 'gro ba las 'dzin pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don dang // 'gro ba ngan par 'gro ba las 'dzin pa'i don dang / 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar 'gro ba las 'dzin pa'i don gyis so //
translated: as the meaning of holding one’s own characteristics, the meaning of holding one back from going to miserable realms, and the meaning of holding one back from going to the five transmigrations of cyclic existence.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis na chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis na chos zhes bya'o //
translated: All that is contaminated and uncontaminated is called “Dharma” in the sense of holding one’s own characteristics.

original: dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni /
analyzed: dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni /
translated: The ten virtues and so on are called “Dharma”

original: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol du //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol du //
translated: in the sense of going to good rebirths and the next world.

original: chos spyod pa ni bde bar nyal //
analyzed: chos spyod pa ni bde bar nyal //
translated: One who practices Dharma sleeps happily.

original: zhes bya ba der 'gro ba ngan par 'gro ba las 'dzin pa'i don gyis na chos zhes bsnyad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der 'gro ba ngan par 'gro ba las 'dzin pa'i don gyis na chos zhes bsnyad do //
translated: Here, Dharma is called “that which holds one back” from going to bad rebirths.

original: chos la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba der ni 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar 'gro ba las 'dzin pa'i don gyis na mya ngan las 'das pa la chos zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chos la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba der ni 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar 'gro ba las 'dzin pa'i don gyis na mya ngan las 'das pa la chos zhes brjod do //
translated: In the phrase “I go for refuge to the Dharma,” Dharma is called “that which holds one back” from going to the five transmigrations of cyclic existence.

original: 'dir ni 'gro ba ngan par 'gro ba las 'dzin pa'i don @101b nyid kyis chos kyi sgrar bzhed do //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'gro ba ngan par 'gro ba las 'dzin pa'i don @101b nyid kyis chos kyi sgrar bzhed do //
translated: Here, Dharma is asserted to be the word for “that which holds one back” from going to bad rebirths.

original: yang ci bdag nyid legs par sdom pa'i sems gcig pu zhig chos yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci bdag nyid legs par sdom pa'i sems gcig pu zhig chos yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is the mind that restrains itself alone Dharma?

original: smras pa / ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang byams pa'i sems gang yin pa de yang chos yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang byams pa'i sems gang yin pa de yang chos yin no //
translated: The thought of benefiting others and the thought of loving kindness are also the Dharma.

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs byams sems zhes bya ba 'dir rang gi sgra zhig mi mngon par byas shing bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs byams sems zhes bya ba 'dir rang gi sgra zhig mi mngon par byas shing bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the thought of benefiting others and the thought of loving kindness should be understood as being taught with the word “thought” elided.

original: de la gzhan rjes su 'dzin par byed pas na gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i sems te /
analyzed: de la gzhan rjes su 'dzin par byed pas na gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i sems te /
translated: The thought of benefiting others is the thought of taking care of others.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la zhugs pa dang / 'jigs pa las skyob pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa'i sems gang yin pa de yang chos yin no /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la zhugs pa dang / 'jigs pa las skyob pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa'i sems gang yin pa de yang chos yin no /
translated: The thought of benefiting others is also the Dharma, because it is the thought of engaging in the four principles for attracting a following and the thought of engaging in protecting from fear, etc.

original: 'dza' bshes las 'byung zhing sems can rnams dang 'gal ba med pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni byams pa'i sems so //
analyzed: 'dza' bshes las 'byung zhing sems can rnams dang 'gal ba med pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni byams pa'i sems so //
translated: The thought of loving kindness is the thought of being friendly toward sentient beings.

original: yang na byams pa ni gnyen bshes nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang na byams pa ni gnyen bshes nyid yin te /
translated: Alternatively, loving kindness is the state of being a friend.🔽The thought of benefiting is the thought of loving kindness.🔽The thought of benefiting others and the thought of loving kindness are also the Dharma.🔽The thought of benefiting others is the thought of taking care of others.🔽The thought of benefiting others is also the Dharma, because it is the thought of engaging in the four principles for attracting a following and the thought of engaging in protecting from fear, etc.

original: bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i sems gang yin pa de nyid byams pa'i sems yin no //
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i sems gang yin pa de nyid byams pa'i sems yin no //
translated: The thought of loving kindness is the thought of being friendly toward sentient beings.🔽Alternatively, loving kindness is the state of being a friend.🔽The thought of benefiting is the thought of loving kindness.

original: gang zhig sems rnam pa gsum bstan pa de ni chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhig sems rnam pa gsum bstan pa de ni chos zhes bya ste /
translated: The thought of benefiting others and the thought of loving kindness are also the Dharma.

original: bzlog pa ni chos ma yin par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni chos ma yin par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this should be applied to the non-dharmas.

original: de ltar rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu dag gi sa bon yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu dag gi sa bon yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind that is taught as the differentiation is the seed of the results.

original: rgyu gang zhig 'bras bu 'grub pa la thun mong ma yin pa de la ni sa bon zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu gang zhig 'bras bu 'grub pa la thun mong ma yin pa de la ni sa bon zhes bya ste /
translated: That cause which is not common to the establishment of the result is called a seed.

original: dper na s'a lu'i sa bon ni s'a lu'i myu gu'i rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na s'a lu'i sa bon ni s'a lu'i myu gu'i rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the seed of rice is the cause of the sprout of rice.

original: sa la sogs pa thun mong pa gang yin pa de ni sa bon ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa thun mong pa gang yin pa de ni sa bon ma yin gyi /
translated: Earth, etc., which are common are not seeds.

original: de ni rgyu nyid yin par zad do //
analyzed: de ni rgyu nyid yin par zad do //
translated: They are merely causes.

original: de ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba mngon par 'grub pa la sems rnam pa gsum sa bon yin te /
analyzed: de ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba mngon par 'grub pa la sems rnam pa gsum sa bon yin te /
translated: Just as that is, so also here, the three types of mind are the seeds for the establishment of the pleasant result.

original: skyes bu'i byed pa la sogs pa rnams ni rgyu tsam du zad do //
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa la sogs pa rnams ni rgyu tsam du zad do //
translated: The activity of the person, etc., are merely causes.

original: yang dus gang gi tshe sa bon 'bras bu'i sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang dus gang gi tshe sa bon 'bras bu'i sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: At what time is the seed the establisher of the result?

original: 'di gzhan du 'bras bu dag gi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di gzhan du 'bras bu dag gi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated elsewhere: “The seeds of the results. ”

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i skye ba la yin la /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i skye ba la yin la /
translated: “Here” refers to this life,

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba'i skye ba la'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba'i skye ba la'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: “elsewhere” refers to other lives.

original: 'di yang lung las rgyus par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang lung las rgyus par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail from the scriptures.

original: de ltar re zhig sems kyi bdag nyid can gyi chos gcig nyid rnam par gzhag nas slar yang bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig sems kyi bdag nyid can gyi chos gcig nyid rnam par gzhag nas slar yang bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, having established that a single phenomenon, the mind, exists, again states:

original: drang srong mchog gi las rnams ni //
analyzed: drang srong mchog gi las rnams ni //
translated: The actions of the supreme seer

original: sems pa dang ni bsams par nye rnam pa gnyis su gsungs so //
analyzed: sems pa dang ni bsams par nye rnam pa gnyis su gsungs so //
translated: are intention and that which is produced by intention.

original: don dam pa thugs su chud pas na drang srong ngo //🔽drang @102a * //
analyzed: don dam pa thugs su chud pas na drang srong ngo // drang @102a * //
translated: He is a seer because he has realized the ultimate.

original: srong yang yin la mchog kyang yin pas na drang srong mchog go //
analyzed: srong yang yin la mchog kyang yin pas na drang srong mchog go //
translated: He is supreme because he is the best of seers.

original: don dam pa rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: don dam pa rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i phyir la /
translated: He is the supreme seer because he has realized the ultimate in every way.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag las kyang mchog tu byung ba yin pa'i phyir na drang srong mchog ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag las kyang mchog tu byung ba yin pa'i phyir na drang srong mchog ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Because they are the best of the Hearers and Solitary Realizers, they are the best of sages, the Buddhas, the Transcendent Destroyers and Possessors.

original: drang srong mchog des mdo las /
analyzed: drang srong mchog des mdo las /
translated: The best of sages, the Buddha, the Transcendent Destroyer and Possessor, said in a Sutra:

original: sems pa'i las dang bsams pa'i las so zhes gsungs so //🔽gang zhig las rnam gnyis gsungs pa'i //
analyzed: sems pa'i las dang bsams pa'i las so zhes gsungs so // gang zhig las rnam gnyis gsungs pa'i //
translated: There is the karma of intention and the karma of volition.

original: las de dag gi bye brag ni //
analyzed: las de dag gi bye brag ni //
translated: The karma that is said to be twofold

original: rnam pa du mar yongs su bsgrags //
analyzed: rnam pa du mar yongs su bsgrags //
translated: is proclaimed to be of many types.

original: ji ltar zhe na //🔽de la las gang sems pa zhes //🔽gsungs pa de ni yid kyir 'dod //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na // de la las gang sems pa zhes // gsungs pa de ni yid kyir 'dod //
translated: How is that?🔽The karma that is said to be intention🔽is asserted to be mental.

original: bsams pa zhes ni gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: bsams pa zhes ni gang gsungs pa //
translated: The karma that is said to be volition

original: de ni lus dang ngag gir 'dod //
analyzed: de ni lus dang ngag gir 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be physical and verbal.

original: yid la yod pa ni yid kyi ste /
analyzed: yid la yod pa ni yid kyi ste /
translated: The karma that exists in the mind is mental.

original: yid kyi sgo nas de mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir dang / lus dang ngag 'jug pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa kho na la yid kyi las zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yid kyi sgo nas de mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir dang / lus dang ngag 'jug pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa kho na la yid kyi las zhes brjod do //
translated: Mental karma is called “mental action” because it is associated with the mental consciousness and because it is the ultimate basis of the actions of body and speech.

original: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs kyis bkar ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs kyis bkar ba'o //
translated: The word “only” in the verse is meant to exclude the actions of body and speech.

original: las gnyis pa bsams pa zhes gang gsungs pa de ni lus dang ngag gi yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: las gnyis pa bsams pa zhes gang gsungs pa de ni lus dang ngag gi yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The second kind of action, “deliberate,” is to be understood as referring to the actions of body and speech.

original: lus dang ngag dag gis de lta de ltar 'jug par bya'o zhes de ltar sems kyis bsams nas gang zhig byed pa de ni bsams pa'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dag gis de lta de ltar 'jug par bya'o zhes de ltar sems kyis bsams nas gang zhig byed pa de ni bsams pa'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “deliberate” because it is action that is done after the mind has reflected, “I will do this or that with my body or speech.”

original: yang de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This action is also of two kinds:

original: lus dang ngag la yod pa'i phyir dang / de dag gi sgo nas mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir na lus kyi dang ngag gi'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag la yod pa'i phyir dang / de dag gi sgo nas mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir na lus kyi dang ngag gi'o //
translated: bodily and vocal. It is called “bodily” and “vocal” because it exists in relation to the body and speech, and because it is completed through the medium of the body and speech.🔽Thus, there are three kinds of action:

original: de ltar na lus kyi dang ngag gi dang yid kyi ste /
analyzed: de ltar na lus kyi dang ngag gi dang yid kyi ste /
translated: bodily, vocal, and mental.

original: rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: There are three types.

original: las rnam pa gsum po 'di dag kyang slar phye na rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las rnam pa gsum po 'di dag kyang slar phye na rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: These three types of action are sevenfold when they are distinguished according to their nature.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis las de'i bye brag rnam pa mang por gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis las de'i bye brag rnam pa mang por gsungs so //
translated: Thus the Blessed One has taught that action is of many different types.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: What are these types?

original: ngag dang bskyod dang mi spong ba'i //
analyzed: ngag dang bskyod dang mi spong ba'i //
translated: Speech, movement, and that which is not relinquished,

original: rnam rig byed min zhes bya gang //
analyzed: rnam rig byed min zhes bya gang //
translated: are called non-informative.

original: spong pa'i rnam rig byed min pa //
analyzed: spong pa'i rnam rig byed min pa //
translated: The non-informative that is relinquishment,

original: gzhan dag kyang ni de bzhin 'dod //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ni de bzhin 'dod //
translated: and the other, are also like that.🔽Merit from enjoyment, merit, demerit,

original: longs spyod las byung bsod nams dang // bsod nams ma yin tshul de bzhin //
analyzed: longs spyod las byung bsod nams dang // bsod nams ma yin tshul de bzhin //
translated: are like that.

original: sems pa dang ni chos de bdun //
analyzed: sems pa dang ni chos de bdun //
translated: Thought and these seven dharmas

original: las su mngon par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: las su mngon par 'dod pa yin //
translated: are accepted as action.

original: de la ngag ni yi ge gsal por brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de la ngag ni yi ge gsal por brjod pa'o //
translated: Speech is the clear articulation of syllables.

original: bskyod pa ni lus kyi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: bskyod pa ni lus kyi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Movement is the movement of the body.

original: de la ngag ces bya bas ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i dag rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i spong ba dang / mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid @102b can kun nas slong bar byed pa thams cad spyir bzung ste /
analyzed: de la ngag ces bya bas ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i dag rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i spong ba dang / mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid @102b can kun nas slong bar byed pa thams cad spyir bzung ste /
translated: The term speech refers in general to all that motivates the virtuous and nonvirtuous informative form that is characterized by the abandonment or nonabandonment of noninformative form.

original: de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bskyod pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa spong ba dang mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid can kun nas slong bar byed pa yang spyir bzung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bskyod pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa spong ba dang mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid can kun nas slong bar byed pa yang spyir bzung ngo //
translated: Similarly, it refers in general to all that motivates the virtuous and nonvirtuous noninformative form that is characterized by the abandonment or nonabandonment of informative form.

original: ji ltar rnam par rig byed 'di'i dbye ba rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par rig byed 'di'i dbye ba rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as informative form is classified in two ways,

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i yang yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i yang yin te /
translated: so too is noninformative form.

original: mi spong pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag dang / spong pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag ces bya bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi spong pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag dang / spong pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag ces bya bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Noninformative form is classified in two ways: noninformative form that is characterized by the abandonment of negative actions and noninformative form that is characterized by the nonabandonment of negative actions.

original: de la mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Nonindicative states that are not abandoned are as follows.

original: deng nas bzung nas bdag gis sems can bsad cing chom rkun byas la 'tsho bar bya'o zhes sdig pa'i las khas blangs pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
analyzed: deng nas bzung nas bdag gis sems can bsad cing chom rkun byas la 'tsho bar bya'o zhes sdig pa'i las khas blangs pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
translated: From the time one vows to commit a nonvirtuous action, such as saying, From now on, I will kill sentient beings, I will steal and I will live like this,🔽nonindicative states that are the basis of the vow to commit nonvirtuous actions arise continuously in those who do not commit such actions.

original: de mi byed pa dag la yang rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par mi dge ba'i las khas blangs pa'i rgyu can gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag nye bar skye bar 'gyur ba dang / rgya'i las byed pa nas bzung ste nya pa la sogs pa rnams de mi byed pa la yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag nye bar skye ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de mi byed pa dag la yang rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par mi dge ba'i las khas blangs pa'i rgyu can gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag nye bar skye bar 'gyur ba dang / rgya'i las byed pa nas bzung ste nya pa la sogs pa rnams de mi byed pa la yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag nye bar skye ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Also, from the time one engages in the action of a smith, for example, up to the time one becomes a fisherman, nonindicative states arise in those who do not engage in such actions.

original: 'di dag ni mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called nonindicative states that are not abandoned.

original: 'di dag ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du spong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dge ba'i rang bzhin can gzhan dag kyang yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du spong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dge ba'i rang bzhin can gzhan dag kyang yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: So too, other noninformative virtuous natures that are characterized by abandonment.

original: deng nas bzung ste srog gcod pa la sogs pa dag spong ngo zhes lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed yongs su rdzogs pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
analyzed: deng nas bzung ste srog gcod pa la sogs pa dag spong ngo zhes lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed yongs su rdzogs pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
translated: For example, from the time one undertakes the vows of individual liberation,🔽from then on, even when one is intoxicated and so on, the noninformative virtuous natures that are accumulated arise.

original: dus phyis myos pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su yang dge ba bsags pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag nye bar skye ba gang yin pa 'di dag ni spong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya'o
analyzed: dus phyis myos pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su yang dge ba bsags pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag nye bar skye ba gang yin pa 'di dag ni spong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya'o
translated: These are called noninformative virtuous natures that are characterized by abandonment.

original: // gzugs dang bya ba'i rang bzhin yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: // gzugs dang bya ba'i rang bzhin yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though they are by nature form and action,

original: rnam par rig byed bzhin du gzhan la rnam par rig par mi byed pas na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed bzhin du gzhan la rnam par rig par mi byed pas na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag go //
translated: they are called noninformative because they do not inform others, unlike informative form.

original: de bzhin du longs spyod las byung ba sod nams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du longs spyod las byung ba sod nams te /
translated: Likewise, merit arises from enjoyment.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of virtue is the same.

original: longs spyod las byung ba 'di la yod pas na longs spyod las byung ba'o //
analyzed: longs spyod las byung ba 'di la yod pas na longs spyod las byung ba'o //
translated: It is called arising from enjoyment because it exists in enjoyment.

original: longs spyod ni yongs su btang ba'i dngos po dge 'dun la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar longs spyod ba'o //🔽byung ba ni rjes su @103a * //
analyzed: longs spyod ni yongs su btang ba'i dngos po dge 'dun la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar longs spyod ba'o // byung ba ni rjes su @103a * //
translated: Enjoyment is the enjoyment by the Saṅgha and so on of things that have been given away.

original: byung ba ste /
analyzed: byung ba ste /
translated: Arising is subsequent arising.

original: sbyin pa po'i rgyud la skyes pa'i dge ba'i 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyin pa po'i rgyud la skyes pa'i dge ba'i 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the increase of virtue that arises in the mindstream of the giver.

original: bsod nams ma yin tshul de bzhin te /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin tshul de bzhin te /
translated: Nonvirtue is similar to that.

original: longs spyod las byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: longs spyod las byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of arising from enjoyment is the same.

original: ji ltar gang du srog chags dag gsod pa'i lha khang la sogs pa brtsigs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gang du srog chags dag gsod pa'i lha khang la sogs pa brtsigs pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like the construction of a temple for the slaughter of living beings and so on.

original: ji lta ji ltar lha khang der srog chags dag gsod pa de lta de ltar lha khang la sogs pa der longs spyad pa las byed pa po rnams kyi rgyud la longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar lha khang der srog chags dag gsod pa de lta de ltar lha khang la sogs pa der longs spyad pa las byed pa po rnams kyi rgyud la longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The more living beings are killed in a temple, the more the perpetrators of the killing, etc. in that temple, etc. generate non-meritorious action that arises from enjoyment.

original: de ltar na bsod nams ma yin pa yang tshul de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na bsod nams ma yin pa yang tshul de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, non-merit also occurs in the same way.

original: yid kyi las kyi mtshan nyid can sems mngon par 'du byed pa sems pa zhes bya ba dang ste /
analyzed: yid kyi las kyi mtshan nyid can sems mngon par 'du byed pa sems pa zhes bya ba dang ste /
translated: The mental action is the volition called “mental formation” which has the nature of mental action.

original: mdor bsdu na las rnam pa bdun po 'di dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na las rnam pa bdun po 'di dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In brief, action is of seven types:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngag dang bskyod pa gnyis dang / dge ba rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / mi dge ba rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mtshan nyid can dang / longs spyod las byung ba'i bsod nams dang /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngag dang bskyod pa gnyis dang / dge ba rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / mi dge ba rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mtshan nyid can dang / longs spyod las byung ba'i bsod nams dang /
translated: the two, speech and movement, which are virtuous or non-virtuous, the virtuous one which has the nature of non-indicative form, the non-virtuous one which has the nature of non-indicative form, the merit that arises from enjoyment,

original: longs spyod las byung ba'i bsod nams ma yin pa dang / sems pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: longs spyod las byung ba'i bsod nams ma yin pa dang / sems pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Nonvirtue arising from enjoyment and intention.

original: chos de bdun las su mngon par te las nyid du gsal zhing las kyi mtshan nyid can du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos de bdun las su mngon par te las nyid du gsal zhing las kyi mtshan nyid can du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: These seven phenomena are asserted to be karma, to be clear as karma, and to have the characteristics of karma.

original: 'di la kha cig rgol bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig rgol bar byed de /
translated: Here, some debate this point.

original: las rnam pa mang po zhig bshad pa gang yin pa de ci rnam par smin pa'i dus kyi bar du gnas pa zhig gam /🔽'on te skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las rnam pa mang po zhig bshad pa gang yin pa de ci rnam par smin pa'i dus kyi bar du gnas pa zhig gam / 'on te skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir /
translated: Is the karma that has been explained in many ways something that endures until the time of its ripening,

original: mi gnas pa zhig yin grang /
analyzed: mi gnas pa zhig yin grang /
translated: or is it nonenduring because it ceases as soon as it arises?

original: re zhig / gal te smin pa'i dus bar du //
analyzed: re zhig / gal te smin pa'i dus bar du //
translated: If it endures until the time of its ripening,

original: gnas na las de rtag par 'gyur //🔽gal te 'gags na 'gags gyur pa //
analyzed: gnas na las de rtag par 'gyur // gal te 'gags na 'gags gyur pa //
translated: that karma would be permanent.🔽If it ceases, how could

original: ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
translated: what has ceased generate an effect?

original: gal te las 'di skyes nas rnam par smin pa'i dus kyi bar du rang gi ngo bos gnas so zhes bya bar rtog na ni /
analyzed: gal te las 'di skyes nas rnam par smin pa'i dus kyi bar du rang gi ngo bos gnas so zhes bya bar rtog na ni /
translated: If you imagine that this karma endures by its very nature until the time of its ripening,

original: de'i phyir de ltar na de dus 'di tsam gyi bar du rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na de dus 'di tsam gyi bar du rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, in that case, it would be permanent for that long,

original: 'jig pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be free from destruction.

original: phyis 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyis 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not permanent because it is destroyed later,

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: sngar 'jig pa dang bral ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa ltar phyis kyang 'jig pa dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba yang 'dus ma byas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'dus ma byas rnams la ni rnam par smin pa ma mthong ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: sngar 'jig pa dang bral ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa ltar phyis kyang 'jig pa dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba yang 'dus ma byas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'dus ma byas rnams la ni rnam par smin pa ma mthong ba'i phyir dang /
translated: Because that which is free from destruction earlier is not related to destruction later, like space, etc., and because it would follow that that which is free from destruction would be unconditioned, and because the result of the evolution of unconditioned things is not seen,

original: rnam par smin @103b pa med pa nyid kyis rtag tu gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par smin @103b pa med pa nyid kyis rtag tu gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: and because it would always remain due to the absence of the result of evolution,

original: las rnams rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las rnams rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be accepted that karma is permanent.

original: de ltar na re zhig rtag pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rtag pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in that case, the error of permanence would occur.

original: ci ste las rnams skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid du khas len no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste las rnams skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid du khas len no zhe na /
translated: But if you accept that karma is destroyed immediately upon being produced,

original: de lta yin na ni /🔽gal te 'gags na 'gags gyur pa //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni / gal te 'gags na 'gags gyur pa //
translated: then in that case,

original: ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
translated: If it has ceased, how could it generate an effect?

original: las med par gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: las med par gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: If karma has ceased, it does not exist. Therefore, it could not generate an effect.

original: 'di la sde pa gzhan dag kha cig lan 'debs par byed pa ni //
analyzed: 'di la sde pa gzhan dag kha cig lan 'debs par byed pa ni //
translated: In response to this, some other schools offer the following reply:

original: re zhig kho bo cag la 'du byed rnams rtag pa nyid kyi nyes bar ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig kho bo cag la 'du byed rnams rtag pa nyid kyi nyes bar ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: First, we do not commit the error of asserting that karmic formations are permanent.

original: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang yang / gal te 'gags na 'gags gyur pa //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro // gang yang / gal te 'gags na 'gags gyur pa //
translated: Because they are destroyed immediately upon being produced.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
translated: But if you say, “If it has ceased, how could it generate an effect?”

original: zhes smras pa de yang lan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes smras pa de yang lan brjod par bya ste /
translated: we must respond to that.

original: myu gu la sogs rgyun gang ni //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs rgyun gang ni //
translated: The continuum of the sprout

original: sa bon las ni mngon par 'byung //
analyzed: sa bon las ni mngon par 'byung //
translated: arises from the seed.

original: de las 'bras bu sa bon ni //
analyzed: de las 'bras bu sa bon ni //
translated: From that arises the effect.

original: med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: If the seed does not exist, that also does not arise.

original: 'dir sa bon ni skad cig ma nyid yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'dir sa bon ni skad cig ma nyid yin du zin kyang /
translated: Here, even though the seed is momentary,

original: rgyun myu gu dang sdong bu dang sbubs 'chas pa dang / lo ma la sogs pa'i ming can 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu'i khyad par rang dang rigs mthun pa bskyed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa kho na'i rgyu'i dngos por gyur nas 'gags pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyun myu gu dang sdong bu dang sbubs 'chas pa dang / lo ma la sogs pa'i ming can 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu'i khyad par rang dang rigs mthun pa bskyed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa kho na'i rgyu'i dngos por gyur nas 'gags pa yin la /
translated: it ceases having become the cause that possesses the ability to generate a result that is a specific continuum of sprouts, stems, nodes, leaves, and so on, which are of a similar type to itself.

original: gang yang myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun sa bon las byung ba de las ni rgyu chung du yin du zin kyang rim gyis lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pas 'bras bu'i tshogs rgya chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun sa bon las byung ba de las ni rgyu chung du yin du zin kyang rim gyis lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pas 'bras bu'i tshogs rgya chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And from that continuum of sprouts and so on that arises from the seed, even though the cause is small, a great collection of results is gradually generated because the coemergent causes are complete.

original: sa bon ni med na ste /
analyzed: sa bon ni med na ste /
translated: If the seed does not exist,

original: sa bon mi bdog par 'gyur na ni myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun de yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon mi bdog par 'gyur na ni myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun de yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: that continuum of sprouts and so on would not arise.

original: de'i phyir de ltar de yod na yod pa nyid dang / de med na med pa nyid kyis na myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi 'bras bu ni sa bon gyi rgyu can nyid yin par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar de yod na yod pa nyid dang / de med na med pa nyid kyis na myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi 'bras bu ni sa bon gyi rgyu can nyid yin par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it exists when that exists and does not exist when that does not exist, the result of the continuum of the sprout and so on is taught to be the cause of the seed.

original: de'i phyir de ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽Since the continuum arises from the seed

original: gang phyir sa bon las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhig /
analyzed: gang phyir sa bon las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhig /
translated: and the result arises from the continuum,

original: sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
analyzed: sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
translated: the seed precedes the result.

original: de phyir chad mi rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad mi rtag ma yin //
translated: Therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: gal te sa bon myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi rkyen du ma gyur par me lce dang me mdag la sogs pa 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bas 'gags par gyur na ni //🔽de'i tshe de'i 'bras bu'i rgyu ni 'byung bar ma mthong bas chad par ltar @104a * //
analyzed: gal te sa bon myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi rkyen du ma gyur par me lce dang me mdag la sogs pa 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bas 'gags par gyur na ni // de'i tshe de'i 'bras bu'i rgyu ni 'byung bar ma mthong bas chad par ltar @104a * //
translated: If the seed were to cease due to the proximity of opposing conditions, such as fire, flame, embers, and so on, without becoming the condition of the continuum of the sprout and so on,

original: par 'gyur la /
analyzed: par 'gyur la /
translated: at that time, since the cause of its result is not seen to arise, it would be a view of annihilation.

original: yang gal te sa bon mi 'gag cing myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun 'byung bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: yang gal te sa bon mi 'gag cing myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun 'byung bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: Moreover, if the seed does not cease and the continuum of the sprout and so on arises,

original: de'i tshe sa bon mi 'gag par khas blangs pas rtag par lta bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe sa bon mi 'gag par khas blangs pas rtag par lta bar 'gyur na /
translated: If you accept that the seed does not cease, then you would have a view of eternalism.

original: 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case.

original: de'i phyir sa bon chad pa dang rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bon chad pa dang rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the absurd consequence of the seed being annihilated or eternal does not apply.

original: ji ltar sa bon la tshul 'di smras pa de bzhin du /🔽sems kyi rgyun ni gang yin pa //
analyzed: ji ltar sa bon la tshul 'di smras pa de bzhin du / sems kyi rgyun ni gang yin pa //
translated: Just as this method is applied to the seed,🔽so too is it applied to the continuum of mind.

original: sems las mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sems las mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: The continuum of mind arises from the mind.

original: de las 'bras bu sems lta zhig / med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de las 'bras bu sems lta zhig / med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: If the mind did not exist, then the result would not arise.

original: sems sems pa dge ba'i khyad par dang mtshungs par ldan pa de las ni de'i rgyu can sems kyi rgyun gang yin pa 'byung la /
analyzed: sems sems pa dge ba'i khyad par dang mtshungs par ldan pa de las ni de'i rgyu can sems kyi rgyun gang yin pa 'byung la /
translated: The continuum of mind that is the cause of that arises from the mind that is concomitant with the special virtuous intention.

original: sems pa dge bas yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyi rgyun de las ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nye ba ma tshang ba med pa na 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems pa dge bas yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyi rgyun de las ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nye ba ma tshang ba med pa na 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the continuum of mind that is infused by virtuous intention, a pleasant result arises when the non-deficient cooperative conditions are present.

original: sems lta zhig med na ste /
analyzed: sems lta zhig med na ste /
translated: If the mind did not exist,

original: sems mi bdog na rgyun de yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems mi bdog na rgyun de yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mind does not exist, that continuum would not occur.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, in this way:

original: gang phyir sems las rgyun dang ni //
analyzed: gang phyir sems las rgyun dang ni //
translated: Because the continuum arises from the mind,

original: rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: And the effect arises from the cause,

original: las ni 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
analyzed: las ni 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
translated: And the action precedes the effect,

original: de'i phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: Therefore, it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: gal te sems dge ba de dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma ltar /
analyzed: gal te sems dge ba de dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma ltar /
translated: If that virtuous mind, like the final mind of an arhat,

original: sems kyi rgyun rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rim pa rgyun ma chad pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i dngos por ma gyur pa 'gags na ni /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rim pa rgyun ma chad pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i dngos por ma gyur pa 'gags na ni /
translated: does not become the cause of the continuum of mind, the uninterrupted process of one mind and its continuum arising from another,

original: de'i phyir las de rgyun chad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir las de rgyun chad par 'gyur la /
translated: then that action would be annihilated.

original: ci ste yang ma 'ongs pa'i rgyun gyi rgyu'i dngos por gyur nas rang gi ngo bo las mi nyams par gyur na ni /
analyzed: ci ste yang ma 'ongs pa'i rgyun gyi rgyu'i dngos por gyur nas rang gi ngo bo las mi nyams par gyur na ni /
translated: But if it becomes the cause of the future continuum and does not deteriorate from its own nature,

original: de'i tshe las rtag par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe las rtag par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then at that time the action would be eternal.

original: de ni de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir las skad cig mar khas blangs su zin kyang chad pa dang rtag par lta bar thal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir las skad cig mar khas blangs su zin kyang chad pa dang rtag par lta bar thal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though one accepts that karma is momentary, it is not the case that the views of annihilation and permanence follow.

original: de'i phyir ji skad bstan pa'i las kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par bshad pa 'dir dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad bstan pa'i las kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par bshad pa 'dir dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang bshad pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, in this explanation of the classification of karma as taught above, the ten virtuous karmic paths are also explained.

original: dkar po las kyi lam bcu po'o //🔽de dag kyang /
analyzed: dkar po las kyi lam bcu po'o // de dag kyang /
translated: The ten virtuous karmic paths

original: chos sgrub pa'i thabs yin te /
analyzed: chos sgrub pa'i thabs yin te /
translated: are the means of accomplishing Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'bras bu 'di gzhan du 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam lnga'o /
analyzed: chos kyi 'bras bu 'di gzhan du 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam lnga'o /
translated: The result of Dharma is the five sense objects elsewhere.

original: dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po de dag ni chos sgrub pa'i thabs yin te 'grub pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po de dag ni chos sgrub pa'i thabs yin te 'grub pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: Those ten virtuous karmic paths are the means of accomplishing Dharma. The meaning is that they are the cause of accomplishment.

original: 'di dag gang gis sgrub pa'i thabs nyid du 'jog par 'gyur ba'i chos @104b zhes bya ba dge ba'i las kyi lam las tha dad pa 'di gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gang gis sgrub pa'i thabs nyid du 'jog par 'gyur ba'i chos @104b zhes bya ba dge ba'i las kyi lam las tha dad pa 'di gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is that Dharma that is established by those means? What is different from the virtuous karmic paths?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: chos kyi sgra ni sems kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig kho na brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi sgra ni sems kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig kho na brjod pa yin te /
translated: The word dharma refers to certain specific mental states.

original: bdag nyid legs par sdom pa dang // gzhan la phan 'dogs byams sems gang //
analyzed: bdag nyid legs par sdom pa dang // gzhan la phan 'dogs byams sems gang //
translated: The restraint of oneself, the desire to help others, and loving kindness

original: de chos zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de chos zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are called dharma.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag yongs su mthar gtugs pa'i ngo bo ni chos kyi sgra'i brjod bya yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag yongs su mthar gtugs pa'i ngo bo ni chos kyi sgra'i brjod bya yin la /
translated: In another way, the essence of these paths of action that are fully completed is the referent of the word dharma,

original: byed bzhin pa'i ngo bo ni dge ba'i las kyi lam gyi sgra'i brjod byar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed bzhin pa'i ngo bo ni dge ba'i las kyi lam gyi sgra'i brjod byar 'gyur ro //
translated: while the essence of those that are being performed is the referent of the word path of action.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag ni bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid can de 'grub par bya ba la rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag ni bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid can de 'grub par bya ba la rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: These ten paths of virtuous action are established as causes for the achievement of the characteristics that have been explained.

original: yang las kyi rnam par dbye ba'i skabs thal zin pa der dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang las kyi rnam par dbye ba'i skabs thal zin pa der dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In the chapter on the classification of karma, it was said, “How are they the ten paths of virtuous action?”

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: lus kyi gsum dang / ngag gi bzhi ni /
analyzed: lus kyi gsum dang / ngag gi bzhi ni /
translated: The three of body and the four of speech

original: ngag dang bskyod dang mi spong pa'i //
analyzed: ngag dang bskyod dang mi spong pa'i //
translated: The three of speech and the three of body

original: rnam rig byed min zhes bya gang //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam rig byed min zhes bya gang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin la /
translated: are the three types of informative form.🔽The three of mind are the three types of non-informative form.

original: yid kyi gsum po brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag par lta ba zhes bya ba ni /🔽sems pa dang ni zhes bya ba des rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi gsum po brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag par lta ba zhes bya ba ni / sems pa dang ni zhes bya ba des rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The three of mind are non-covetousness, non-ill will, and right view.🔽The three of speech are true speech, harmonious speech, and beneficial speech.🔽The three of body are refraining from killing, refraining from stealing, and refraining from sexual misconduct.

original: de ltar na der dge ba'i las kyi lam de dag bcu car yang rnam par bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na der dge ba'i las kyi lam de dag bcu car yang rnam par bshad pa yin la /
translated: Thus, in this verse, all ten virtuous karmic paths are explained.

original: de dag kyang ji skad bshad pa'i chos 'grub pa'i rgyu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang ji skad bshad pa'i chos 'grub pa'i rgyu 'gyur ro //
translated: And they are the causes for accomplishing the Dharma as it has been explained.

original: chos de'i 'bras bu ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i mtshan nyid can 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: chos de'i 'bras bu ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i mtshan nyid can 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar longs spyod pa'o //
translated: The result of that Dharma is the enjoyment of the five sense objects of form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means this world.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ma mthong bar te 'jig rten pha rol du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ma mthong bar te 'jig rten pha rol du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Otherwise” means not seeing, that is, in the next world.

original: de ltar re zhig kha cig gis brtsad pa'i lan btab pa yin dang / gzhan dag gis de la skyon brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig kha cig gis brtsad pa'i lan btab pa yin dang / gzhan dag gis de la skyon brjod nas /
translated: Thus, first, some respond to the objection, and others state the error in that response.

original: brtsad pa'i lan gzhan gdab pa'i phyir smra pa /
analyzed: brtsad pa'i lan gzhan gdab pa'i phyir smra pa /
translated: In order to respond to the objection in another way, the opponent says:

original: gal te brtag pa der 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te brtag pa der 'gyur na //
translated: If that were the case,

original: nyes pa chen po mang por 'gyur //
analyzed: nyes pa chen po mang por 'gyur //
translated: many great errors would ensue.

original: de lta bas na brtag pa ste //
analyzed: de lta bas na brtag pa ste //
translated: Therefore, this

original: 'dir ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: is not tenable here.

original: gal te sa bon dang myu gu dang chos mthun pa'i sgo nas sems kyi rgyun la chad pa dang rtag pa'i skyon du thal ba spong par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe gzhan gyi phyogs la nyes pa chen po ste mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dang 'gal ba
analyzed: gal te sa bon dang myu gu dang chos mthun pa'i sgo nas sems kyi rgyun la chad pa dang rtag pa'i skyon du thal ba spong par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe gzhan gyi phyogs la nyes pa chen po ste mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dang 'gal ba
translated: If the error of the mind-stream being either annihilated or eternal were to be eliminated by way of the similarity of the seed and sprout, then at that time many great errors would ensue for the opponent’s position.

original: dang / grangs mang ba nyid kyis mang por 'gyur ro /
analyzed: dang / grangs mang ba nyid kyis mang por 'gyur ro /
translated: They would be many because of the contradiction of seeing and not seeing and because of the multiplicity of the many.

original: @105a * // ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: @105a * // ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gal te sa bon gyi rgyun gyi dpes yin na ni s'a lu'i sa bon las ni s'a lu'i myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun kho na 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /🔽rigs mi mthun pa ma yin la s'a lu'i myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun las kyang s'a lu'i 'bras bu kho na skye'i //
analyzed: gal te sa bon gyi rgyun gyi dpes yin na ni s'a lu'i sa bon las ni s'a lu'i myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun kho na 'byung bar 'gyur gyi / rigs mi mthun pa ma yin la s'a lu'i myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun las kyang s'a lu'i 'bras bu kho na skye'i //
translated: If it is by the example of the continuum of the seed, then from a rice seed only the continuum of a rice sprout would arise.🔽And from the continuum of a rice sprout only a rice plant would arise, not one of a different type.

original: rigs tha dad pa'i phyir nim pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa'i phyir nim pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: And from a rice plant only a rice seed would arise, not a seed of a different type.

original: 'dir yang rigs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir dge ba'i sems las dge ba'i sems kyi rgyun kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dir yang rigs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir dge ba'i sems las dge ba'i sems kyi rgyun kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: In the same way, here also, because of the similarity of the reasoning, only a continuum of virtuous minds would arise from a virtuous mind.

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyun ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyun ni ma yin no //
translated: But not a continuum of nonvirtuous or neutral minds, because of the difference in type.

original: de bzhin du mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems yas kyang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi rgyun kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems yas kyang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi rgyun kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, only a continuum of nonvirtuous or neutral minds would arise from a nonvirtuous or neutral mind.

original: rigs tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin no //
translated: But not a continuum of a different type, because of the difference in type.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sems rnams las kyang 'dra ba'i sems 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sems rnams kho na 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sems rnams las kyang 'dra ba'i sems 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sems rnams kho na 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Also, from a mind of the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm, and from a uncontaminated mind, a similar mind of the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm, and a uncontaminated mind arise.

original: rigs mi mthun pa rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: But a dissimilar mind does not arise.

original: mi'i sems las kyang mi'i sems kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi'i sems las kyang mi'i sems kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Also, from a human mind, only a human mind arises.

original: gzhan lha dang dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro la sogs pa'i sems ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan lha dang dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro la sogs pa'i sems ni ma yin no //
translated: But a mind of a god, hell being, ghost, animal, and so on does not arise.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig lha yin pa de ni lha kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig lha yin pa de ni lha kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, one who is a god is only a god.

original: gang zhig mi yin pa de ni mi kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig mi yin pa de ni mi kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: One who is a human is only a human.

original: de'i phyir lha dang mi mi dge ba byed pa rnams kyi 'gro ba dang skye gnas dang rigs dang blo dang dbang po dang stobs dang gzugs dang longs spyod la sogs pa tha dad pa dang / ngan 'gro ltung ba yang yod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i phyir lha dang mi mi dge ba byed pa rnams kyi 'gro ba dang skye gnas dang rigs dang blo dang dbang po dang stobs dang gzugs dang longs spyod la sogs pa tha dad pa dang / ngan 'gro ltung ba yang yod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Therefore, the different destinies, births, families, minds, faculties, powers, forms, enjoyments, etc. of gods and humans who do not do what is wholesome would not exist, and there would be no falling into bad destinies.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But all of this is not the case.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar sa bon gyi rgyun dang chos mthun par rtog na nyes pa chen po dang mang por thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir brtag pa de 'dir yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar sa bon gyi rgyun dang chos mthun par rtog na nyes pa chen po dang mang por thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir brtag pa de 'dir yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since many great faults would follow if one imagined that the continuum of seeds is similar, that imagination is not tenable here.🔽Whatever is taught by the Buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang rang rgyal dang // nyan thos rnams kyis gang gsungs pa'i //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang rang rgyal dang // nyan thos rnams kyis gang gsungs pa'i //
translated: the Solitary Sages, and the Disciples,

original: brtag pa gang zhig 'dir 'thad pa //
analyzed: brtag pa gang zhig 'dir 'thad pa //
translated: That is tenable here.

original: de ni rab tu brjod par byed //
analyzed: de ni rab tu brjod par byed //
translated: That is what should be taught.

original: brtag pa de yang gang zhig yin zhe na //
analyzed: brtag pa de yang gang zhig yin zhe na //
translated: What is that imagination?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa // dpang rgya ji lta de bzhin chud //
analyzed: smras pa // dpang rgya ji lta de bzhin chud //
translated: Just as a seed is, so is the world.

original: mi za las ni bu lon bzhin //
analyzed: mi za las ni bu lon bzhin //
translated: Karma is like a debt, since it is not consumed.

original: de ni khams las rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: de ni khams las rnam pa bzhi //
translated: It is of four types, according to realm.

original: de yang @105b rang bzhin lung ma bstan //
analyzed: de yang @105b rang bzhin lung ma bstan //
translated: It is morally neutral by nature.

original: 'dir dge ba'i las byas par gyur pa ni skyes ma thag tu 'gags pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir dge ba'i las byas par gyur pa ni skyes ma thag tu 'gags pa yin la /
translated: Here, virtuous karma that has been performed ceases immediately upon being performed.

original: de 'gags pas 'bras bu med par thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'gags pas 'bras bu med par thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that, because it has ceased, it does not have an effect.

original: gang gi phyir las de gang gi tshe skye ba de nyid kyi tshe byed pa po'i rgyud la las de'i chud mi za ba zhes bya ba ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos bu lon gyi dpang rgya 'dra ba zhig skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir las de gang gi tshe skye ba de nyid kyi tshe byed pa po'i rgyud la las de'i chud mi za ba zhes bya ba ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos bu lon gyi dpang rgya 'dra ba zhig skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because when that karma arises, at that time, in the continuum of the agent, a dharma called the nonexpiration of that karma arises, which is not a possession, like a promissory note.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na dpang rgya ji lta ba de bzhin du chud mi za bar rig par bya la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na dpang rgya ji lta ba de bzhin du chud mi za bar rig par bya la /
translated: Therefore, just as in the case of a promissory note, the nonexpiration of karma should be understood.

original: gang la chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i chos de bskyed ba'i las de ni bu lon bzhin rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i chos de bskyed ba'i las de ni bu lon bzhin rig par bya'o //
translated: And the karma that produces the dharma called nonexpiration should be understood to be like a debt.

original: ji ltar bu lon gyi dpang rgya bzhag nas nor spyad kyang nor bdag gi nor chud za bar mi 'gyur bar dus gzhan gyi tshe skyed dang bcas pa'i nor gyi phung po dang 'brel pa nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du las zhig tu zin kyang chud mi
analyzed: ji ltar bu lon gyi dpang rgya bzhag nas nor spyad kyang nor bdag gi nor chud za bar mi 'gyur bar dus gzhan gyi tshe skyed dang bcas pa'i nor gyi phung po dang 'brel pa nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du las zhig tu zin kyang chud mi
translated: Just as when a promissory note is issued, the wealth of the creditor is not wasted, and the wealth of the debtor is connected with the mass of wealth, together with interest, at another time, in the same way, even though the karma is destroyed,

original: za ba zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan gnas pas byed pa po de'i rgyu can gyi 'bras bu dang mngon par 'brel ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: za ba zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan gnas pas byed pa po de'i rgyu can gyi 'bras bu dang mngon par 'brel ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: the nondissipation of karma is a different phenomenon that endures, and the agent is connected with the result that is caused by that karma.

original: yang ji ltar bu lon gyi dpang rgyas gtong ba po la nor bkug nas ror gyur pa ni yod dam med kyang rung ste yang nor 'gugs par mi nus pa de bzhin du chud mi za ba yang rnam par smin pa phyung nas yod dam med kyang rung
analyzed: yang ji ltar bu lon gyi dpang rgyas gtong ba po la nor bkug nas ror gyur pa ni yod dam med kyang rung ste yang nor 'gugs par mi nus pa de bzhin du chud mi za ba yang rnam par smin pa phyung nas yod dam med kyang rung
translated: Just as when a promissory note is issued, the creditor is compelled to accept the wealth and the wealth is transformed into something else, and it is no longer possible to compel the creditor to accept the wealth again, in the same way, even though the nondissipation of karma is extracted and exists or does not exist,

original: ste dpang rgya ror gyur pa ltar yang byed pa po rnam par smin pa dang 'brel par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: ste dpang rgya ror gyur pa ltar yang byed pa po rnam par smin pa dang 'brel par byed mi nus so //
translated: it is no longer possible to connect the agent with the result, just as it is no longer possible to compel the creditor to accept the wealth again.

original: yang mdo gzhan las gsungs shing kho bo cag gis smras pa'i chud mi za ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: yang mdo gzhan las gsungs shing kho bo cag gis smras pa'i chud mi za ba gang yin pa /
translated: Also, the non-expiration that is taught in other sūtras and that we maintain

original: de ni khams las rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ni khams las rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: is of four types, due to the distinction of realm:

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dbye ba las so //
translated: of the desire realm, form realm, formless realm, and uncontaminated.

original: de yang rang bzhin lung ma bstan //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin lung ma bstan //
translated: It is neutral by nature.

original: chud mi za ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid tu brda mi sprod pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: chud mi za ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid tu brda mi sprod pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: Non-expiration is only neutral because it is not indicated as virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: gal te mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi de mi dge ba zhig yin na ni de'i tshe 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi de mi dge ba zhig yin na ni de'i tshe 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were nonvirtuous for nonvirtuous karma, then it would not exist for those who are free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: gal te dge ba rnams kyi dge ba zhig yin na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa rnams la de med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dge ba rnams kyi dge ba zhig yin na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa rnams la de med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were virtuous for virtuous karma, then it would not exist for those who have severed their root of virtue.

original: de'i phyir de ni rang bzhin gyis lung du ma bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rang bzhin gyis lung du ma bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore it is neutral by nature.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / spong ba spang ba ma yin te //
analyzed: gzhan yang / spong ba spang ba ma yin te //
translated: it is not abandoned by the abandonment of the desire realm.

original: bsgoms pas spang ba nyid kyang min //
analyzed: bsgoms pas spang ba nyid kyang min //
translated: Nor is it abandoned by cultivation.

original: chud mi za ba de spong bas spang ba ni ma yin no //🔽'phags pa yang so so skye ba'i las dang ldan par 'gyur du 'ong bas mthong ba'i @106a * //
analyzed: chud mi za ba de spong bas spang ba ni ma yin no // 'phags pa yang so so skye ba'i las dang ldan par 'gyur du 'ong bas mthong ba'i @106a * //
translated: It is not abandoned by the abandonment of that non-expiration.🔽It might be argued that the noble person would come to possess the karma of an ordinary man, but the path of insight abandons only the karma of an ordinary man.

original: lam gyis so so skye ba'i las dag kho na spong gi / chud mi za ba ni de'i las spangs kyang mthong ba'i lam gyis spong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lam gyis so so skye ba'i las dag kho na spong gi / chud mi za ba ni de'i las spangs kyang mthong ba'i lam gyis spong ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though the karma is abandoned, the non-expiration is not abandoned by the path of insight.

original: 'on kyang de ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis kyang spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis kyang spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, it is abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: kyang gi sgras ni khams las yang dag par 'das pas kyang spang bar bya ba yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa'i don to //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni khams las yang dag par 'das pas kyang spang bar bya ba yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa'i don to //
translated: The word “also” in the verse is meant to imply that it is also abandoned by the transcendence of the realm.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar las 'jig kyang chud mi za ba mi 'jig la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar las 'jig kyang chud mi za ba mi 'jig la /
translated: Since karma is destroyed in this way, but non-expiration is not destroyed,

original: las spangs kyang spang bar bya ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: las spangs kyang spang bar bya ba ma yin pa /
translated: and even though the karma is abandoned, the non-expiration is not abandoned,

original: de phyir chud mi za ba yis //
analyzed: de phyir chud mi za ba yis //
translated: therefore, by non-expiration,

original: las kyi 'bras bu bskyod par 'gyur //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu bskyod par 'gyur //
translated: the result of karma is not destroyed.

original: yang gal te chud mi za ba 'di las spong bas te 'dor bas spong bar 'gyur la ;
analyzed: yang gal te chud mi za ba 'di las spong bas te 'dor bas spong bar 'gyur la ;
translated: Again, if this nonexpiration were to expire through abandonment,

original: las 'pho ba ste las 'jig cing las gzhan mngon du phyogs pa'i ngo bos 'jig par 'gyur na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: las 'pho ba ste las 'jig cing las gzhan mngon du phyogs pa'i ngo bos 'jig par 'gyur na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: and if karma were to expire through the transition of karma, that is, through the disintegration of karma and the manifestation of other karma, what fault would there be?🔽We reply: If it were to expire through abandonment

original: brjod pa / gal te spong bas spang pa dang // las 'pho ba yis 'jig 'gyur na //🔽de la las 'jig la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: brjod pa / gal te spong bas spang pa dang // las 'pho ba yis 'jig 'gyur na // de la las 'jig la sogs pa'i //
