translated: and if it were to expire through the transition of karma,🔽then the faults of the destruction of karma and so on

original: skyon rnams su ni thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skyon rnams su ni thal bar 'gyur //
translated: would ensue.

original: gal te so so skye bo'i las bzhin du mthong pa'i lam gyis chud mi za ba spong na ni /
analyzed: gal te so so skye bo'i las bzhin du mthong pa'i lam gyis chud mi za ba spong na ni /
translated: If nonexpiration were to expire through the path of seeing, just like the karma of ordinary beings,

original: de'i tshe las 'jig pa kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe las 'jig pa kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: then at that time karma would definitely be destroyed.

original: las 'jig pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba sngon gyi las kyi rgyu can du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'jig pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba sngon gyi las kyi rgyu can du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because karma would be destroyed, the results of karma that are the pleasant and unpleasant karmic maturation of āryas would not be the cause of previous karma.

original: ma byas pa'i las las 'bras bu 'byung bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa'i las las 'bras bu 'byung bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The result would arise from karma that was not done.

original: las dang 'bras bu med par lta ba'i phyir log par lta bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu med par lta ba'i phyir log par lta bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it would view karma and its results as nonexistent, it would be wrong view.

original: de ltar chud mi za bas spong bas spang bar bya ba nyid du khas len na las 'jig pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar chud mi za bas spong bas spang bar bya ba nyid du khas len na las 'jig pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if you accept that karma is abandoned by the abandonment of imperishable karma, the error of the destruction of karma and so on would ensue.

original: de bzhin du las 'pho ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du las 'pho ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same error would ensue if you applied this to the transference of karma.🔽Karma of the same realm, whether similar or dissimilar,

original: khams mtshungs las ni cha mtshungs dang // cha mi mtshungs ba thams cad kyi //
analyzed: khams mtshungs las ni cha mtshungs dang // cha mi mtshungs ba thams cad kyi //
translated: all of it

original: de ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe //🔽gcig pu lon skye bar 'gyur //🔽cha mtshungs pa ni las rigs 'dra ba rnams so //
analyzed: de ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe // gcig pu lon skye bar 'gyur // cha mtshungs pa ni las rigs 'dra ba rnams so //
translated: is taken up at the time of rebirth🔽as a single karma.🔽Similar karma is of the same type.

original: cha mi mtshungs pa ni las rigs tha dad pa rnams so ;
analyzed: cha mi mtshungs pa ni las rigs tha dad pa rnams so ;
translated: Dissimilar karma is of different types.

original: ; las cha mtshungs pa dang / cha mi mtshungs pa de rnams thams cad kyi chud mi za ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe las thams cad pa shig nas gcig kho na skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ; las cha mtshungs pa dang / cha mi mtshungs pa de rnams thams cad kyi chud mi za ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe las thams cad pa shig nas gcig kho na skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All the non-perishing of those actions, whether similar or dissimilar, when linking with the desire, form, and formless realms, all but one of the actions is destroyed and only one is born.

original: @106b de yang khams mtshungs te /
analyzed: @106b de yang khams mtshungs te /
translated: That is similar to the realm.

original: khams mnyam pa rnams kyi de kho na skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: khams mnyam pa rnams kyi de kho na skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Only that of the same realm is born,

original: mi mtshungs pa rnams kyi ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa rnams kyi ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: not that of a dissimilar realm.

original: mthong ba'i chos la rnam gnyis po //🔽thams cad las dang las kyi de //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la rnam gnyis po // thams cad las dang las kyi de //
translated: In the present life, it is of two kinds.

original: tha dad par ni skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: tha dad par ni skye 'gyur zhing //
translated: All of it arises separately from action and its result.

original: rnam par smin kyang gnas pa yin //
analyzed: rnam par smin kyang gnas pa yin //
translated: Even when it ripens, it endures.

original: chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i chos de ni mthong ba'i chos la ste tshe 'di la zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i chos de ni mthong ba'i chos la ste tshe 'di la zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The phenomenon called non-perishing is of two kinds in the present life, the life in which it occurs, by the division into contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: tshul gnyis po thams cad kyi ste sems pa dang bsams pa'i las kyi rang bzhin can gyi las dang las kyi chud mi za ba re re skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul gnyis po thams cad kyi ste sems pa dang bsams pa'i las kyi rang bzhin can gyi las dang las kyi chud mi za ba re re skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And for each action, which is of the nature of intention and intentional action, and for each non-expiration of action, there is a single non-expiration of action.

original: chud mi za ba de ni rnam par smin kyang ste rnam par smin pa na gdon mi za bar 'gag pa ma yin la /
analyzed: chud mi za ba de ni rnam par smin kyang ste rnam par smin pa na gdon mi za bar 'gag pa ma yin la /
translated: This non-expiration of action is not necessarily interrupted when it ripens.

original: yod du zin kyang dpang rgya ror gyur pha ltar yang 'bras bu 'byin par ni byed mi nus so //
analyzed: yod du zin kyang dpang rgya ror gyur pha ltar yang 'bras bu 'byin par ni byed mi nus so //
translated: Even though it exists, it cannot produce its effect, like a seed which is burned by fire.🔽It is interrupted when the effect is obtained,

original: de ni 'bras bu 'pho ba dang // shi bar gyur na 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu 'pho ba dang // shi bar gyur na 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: or when one dies.

original: de yi rnam dbye zag med dang // zag dang bcas par shes par bya //
analyzed: de yi rnam dbye zag med dang // zag dang bcas par shes par bya //
translated: It should be known that it is of two types: pure and impure.

original: de la 'bras bu 'pho ba na 'gag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu 'pho ba na 'gag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: When the effect is obtained, it is interrupted, as the verse says:

original: bsgoms pas spang ba nyid kyang yin //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //🔽shi bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: bsgoms pas spang ba nyid kyang yin // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o // shi bar gyur pa na /
translated: It is also abandoned through cultivation.

original: 'gag pa ni ji skad du /🔽de ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe //
analyzed: 'gag pa ni ji skad du / de ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe //
translated: When one dies, it is interrupted, as the verse says:🔽It is only at conception

original: gcig pu kho na skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig pu kho na skye bar 'gyur //
translated: that it is produced.

original: zhes bsnyad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bsnyad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is what is meant.

original: de yang zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, those that are contaminated are contaminated,

original: zag pa med pa rnams kyi ni zag pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams kyi ni zag pa med pa yin te /
translated: and those that are uncontaminated are uncontaminated.

original: de ltar de'i rnam par dbye ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de'i rnam par dbye ba shes par bya'o //
translated: This is how the classification of karma should be understood.

original: de'i phyir da ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar na /
translated: Therefore, now,🔽Emptiness and non-annihilation,

original: stong pa nyid dang chad med dang // 'khor ba dang ni rtag pa min //🔽las rnams chud mi za ba'i chos //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang chad med dang // 'khor ba dang ni rtag pa min // las rnams chud mi za ba'i chos //
translated: and also not eternal,

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni bstan pa yin //
translated: The teaching of the Buddha🔽Is that karma does not perish.

original: gang gi phyir las ni byas nas 'gag gi rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir las ni byas nas 'gag gi rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ma yin la /
translated: Because karma, having been performed, ceases, it does not endure by its intrinsic nature.

original: las rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: las rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because karma does not endure by its intrinsic nature,

original: stong pa nyid du thal ba yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du thal ba yin no //
translated: it follows that it is empty.

original: de ltar las mi gnas pas chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar las mi gnas pas chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: In that way, because karma does not endure, it does not follow that it is a view of annihilation,

original: chud mi za ba yongs su bzung bas las kyi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chud mi za ba yongs su bzung bas las kyi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the result of karma exists due to the retention of non-perishing.

original: rnam par smin pa med na ni las chad par lta bar 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa med na ni las chad par lta bar 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: If there were no ripening, then karma would be annihilated.

original: chud mi za ba'i tshos yod pa'i phyir dang / sa bon gyi rgyun dang chos mthun pa'i rtag pa med pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang rigs dang skye gnas dang / khams sna tshogs pa'i dbye bas @107a * //
analyzed: chud mi za ba'i tshos yod pa'i phyir dang / sa bon gyi rgyun dang chos mthun pa'i rtag pa med pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang rigs dang skye gnas dang / khams sna tshogs pa'i dbye bas @107a * //
translated: Since there is no destruction, and since there is no eternal karma, which would be the opposite of the continuum of seeds, the various migrations, types of birth, and realms are established.

original: phye ba / 'gro lnga'i 'khor ba bkra ba yang grub pa yin no //🔽gang gi phyir las rang gi ngo bos mi gnas par khas blangs pas rtag par smra bar thal ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: phye ba / 'gro lnga'i 'khor ba bkra ba yang grub pa yin no // gang gi phyir las rang gi ngo bos mi gnas par khas blangs pas rtag par smra bar thal ba yang ma yin la /
translated: The beautiful cycle of the five migrations is established.🔽Since it is accepted that karma does not endure inherently, it is not the case that the absurd consequence follows that karma is eternal.

original: chud mi za ba yod pa'i phyir las rnams kyang chud mi za ba zhes bya ba de lta bu'i chos 'di ma rig pa nyid ma lus pa dang bral bas sad par gyur pa /
analyzed: chud mi za ba yod pa'i phyir las rnams kyang chud mi za ba zhes bya ba de lta bu'i chos 'di ma rig pa nyid ma lus pa dang bral bas sad par gyur pa /
translated: Since there is no destruction, karma does not disintegrate.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa de'i phyir sngar gzhan gyis /🔽gal te smin pa'i dus bar du //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa de'i phyir sngar gzhan gyis / gal te smin pa'i dus bar du //
translated: Since the Blessed Buddha taught this doctrine, which is free from all ignorance,🔽and since he awakened from ignorance,🔽others previously have not taught this doctrine.🔽If it endures until the time of ripening,

original: gnas na las de rtag par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnas na las de rtag par 'gyur //
translated: Karma would be eternal.

original: gal te 'gags na 'gags gyur pa //
analyzed: gal te 'gags na 'gags gyur pa //
translated: If it ceased, having ceased,

original: ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
translated: How could it generate an effect?

original: zhes gang smras pa de kho bo cag gi phyogs la mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de kho bo cag gi phyogs la mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, what you said is untenable in our system.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis brjod pa'i brtag pa kho na rigs so zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis brjod pa'i brtag pa kho na rigs so zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, only our analysis is correct.

original: 'di la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la bshad par bya ste /
translated: Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gang dag las nyid kyang mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'bras bu'i rgyu can gyi rtsod pa byed pa khyed cag ci'i phyir dri za'i grong khyer gyi rab 'gyel gyis dogs pas ches yid byung bar gyur zhing de srung ba'i ngal bas tshegs su 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dag las nyid kyang mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'bras bu'i rgyu can gyi rtsod pa byed pa khyed cag ci'i phyir dri za'i grong khyer gyi rab 'gyel gyis dogs pas ches yid byung bar gyur zhing de srung ba'i ngal bas tshegs su 'gyur /
translated: Since karma is untenable for you, why are you, who argue on the basis of effects, so terrified of the collapse of the city of gandharvas that you are exhausted by the trouble of defending it?

original: 'di ltar gal te las rang gi ngo bos skye bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te las rang gi ngo bos skye bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: In this regard, if karma arose due to its own intrinsic reality,

original: de rnam par ma smin gyi bar du gnas par rtag pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de rnam par ma smin gyi bar du gnas par rtag pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: it would be permanent because it would endure until it matured.

original: 'jig pas chad par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'jig pas chad par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Since it would be destroyed, it would be annihilated.

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyis stong pas las skye ba med pa de'i tshe na gang las dpyad pa 'dir 'gyur ba de la gnas pa dang 'jig pa yod par ga la 'gyur //🔽'dir / gang phyir las ni skye ba med //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyis stong pas las skye ba med pa de'i tshe na gang las dpyad pa 'dir 'gyur ba de la gnas pa dang 'jig pa yod par ga la 'gyur // 'dir / gang phyir las ni skye ba med //
translated: When karma does not arise due to being empty of intrinsic reality, then how could that which is the basis of this analysis have endurance and disintegration?🔽Here, it is said:

original: ces smras pa /
analyzed: ces smras pa /
translated: “Because karma does not arise,🔽it does not endure.”

original: slob dpon gyis /🔽'di ltar rang bzhin med de'i phyir //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis / 'di ltar rang bzhin med de'i phyir //
translated: The master said:

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: “Because it is devoid of intrinsic reality.”

original: gang gi phyir las rang bzhin med pa de'i phyir skye ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir las rang bzhin med pa de'i phyir skye ba med do //
translated: Because karma is devoid of intrinsic reality, it does not arise.

original: gal te de ltar las rang bzhin med pas mi skye na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar las rang bzhin med pas mi skye na /
translated: If karma does not arise because it is devoid of intrinsic reality,

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: how is it that the Bhagavān said:

original: lus can rnams kyi las rnams ni //
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi las rnams ni //
translated: “The karma of embodied beings

original: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
translated: does not disintegrate even in a hundred eons.

original: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
analyzed: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
translated: When the assemblage and the time are right,

original: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //🔽zhes de skad du gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur // zhes de skad du gsungs she na /
translated: the fruit will ripen.”

original: brjod pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa ni /
analyzed: brjod pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa ni /
translated: The Bhagavān’s intention is this:

original: gang phyir de ni ma skyes pa //
analyzed: gang phyir de ni ma skyes pa //
translated: “Because it does not arise,

original: de phyir chud zar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyir chud zar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it does not disintegrate.”

original: zhes bya ba de ltar yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ltar yin te /
translated: So it is, and

original: de'i phyir tshul 'dis ni kho bo cag la gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul 'dis ni kho bo cag la gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: thus this method does not harm us.

original: las rang bzhin med do zhes bya ba de ni de ltar yin par gdon mi za bar shes par bya ste /🔽gzhan du na /
analyzed: las rang bzhin med do zhes bya ba de ni de ltar yin par gdon mi za bar shes par bya ste / gzhan du na /
translated: It must be understood that karma has no intrinsic reality, for if it did,🔽then karma would be permanent.

original: gal te las la rang bzhin yod //
analyzed: gal te las la rang bzhin yod //
translated: If karma had intrinsic reality,

original: rtag @107b par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
analyzed: rtag @107b par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
translated: it would be permanent, without a doubt.

original: las ni byas pa ma yin 'gyur //
analyzed: las ni byas pa ma yin 'gyur //
translated: Karma would not be created,

original: rtag la bya ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag la bya ba med phyir ro //
translated: because the permanent is devoid of action.

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis las yod par gyur na ni the tshom med par de rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis las yod par gyur na ni the tshom med par de rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: If karma had intrinsic reality, then without a doubt it would be permanent,

original: rang bzhin la gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin la gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no change in intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir las ni byas pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir las ni byas pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore karma would not be created.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir rtag la bya ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag la bya ba med phyir ro //
translated: Because the permanent is devoid of action.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig yod pa yin la /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig yod pa yin la /
translated: That which is permanent is existent.

original: gang yod pa de ni bya ba mi 'thad pas rgyu la mi ltos so //
analyzed: gang yod pa de ni bya ba mi 'thad pas rgyu la mi ltos so //
translated: And that which is existent is not tenable as action, because it does not depend on a cause.

original: de'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las ma byas par 'jig rten la rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las ma byas par 'jig rten la rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, without performing virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, one would experience their ripening in the world.🔽Therefore:

original: de'i phyir / ci ste las ni ma byas na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ci ste las ni ma byas na //
translated: If one did not perform an action,

original: ma byas pa dang phrad 'jig 'gyur //
analyzed: ma byas pa dang phrad 'jig 'gyur //
translated: one would encounter and be destroyed by that which was not done.

original: tshangs spyod gnas pa ma yin pa'ang //
analyzed: tshangs spyod gnas pa ma yin pa'ang //
translated: One who does not abide in pure conduct

original: de la skyon du thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de la skyon du thal bar 'gyur //
translated: would also encounter that fault.

original: gal te las byas pa ma yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te las byas pa ma yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: If one did not perform an action, one would encounter and be destroyed by that which was not done.

original: gang gi srog gcod pa'i las ma byas pa de la yang las de ma byas kyang yod pas 'di de dang 'brel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi srog gcod pa'i las ma byas pa de la yang las de ma byas kyang yod pas 'di de dang 'brel ba'i phyir /
translated: If one did not perform the action of taking life, then even though one did not perform that action, it would exist. Because this is related to that,

original: ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: one would encounter and be destroyed by that which was not done.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ma yin pa yang phyogs de la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ma yin pa yang phyogs de la 'gyur ro //
translated: One who does not abide in pure conduct would also encounter that fault.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa yongs su dag pa rnams la yang mi tshangs par spyod pa ma byas par yod pas thams cad tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa la gnas pa'i phyir 'ga' yang mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa yongs su dag pa rnams la yang mi tshangs par spyod pa ma byas par yod pas thams cad tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa la gnas pa'i phyir 'ga' yang mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And since those who maintain pure celibacy would not engage in sexual intercourse, no one would attain nirvana, because no one would maintain celibacy.

original: gzhan yang tha snyad thams cad nyid dang yang //
analyzed: gzhan yang tha snyad thams cad nyid dang yang //
translated: Moreover, all conventions

original: 'gal bar 'gyur ba the tshom med //
analyzed: 'gal bar 'gyur ba the tshom med //
translated: would be contradictory, without doubt.🔽The distinction between

original: bsod nams dang ni sdig byed pa'i //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ni sdig byed pa'i //
translated: the performance of virtue and the performance of evil

original: rnam par dbye ba'ang 'thad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'ang 'thad mi 'gyur //
translated: would be untenable.

original: gang dag zhing rmo ba dang tshong dang ba lang 'tsho ba la sogs pa'i bya ba 'bras bu'i don du rtsom pa de dag thams cad kyis ma byas bzhin du yod pa'i phyir don med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang dag zhing rmo ba dang tshong dang ba lang 'tsho ba la sogs pa'i bya ba 'bras bu'i don du rtsom pa de dag thams cad kyis ma byas bzhin du yod pa'i phyir don med par 'gyur la /
translated: Since all those who engage in activities such as farming, commerce, and cattle herding would do so without working, their activities would be pointless.

original: bum pa gyis shig snam bu thogs shig bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad thams cad dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bum pa gyis shig snam bu thogs shig bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad thams cad dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And all mundane conventions such as “Make a pot,” “Wear a blanket,” and so on would be contradictory.

original: bum pa la sogs pa thams cad yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa thams cad yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because all things such as pots exist.

original: 'di ni bsod nams byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsod nams byed pa'o //
translated: “This one is a merit-maker,”

original: 'di ni sdig pa byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sdig pa byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: “This one is a sinner,”

original: bsod nams dang sdig pa byed pa gnyis po re re la yang ma byas kyang bsod nams dag yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan yang / de ni rnam smin smin gyur pa //
analyzed: bsod nams dang sdig pa byed pa gnyis po re re la yang ma byas kyang bsod nams dag yod pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang / de ni rnam smin smin gyur pa //
translated: because even though each of the two, the merit-maker and the sinner, has not done the other’s action, they have merit and sin.🔽Moreover,

original: yang dang yang du rnam smin 'gyur //
analyzed: yang dang yang du rnam smin 'gyur //
translated: that which has already ripened would ripen again and again.

original: gal te @108a * //
analyzed: gal te @108a * //
translated: If it existed

original: rang bzhin yod na ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod na ni //
translated: by virtue of its own nature,

original: gang phyir las gnas de yi phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir las gnas de yi phyir //
translated: then because the karma would endure,

original: las rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pas kyang yang dang yang du rnam par smin pa 'byin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pas kyang yang dang yang du rnam par smin pa 'byin par 'gyur te /
translated: the karma that has already ripened would again and again yield its ripened effect,

original: rnam par smin pa smin par ma gyur ba'i gnas skabs ltar rang gi ngo bo las ma nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa smin par ma gyur ba'i gnas skabs ltar rang gi ngo bo las ma nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its own nature would not deteriorate, just as it was in the state of not having ripened.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gal te las rang bzhin yod do snyam du sems na ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid yin dang / gang gi phyir las rnam par gnas pa yod pa de'i phyir the tshom med par ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gal te las rang bzhin yod do snyam du sems na ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid yin dang / gang gi phyir las rnam par gnas pa yod pa de'i phyir the tshom med par ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: enduring, and since karma would endure, there is no doubt that the errors🔽previously explained would ensue.

original: de'i phyir las rang bzhin med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir las rang bzhin med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, karma is essenceless.

analyzed: gang gi phyir las rang bzhin med pa de'i tshe kho bo cag de skad du rnam par 'chad bdag la rtag pa dang / chad par lta bar thal ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Since karma is essenceless, we do not incur the errors of eternalism and🔽annihilationism.🔽Here, someone might say that karma does exist essentially because its

original: las ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid yin te de'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dir gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni rgyu med de /
analyzed: las ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid yin te de'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro // 'dir gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni rgyu med de /

analyzed: rus sbal gyi spu'i gos bzhin no //
translated: Here, that which does not exist has no cause, like the cloth of a turtle’s🔽fur.

original: las kyi rgyu nyon mongs pa rnams ni yod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: las kyi rgyu nyon mongs pa rnams ni yod pa yang yin te /
translated: The causes of karma, the afflictions, do exist.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so //
translated: “Conditioned by ignorance, there are karmic processes.”

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “Conditioned by grasping, becoming comes to be.”

original: de'i phyir las yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir las yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore karma does exist.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: This is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gang gi phyir /
translated: Why?🔽Because this karma

original: las 'di nyon mongs ba dag nyid la //
analyzed: las 'di nyon mongs ba dag nyid la //
translated: Has the nature of afflictions.

original: nyon mongs de dag yang dag min //
analyzed: nyon mongs de dag yang dag min //
translated: Those afflictions are not real.

original: gal te nyon mongs yang dag min //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs yang dag min //
translated: If afflictions are not real,

original: las ni yang dag ji ltar yin //
analyzed: las ni yang dag ji ltar yin //
translated: How can karma be real?

original: 'dir las 'di nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid ste nyon mongs pa'i rgyu can yin la nyon mongs pa de dag kyang yang dag par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir las 'di nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid ste nyon mongs pa'i rgyu can yin la nyon mongs pa de dag kyang yang dag par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here karma has the nature of afflictions; it has the cause of afflictions. Those afflictions are not real because it will be explained:🔽Those that arise in dependence on

analyzed: gang dag sdug dang mi sdug dang / phyin ci log la rten 'byung ba //
translated: The attractive, unattractive, and misconceptions

original: de dag rang bzhin las med de //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin las med de //
translated: Do not exist by way of their essence.

analyzed: de phyir nyon mongs yang dag med // ces 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir de ltar nyon mongs pa de dag yang dag pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar nyon mongs pa de dag yang dag pa ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, if those afflictions are not real,

original: de'i tshe de dag gi rgyu can las gang yin pa de dag yang dag par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag gi rgyu can las gang yin pa de dag yang dag par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: In that case, how could they be the effects of karma?

original: de'i phyir las rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir las rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, karma does not exist essentially.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might argue as follows:

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Karma and afflictions exist.

original: de'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because their effects exist.

original: 'dir las dang nyon mongs pa dag gi 'bras bu lus zhes bya ba dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir las dang nyon mongs pa dag gi 'bras bu lus zhes bya ba dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Here, the so-called body, which is the effect of karma and the afflictions, is observed.

original: gang gi 'bras bu dmigs pa de ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi 'bras bu dmigs pa de ni yod pa yin te /
translated: That which is observed to be an effect exists.

original: yod pa ma yin pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni ma @108b mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni ma @108b mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the effects of that which does not exist, such as the sky flower, are not seen.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te de dag gi 'bras bu lus zhes bya ba yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te de dag gi 'bras bu lus zhes bya ba yod na ni /
translated: If the so-called body, which is the effect of karma and the afflictions, exists,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag kyang yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag kyang yod par 'gyur na /
translated: then karma and the afflictions would also exist.

original: yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni //
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni //
translated: But this is not the case. In order to demonstrate this, it says:🔽Karma and the afflictions

original: las rnams kyi ni rkyen du bstan //
analyzed: las rnams kyi ni rkyen du bstan //
translated: Are taught to be conditions of karma.

original: gal te las dang nyon mongs pa //🔽de stong lus la ji ltar brjod //
analyzed: gal te las dang nyon mongs pa // de stong lus la ji ltar brjod //
translated: If karma and affliction

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: are empty, how can you speak of a body?

original: ji ltar las dang nyon mongs pa dag stong pa de ltar ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar las dang nyon mongs pa dag stong pa de ltar ni bstan zin to //
translated: It has been shown how karma and affliction are empty.

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe las dang nyon mongs pa dag nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe de dag gi 'bras bu lus rnams yod pa ma yin pa la brjod pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe las dang nyon mongs pa dag nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe de dag gi 'bras bu lus rnams yod pa ma yin pa la brjod pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, when karma and affliction do not exist, how can you speak of the existence of the body, which is their effect?

original: gang gi phyir de dag yod pa ma yin pa nyid du sngar grub zin pa de'i phyir 'di la brjod par bya ba lhag ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag yod pa ma yin pa nyid du sngar grub zin pa de'i phyir 'di la brjod par bya ba lhag ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Since it has been established earlier that they do not exist, there is not the slightest thing left to say about this.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽las ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / las ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: de'i 'bras bu za ba po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu za ba po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Karma exists essentially because the experiencer of its effect exists.

original: gang yod pa ma yin pa de'i 'bras bu za ba po ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yod pa ma yin pa de'i 'bras bu za ba po ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The experiencer of the effect of that which does not exist does not exist.

original: dper na / nam mkha'i aa mra'i shing thog bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha'i aa mra'i shing thog bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the sky-flower.

original: las kyi 'bras bu za ba po ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu za ba po ni yod pa yin te /
translated: The experiencer of the result of action exists,

original: ma rig bsgribs pa'i skye bo gang //
analyzed: ma rig bsgribs pa'i skye bo gang //
translated: because the person who is obscured by nescience,

original: sred ldan de ni za ba po //
analyzed: sred ldan de ni za ba po //
translated: who is desirous, is the experiencer.

original: de yang byed las gzhan min zhing /
analyzed: de yang byed las gzhan min zhing /
translated: And that is not different from the agent,

original: de nyid de yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it just that.

original: de la ma rig pa dang mi shes pa dang / mun pa dang rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dag go //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang mi shes pa dang / mun pa dang rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dag go //
translated: Here, nescience, ignorance, darkness, and confusion are synonyms.

original: ma rig pas bsgribs pa ni g-yogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pas bsgribs pa ni g-yogs pa'o //
translated: Obscured by nescience means covered by it.

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar yang dang yang du skye bas na skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar yang dang yang du skye bas na skye ba ste /
translated: Repeated birth in the five destinies of cyclic existence is rebirth.

original: sems can dang / gang zag dang / srog chags zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rnam grangs dag go //
analyzed: sems can dang / gang zag dang / srog chags zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rnam grangs dag go //
translated: Sentient being, person, and living being are synonyms for that.

original: sred pa dang 'dod chags dang chags pa dang rnam par chags pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam grangs dag go //
analyzed: sred pa dang 'dod chags dang chags pa dang rnam par chags pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam grangs dag go //
translated: The words desirous, attached, and passion are synonyms.

original: ldan pa ni 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni 'ching ba'o //
translated: Possessing is bondage.

original: srid pa'i 'ching ba 'di la yod pas na sred ldan te //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'ching ba 'di la yod pas na sred ldan te //
translated: Because this bondage of existence exists, it is desirous.

original: sred pa'i 'ching ba can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sred pa'i 'ching ba can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “bound by the fetter of craving” is that.

original: ji skad du mdo las //
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las //
translated: As a sūtra explains:🔽Sentient beings are obscured by ignorance,

original: ma rig bsgribs pa'i sems can dag / sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba can //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma rig bsgribs pa'i sems can dag / sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba can // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and are fettered by the fetter of craving.

original: 'on kyang sdig pa'i las 'di ni rang gis byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang sdig pa'i las 'di ni rang gis byas pa yin la /
translated: However, this sinful karma is created by oneself,🔽and its karmic maturation is experienced by oneself.

original: 'di'i rnam par smin pa ni rang nyid kyis so sor nyams su myong bar bya ba yin no zhes 'byung ba las na de ni las kyi 'bras bu'i za ba po'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rnam par smin pa ni rang nyid kyis so sor nyams su myong bar bya ba yin no zhes 'byung ba las na de ni las kyi 'bras bu'i za ba po'o //
translated: Therefore, the self is the experiencer of the results of karma.

original: de yang byed pa po las gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: de yang byed pa po las gzhan ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, the self is not different from the agent,

original: de nyid de yang ma yin te de @109a * //
analyzed: de nyid de yang ma yin te de @109a * //
translated: but it is also not that itself,

original: nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is inexpressible as either the same as or different from that.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu za ba po yod pa'i phyir las yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu za ba po yod pa'i phyir las yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because the experiencer of the result exists, karma exists.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: This should be addressed as follows:

original: gal te las nyid yod na las kyi byed pa po dang / 'bras bu za ba po yang yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te las nyid yod na las kyi byed pa po dang / 'bras bu za ba po yang yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If karma itself existed, then the agent of karma and the experiencer of the result would also exist.

original: yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not exist.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir ni las 'di ni //🔽rkyen las byung ba ma yin zhing //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ni las 'di ni // rkyen las byung ba ma yin zhing //
translated: Because this karma🔽does not arise from conditions,

original: rkyen min las byung yod min pa //
analyzed: rkyen min las byung yod min pa //
translated: and does not arise from non-conditions,

original: de phyir byed pa po yang med //
analyzed: de phyir byed pa po yang med //
translated: therefore there is no agent.

original: gal te las dang byed med na //
analyzed: gal te las dang byed med na //
translated: If there is no karma and no agent,

original: las skyes 'bras bu ga la yod //
analyzed: las skyes 'bras bu ga la yod //
translated: how can there be an effect arisen from karma?

original: ci ste 'bras bu yod min na /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu yod min na /
translated: If there is no effect,

original: za ba po lta ga la yod //
analyzed: za ba po lta ga la yod //
translated: how can there be an experiencer?

original: gal te las zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni /🔽de rkyen las byung ba'am /
analyzed: gal te las zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni / de rkyen las byung ba'am /
translated: If something called “karma” exists,

original: rkyen ma yin pa las byung ba zhig tu 'gyur grang /
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa las byung ba zhig tu 'gyur grang /
translated: it would have to arise from conditions or from non-conditions.

original: re zhig gal te rkyen las byung bar 'dod na ni /
analyzed: re zhig gal te rkyen las byung bar 'dod na ni /
translated: First, if you assert that it arises from conditions,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is illogical,

original: rkyen brtag par bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen brtag par bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the analysis of conditions has already been explained.

original: ci ste rkyen ma yin pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: ci ste rkyen ma yin pa las byung ba ste /
translated: But if it arises from non-conditions,

original: rgyu med pa yin na ni de yang /
analyzed: rgyu med pa yin na ni de yang /
translated: that is, if it is without a cause,

original: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang / rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas byed pa po dang las brtag pa las rgyas par bstan zin to //
analyzed: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang / rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas byed pa po dang las brtag pa las rgyas par bstan zin to //
translated: then this has been extensively explained in the analysis of the cause and effect and the agent in the context of the argument against causeless arising.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar las 'di rkyen las byung ba'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar las 'di rkyen las byung ba'am /
translated: Because in this way, this karma does not arise from conditions,

original: rkyen ma yin pa las byung ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa las byung ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: nor does it arise from nonconditions.

original: las 'di'i byed pa po yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las 'di'i byed pa po yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the agent of this karma also does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar las dang byed pa po yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe las las skyes pa'i 'bras bu med pa ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar las dang byed pa po yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe las las skyes pa'i 'bras bu med pa ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: When karma and the agent do not exist in this way, how could a result arisen from karma exist?

original: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na 'bras bu za ba po yod par yang lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na 'bras bu za ba po yod par yang lta ga la 'gyur te /
translated: If a result does not exist, how could one who experiences the result exist?

original: 'di dag thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all of these do not exist essentially.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: gal te de ltar khyod kyis dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par rnam par gzhag na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar khyod kyis dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par rnam par gzhag na /
translated: If you posit that things lack essence in this way,

original: 'o na ni gang bcom ldan 'das kyis rang gis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni rang nyid kyis myong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes gsungs pa de dag thams cad tshul 'dis bsal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na ni gang bcom ldan 'das kyis rang gis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni rang nyid kyis myong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes gsungs pa de dag thams cad tshul 'dis bsal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Well then, all of the statements of the Bhagavān that “One experiences the karmic maturation of karma that one has done oneself” would be refuted by this method.

original: las dang 'bras bu la skur ba btab pa'i phyir na khyod med pa pa gtso bor gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu la skur ba btab pa'i phyir na khyod med pa pa gtso bor gyur pa yin no //
translated: And because you deprecate karma and its effects, you are the foremost nihilist.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: kho bo cag med pa pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag med pa pa ma yin te /
translated: We are not nihilists.

original: kho bo cag ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis su smra ba bkag nas gnyis med pa'i lam mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis su smra ba bkag nas gnyis med pa'i lam mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: We clarify the path that is free of the two extremes, which is the path that goes to the city of nirvana, having refuted the two extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: kho bo cag ni las dang byed pa po dang 'bras bu la sogs pa @109b med do zhes smra ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni las dang byed pa po dang 'bras bu la sogs pa @109b med do zhes smra ba yang ma yin te /
translated: We do not say that karma, agents, effects, and so on do not exist.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what do you say?

original: 'di dag rang bzhin med do zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag rang bzhin med do zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: We posit that these do not intrinsically exist.

original: ci ste rang bzhin med pa rnams la bya ba byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir nyes pa po na 'dug pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste rang bzhin med pa rnams la bya ba byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir nyes pa po na 'dug pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the error remains because it is untenable that those lacking intrinsic reality perform functions,

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: rang bzhin dang bcas pa rnams kho na la bya ba ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / rang bzhin med pa rnams kho na la bya ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bcas pa rnams kho na la bya ba ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / rang bzhin med pa rnams kho na la bya ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because functions are not seen in those that possess intrinsic reality, and because functions are seen in those that lack intrinsic reality.

original: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa rang bzhin med par gyur pa dag kho na 'jig rten na rang gi bya ba byed par dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa rang bzhin med par gyur pa dag kho na 'jig rten na rang gi bya ba byed par dmigs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, only such things as pots, which are devoid of intrinsic reality, are seen in the world to perform their own functions.

original: gzhan yang don 'di ni dpe ches gsal ba 'di las nges par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang don 'di ni dpe ches gsal ba 'di las nges par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, this point should be ascertained from this very clear example.

original: ji ltar ston pas sprul pa ni //
analyzed: ji ltar ston pas sprul pa ni //
translated: Just as the Teacher emanates

original: rdzu 'phrul phun tshogs kyis sprul zhing //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul phun tshogs kyis sprul zhing //
translated: emanations by the perfection of his miraculous powers,

original: sprul pa de yang sprul pa na //
analyzed: sprul pa de yang sprul pa na //
translated: and those emanations again emanate

original: slar yang gzhan ni sprul pa ltar //
analyzed: slar yang gzhan ni sprul pa ltar //
translated: other emanations,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: so it is.

original: dper na / ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul phun tshogs te /
analyzed: dper na / ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul phun tshogs te /
translated: For example, the Teacher, the Lord Buddha, emanates emanations by the perfection of his miraculous powers.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus sprul pa sprul la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus sprul pa sprul la /
translated: By the power of his magical emanation, he emanates another emanation.

original: sprul pa de yang ste gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis sprul pa de slar yang ste phyis gzhan te sprul pa gzhan po sprul pa yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa de yang ste gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis sprul pa de slar yang ste phyis gzhan te sprul pa gzhan po sprul pa yin no //
translated: And that emanation, that emanation of the Blessed Buddha, again, later, another, another emanation.

original: de la sprul pa gang zhig sprul pa gzhan sprul pa po de ni stong zhing rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: de la sprul pa gang zhig sprul pa gzhan sprul pa po de ni stong zhing rang bzhin med de /
translated: And that emanation which emanates another emanation, that emanator is empty, without intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: The meaning is that he is devoid of the intrinsic nature of a Tathāgata.

original: yang gang zhig sprul pas sprul pa'i sprul pa gzhan gang yin pa de yang stong zhing rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: yang gang zhig sprul pas sprul pa'i sprul pa gzhan gang yin pa de yang stong zhing rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: And also that which is emanated by that emanation, that other emanation, that is also empty, without intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is devoid of the intrinsic nature of a Tathāgata.

original: ji ltar der rang bzhin med pa rnams la rang bzhin med pa'i bya ba byed pa nyid dang las dang bya ba byed pa po'i brjod par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: ji ltar der rang bzhin med pa rnams la rang bzhin med pa'i bya ba byed pa nyid dang las dang bya ba byed pa po'i brjod par 'gyur ba /
translated: Just as, in that way, those without intrinsic nature perform the action of those without intrinsic nature, and the action, the agent of the action, and the expression are all tenable,

original: de bzhin byed po des las gang //
analyzed: de bzhin byed po des las gang //
translated: so too, by that agent, what action is there?

original: byas pa'ang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin //
analyzed: byas pa'ang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin //
translated: And the action is like an emanation.

original: dper na sprul pas sprul gzhan zhig / sprul pa mdzad pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sprul pas sprul gzhan zhig / sprul pa mdzad pa de bzhin no //
translated: Just as an emanation emanates another emanation,🔽So it is here.

original: 'dir las kyi byed pa po gang yin pa de ni sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dir las kyi byed pa po gang yin pa de ni sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin te /
translated: The agent of the action is like an emanation,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin la /
translated: because it is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i byed pa po des las gang cung zad cig byed pa de yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i byed pa po des las gang cung zad cig byed pa de yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin te /
translated: And the action that is performed by that agent, which is empty of intrinsic reality, is also empty of intrinsic reality.

original: dper na / sprul pas sprul pa gzhan sprul pa de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na / sprul pas sprul pa gzhan sprul pa de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is just like an emanation emanating another emanation.

original: de'i phyir dbu ma pa gnyis su med par smra ba rnams la log par lta ba ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbu ma pa gnyis su med par smra ba rnams la log par lta ba ga la yod /
translated: Therefore, how can the Madhyamikas, who advocate nonduality, have the view of nihilism?

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang tshe bde gshegs gtam rnams ston pa na //🔽mgon po srang bzhud mi la thugs brtse'i phyir //
analyzed: gang tshe bde gshegs gtam rnams ston pa na // mgon po srang bzhud mi la thugs brtse'i phyir //
translated: When the Sugata’s teachings are taught,

original: rgyal @110a * //
analyzed: rgyal @110a * //
translated: The Lord, out of compassion for people who are poor,

original: bas der ni sprul pa rnam sprul te //
analyzed: bas der ni sprul pa rnam sprul te //
translated: The Victor emanates emanations there

original: de dag la yang sangs rgyas chos bzang ston //
analyzed: de dag la yang sangs rgyas chos bzang ston //
translated: And teaches them the excellent Dharma of the Buddha.

original: srog chags brgya stong dag gis de thos nas //
analyzed: srog chags brgya stong dag gis de thos nas //
translated: Hundreds of thousands of living beings, hearing that,

original: sangs rgyas ye shes mchog la smon lam 'debs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ye shes mchog la smon lam 'debs //
translated: aspire to the supreme wisdom of the Buddha.

original: nam bdag 'di 'dra'i ye shes thob snyam ste //
analyzed: nam bdag 'di 'dra'i ye shes thob snyam ste //
translated: “When will I attain such wisdom?”

original: bsam pa mkhyen pas rgyal bas de lung ston //
analyzed: bsam pa mkhyen pas rgyal bas de lung ston //
translated: The Victorious One, knowing their thoughts, prophesies their enlightenment.

original: gang gis rgyal ba mi dbang spyan drangs pa //
analyzed: gang gis rgyal ba mi dbang spyan drangs pa //
translated: Those who invite the Victorious One, the Lord of Humans,

original: de yi sbyin pa mu mtha' med 'gyur te //
analyzed: de yi sbyin pa mu mtha' med 'gyur te //
translated: their generosity becomes limitless.

original: rnyed mchog bsam gyis mi khyab de rnyed ces //
analyzed: rnyed mchog bsam gyis mi khyab de rnyed ces //
translated: “They will attain the supreme, inconceivable gain!”

original: la la dag ni de la mos pa bskyed //
analyzed: la la dag ni de la mos pa bskyed //
translated: Some generate interest in that.

original: ces rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus it is stated extensively.

original: 'dul ba las kyang /
analyzed: 'dul ba las kyang /
translated: Also, in the Vinaya,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sdig pa can gyi dge slong mi mthun pa zhig sprul la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sdig pa can gyi dge slong mi mthun pa zhig sprul la /
translated: the Blessed One emanated an immoral monk who was disagreeable.

original: de'i tshig gis tshul khrims dang ldan pa la rnam par dag par khas 'ches pa dang 'grogs par yang bcas so zhes 'don to //
analyzed: de'i tshig gis tshul khrims dang ldan pa la rnam par dag par khas 'ches pa dang 'grogs par yang bcas so zhes 'don to //
translated: By his words, he made it a rule to associate with those who have pure ethics and pure commitments.🔽The example of the emanation is not only tenable as the view of essencelessness,

original: de la sprul pa'i dpes rang bzhin med par lta ba 'thad pa'i ngo bo yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de la sprul pa'i dpes rang bzhin med par lta ba 'thad pa'i ngo bo yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: but also as the view of the reality of the ultimate.

original: gzhan yang dpe 'di dag gis kyang dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par gsal bar shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang dpe 'di dag gis kyang dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par gsal bar shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that these examples also clearly show that things do not intrinsically exist, it is said:🔽Afflictions, karma, bodies,🔽agents, and effects🔽are like a city of gandharvas,

original: nyon mongs las dang lus rnams dang // byed pa po dang 'bras bu dag / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dag / smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs las dang lus rnams dang // byed pa po dang 'bras bu dag / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dag / smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: like a mirage, like a dream.

original: de la nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: Here, afflictions are desire and so on,

original: sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud dag nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud dag nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they afflict the mental continua of sentient beings.

original: las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba dag go //
analyzed: las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba dag go //
translated: Karma is virtuous, nonvirtuous, and stable.

original: lus ni khog pa dag go //
analyzed: lus ni khog pa dag go //
translated: Bodies are the physical supports.

original: byed pa po ni bdag rnams so //
analyzed: byed pa po ni bdag rnams so //
translated: Agents are selves.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa dang bdag po dang rgyu mthun pa rnams te ;
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa dang bdag po dang rgyu mthun pa rnams te ;
translated: Effects are the ripened, the dominant, and the natural.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i don de dag ni dri za'i grong khyer gyi rnam pa la sogs pa ltar rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i don de dag ni dri za'i grong khyer gyi rnam pa la sogs pa ltar rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: These objects of afflictions and so on should be understood to be essenceless, like a city of gandharvas and so on.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin khas ma blangs pas dbu ma pa rnams kho na la rtag pa dang chad par lta ba gnyis su thal ba med pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin khas ma blangs pas dbu ma pa rnams kho na la rtag pa dang chad par lta ba gnyis su thal ba med pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since the Madhyamikas do not accept the intrinsic reality of things, it should be understood that only they are free from the errors of reification and repudiation.

original: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa rnam par dpyod pa der brtsad pa ngan pa lhag ma'i brgal ba dang lan dag ni rgyas par dbu ma la 'jug pa las nges par bya'o //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa rnam par dpyod pa der brtsad pa ngan pa lhag ma'i brgal ba dang lan dag ni rgyas par dbu ma la 'jug pa las nges par bya'o //
translated: The remaining refutations and responses of the bad arguments in the analysis of the relation between action and effect should be ascertained in detail from the Madhyamakavatara.

original: 'dir sprul pa'i dge slong gnyis kyis dge slong dmigs pa ba lnga brgya btul ba 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs @110b pa'i mdo las gsungs pa ma tshang ba med par dper brjod par bya'o //🔽slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: 'dir sprul pa'i dge slong gnyis kyis dge slong dmigs pa ba lnga brgya btul ba 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs @110b pa'i mdo las gsungs pa ma tshang ba med par dper brjod par bya'o // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: Here, the example of the two emanated monks who tamed the five hundred monks who were attached to signs should be cited in full from the Arya-Ratnakutasutra.

original: las dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu bdun pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu bdun pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the seventeenth chapter, the analysis of action and effect, in the Prasannapada composed by Acharya Chandraklrti.

original: // 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: gal te nyon mongs pa rnams dang / las dag dang / lus rnams dang / byed pa po dag dang / 'bras bu rnams te /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa rnams dang / las dag dang / lus rnams dang / byed pa po dag dang / 'bras bu rnams te /
translated: If afflictions, actions, bodies, agents, and effects

original: 'di dag thams cad de kho na nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad de kho na nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: are all unreal,

original: 'on kyang dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa ltar de kho na nyid ma yin bzhin du /
analyzed: 'on kyang dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa ltar de kho na nyid ma yin bzhin du /
translated: then like a gandharva city and so on,

original: byis pa rnams la de kho na nyid kyi rnam par snang ba yin na /
analyzed: byis pa rnams la de kho na nyid kyi rnam par snang ba yin na /
translated: they appear to the childish as if they are real,🔽but in reality they are not.

original: yang 'dir de kho na nyid ni gang zhig yin la /
analyzed: yang 'dir de kho na nyid ni gang zhig yin la /
translated: What then is reality?

original: de kho na nyid la 'jug pa yang ji ltar yin /
analyzed: de kho na nyid la 'jug pa yang ji ltar yin /
translated: And how does one engage with reality?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: nang dang phyi'i dngos po ma dmigs pas na /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i dngos po ma dmigs pas na /
translated: Since internal and external things are not observed,

original: nang dang phyi la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa rnam pa thams cad du zad pa 'di ni 'dir de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: nang dang phyi la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa rnam pa thams cad du zad pa 'di ni 'dir de kho na nyid do //
translated: the complete exhaustion of the conception of “I” and “mine” in regard to the internal and external is reality here.

original: de kho na nyid la 'jug pa ni /🔽nyon mongs skyon rnams ma lus 'jig tshogs la //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la 'jug pa ni / nyon mongs skyon rnams ma lus 'jig tshogs la //
translated: Engaging with reality is🔽seeing with wisdom that all faults and afflictions

original: lta las byung bar blo yis mthong gyur zhing //
analyzed: lta las byung bar blo yis mthong gyur zhing //
translated: arise from the view of the transitory collection.

original: bdag ni 'di yi yul du rtogs byas nas //
analyzed: bdag ni 'di yi yul du rtogs byas nas //
translated: Having understood that this is its object,

original: rnal 'byor pa yis bdag ni 'gog par byed //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis bdag ni 'gog par byed //
translated: the yogi/nī stops the self.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par dbu ma la 'jug pa las btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par dbu ma la 'jug pa las btsal bar bya'o //
translated: This and more is to be found in the Madhyamakāvatāra.

original: 'dir ni gnas pa'i phyogs tsam nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni gnas pa'i phyogs tsam nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, I will explain just a small portion of the topic.

original: 'di na rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid la 'jug par 'dod cing /
analyzed: 'di na rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid la 'jug par 'dod cing /
translated: Here, the yogi/nī who wishes to enter into suchness

original: nyon mongs pa dang skyon ma lus pa rab tu spong bar 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang skyon ma lus pa rab tu spong bar 'dod pa ni /
translated: and who wishes to completely eliminate the afflictions and faults

original: 'khor ba 'di ci'i rtsa ba can yin zhes de ltar nye bar rtog par byed la /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'di ci'i rtsa ba can yin zhes de ltar nye bar rtog par byed la /
translated: will think, “What is the root of cyclic existence?”

original: de de ltar nye bar rtog pa na /🔽'khor ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can nyid du mthong zhing bdag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba de'i dmigs pa yin par mthong la bdag ma dmigs pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong zhing /
analyzed: de de ltar nye bar rtog pa na / 'khor ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can nyid du mthong zhing bdag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba de'i dmigs pa yin par mthong la bdag ma dmigs pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong zhing /
translated: When they think in this way,

original: de spangs pas nyon mongs pa dang skyon ma lus pa ldog par mthong pas /
analyzed: de spangs pas nyon mongs pa dang skyon ma lus pa ldog par mthong pas /
translated: they will see that cyclic existence is rooted in the view of the transitory collection and that the self is the object of observation of that view of the transitory collection. They will see that by not observing the self, the view of the transitory collection is eliminated and that by eliminating that, all faults and afflictions are eliminated.

original: gang zhig bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul bdag ces bya ba 'di ci zhig ces ches thog mar bdag kho na la nye bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul bdag ces bya ba 'di ci zhig ces ches thog mar bdag kho na la nye bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: First of all, one should understand the self alone, asking, “What is this so-called self that is the object of self-habits?”

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul de yang brtags pa na phung po'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul de yang brtags pa na phung po'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: When one investigates the object of self-habits, is it the nature of the aggregates,

original: phung po las tha dad pa zhig tu 'gyur grang /
analyzed: phung po las tha dad pa zhig tu 'gyur grang /
translated: or is it different from the aggregates?

original: de la rten dang brten pa dang de dang ldan pa'i phyogs rnams kyang gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi phyogs kyi @111a * //
analyzed: de la rten dang brten pa dang de dang ldan pa'i phyogs rnams kyang gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi phyogs kyi @111a * //
translated: The positions of support, supported, and possessor are included in the positions of sameness and difference,

original: khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir dang / mdor bsdus nas brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir dang / mdor bsdus nas brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are included in the positions of sameness and difference, and because they are asserted to be abbreviated expressions.

original: gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi phyogs gnyis bkag pa nyid kyis bdag dgag par brtsam par bzhed na /
analyzed: gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi phyogs gnyis bkag pa nyid kyis bdag dgag par brtsam par bzhed na /
translated: Therefore, since the positions of sameness and difference are refuted, the self is refuted.

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the self were the aggregates,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: it would have the nature of arising and disintegration.

original: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
translated: If the self were different from the aggregates,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: yang gzhan de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa dang / me dang bud shing brtag par phyogs lnga nye bar bkod la /
analyzed: yang gzhan de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa dang / me dang bud shing brtag par phyogs lnga nye bar bkod la /
translated: Again, the five positions are set forth in the examination of the Tathagata and the examination of fire and fuel.

original: 'dir ni phyogs gnyis nyid yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ni phyogs gnyis nyid yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why are there only two positions here?

original: brjod par bya ste /🔽gang gi phyir /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / gang gi phyir /
translated: This is to be stated.

original: de dag tu phyogs lnga bstan pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de dag tu phyogs lnga bstan pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the five positions are taught in those two,

original: gzhan du bstan pas yang 'dir ma bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan du bstan pas yang 'dir ma bstan te /
translated: they are not taught again here, since they are taught elsewhere.

original: mdor bsdus nas phyogs gnyis shig nye bar bkod de de la gal te phung po bdag yin no zhes rtog na ni des na skye dang 'jig pa can te bdag skye ba dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur te phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa la brten🔽pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas phyogs gnyis shig nye bar bkod de de la gal te phung po bdag yin no zhes rtog na ni des na skye dang 'jig pa can te bdag skye ba dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur te phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you imagine that the aggregates are the self, then the self would be subject to production and destruction, because the aggregates are based on production and destruction.

original: bdag ni de ltar 'dod pa yang ma yin te nyes pa du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ni de ltar 'dod pa yang ma yin te nyes pa du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But the self is not accepted in this way, because many errors would ensue.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / ma byung ba las byung min te //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ma byung ba las byung min te //
translated: It does not arise from what is non existent,

original: 'di la skyon du thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di la skyon du thal bar 'gyur //
translated: because that would entail the error🔽that it is causeless.

original: bdag ni byas par 'gyur ba dang // 'byung ba rgyu med can du'ang 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag ni byas par 'gyur ba dang // 'byung ba rgyu med can du'ang 'gyur //
translated: Arising would be causeless.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: nye bar len nyid bdag ma yin //
analyzed: nye bar len nyid bdag ma yin //
translated: The appropriated are not the self.

original: de byung ba dang 'jig pa yin //🔽nye bar blang ba ji lta bur //
analyzed: de byung ba dang 'jig pa yin // nye bar blang ba ji lta bur //
translated: They arise and disintegrate.🔽How could the appropriator

original: nye bar len po yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: nye bar len po yin par 'gyur //
translated: Be the appropriated?

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: gzhan yang phyogs 'di ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyogs 'di ni //
translated: Moreover, this position

original: gal te phung po bdag na de phyir de //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag na de phyir de //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: mang pas bdag de dag kyang mang por 'gyur //
analyzed: mang pas bdag de dag kyang mang por 'gyur //
translated: Then since there are many aggregates, the self too would be many.

original: bdag ni rdzas su 'gyur zhing der lta ba //
analyzed: bdag ni rdzas su 'gyur zhing der lta ba //
translated: The self would become a substance, and the view of the self

original: rdzas la 'jug pas phyin ci log mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rdzas la 'jug pas phyin ci log mi 'gyur //
translated: Would not be erroneous with respect to a substance.

original: mya ngan 'das tshe nges par bdag chad 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das tshe nges par bdag chad 'gyur //
translated: At the time of nirvana, the self would definitely be annihilated.

original: mya ngan 'das sngon skad cig dag la ni //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das sngon skad cig dag la ni //
translated: Prior to nirvana, the self would arise and disintegrate

original: skye 'jig byed po med pas 'bras med nyid //
analyzed: skye 'jig byed po med pas 'bras med nyid //
translated: Moment by moment, and since the self would be inactive, karma would not have any effect.

original: gzhan gyis bsags las gzhan gyis za bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsags las gzhan gyis za bar 'gyur //
translated: One would experience the effects of karma accumulated by another.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbu ma la 'jug pa las rgyas par rnam par dpyad pa byas pa las khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbu ma la 'jug pa las rgyas par rnam par dpyad pa byas pa las khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: One should understand this from the extensive analysis in Madhyamakāvatāra.

original: 'dir ni spros pa rgyas par mi brtsam mo //
analyzed: 'dir ni spros pa rgyas par mi brtsam mo //
translated: Here I will not elaborate on this extensively.

original: de ltar re zhig phung po bdag ma yin na //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig phung po bdag ma yin na //
translated: Thus, the aggregates are not the self.

original: phung po las tha dad par yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: phung po las tha dad par yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not tenable that the self is different from the aggregates.

original: gal te @111b phung po rnams las gzhan phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te @111b phung po rnams las gzhan phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur /
translated: If the self were different from the aggregates, it would lack the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: ji ltar ba glang las gzhan pa'i rta ba glang gi mtshan nyid can du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar ba glang las gzhan pa'i rta ba glang gi mtshan nyid can du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a horse that is different from an ox does not have the characteristics of an ox,

original: bdag kyang phung po las tha dad par rtog pa na /
analyzed: bdag kyang phung po las tha dad par rtog pa na /
translated: in the same way, if the self were conceived as different from the aggregates,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur ro //🔽de la phung po dag ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur ro // de la phung po dag ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir /
translated: it would lack the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
translated: In this regard, the aggregates have the characteristics of arising, enduring, and being destroyed because they are conditioned.

original: de la bdag phung po'i mtshan nyid can du ma gyur pas skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bdag phung po'i mtshan nyid can du ma gyur pas skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the self is not characterized by the aggregates, it does not arise, endure, and perish.

original: gang zhig de lta bu yin pa des ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ram 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog gam mya ngan las 'das pa ltar /🔽bdag tu brjod pa rnyed par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang zhig de lta bu yin pa des ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ram 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog gam mya ngan las 'das pa ltar / bdag tu brjod pa rnyed par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Since it is not like that, it is not found, like a sky flower or nirvana, because it does not exist or because it is unconditioned.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul de nyid du yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul de nyid du yang mi rigs so //
translated: The object of the conception of self is not tenable as the self.

original: de'i phyir bdag phung po las gzhan du yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag phung po las gzhan du yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also not tenable that the self is different from the aggregates.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na 'di ni don gzhan yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na 'di ni don gzhan yin no //
translated: Or, this is another meaning.

original: gal te bdag phung po las tha dad na de phung po ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can du 'gyur te //
analyzed: gal te bdag phung po las tha dad na de phung po ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can du 'gyur te //
translated: If the self were different from the aggregates, it would not be characterized by the aggregates.

original: phung po lnga ni gzugs su rung ba dang / nyams su myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang yul so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid can yin na /
analyzed: phung po lnga ni gzugs su rung ba dang / nyams su myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang yul so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid can yin na /
translated: The five aggregates have the characteristics of being suitable as form, being experienced, apprehending signs, being conditioned, and cognizing individual objects.

original: bdag ni gzugs las rnam par shes pa bzhin du phung po dag las tha dad par 'dod pa na mtshan nyid tha dad par grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag ni gzugs las rnam par shes pa bzhin du phung po dag las tha dad par 'dod pa na mtshan nyid tha dad par grub par 'gyur la /
translated: If you assert that the self is different from the aggregates, like consciousness is different from form, then it would be established as having a different characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad par grub pa ni gzugs las sems ltar gzung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad par grub pa ni gzugs las sems ltar gzung bar 'gyur na /
translated: If it were established as having a different characteristic, like the mind is different from form, it would be apprehended.

original: 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not apprehended.

original: de'i phyir phung po las tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po las tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it does not exist as different from the aggregates.

original: gal te mu stegs pa dag gis bdag phung po las tha dad par rtogs shing /
analyzed: gal te mu stegs pa dag gis bdag phung po las tha dad par rtogs shing /
translated: But don’t the tīrthikas understand the self to be different from the aggregates?

original: de'i mtshan nyid kyang tha dad par smra ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid kyang tha dad par smra ba ma yin nam /
translated: And don’t they also say that it has a different characteristic?

original: de'i phyir tshul 'di ni de dag la gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul 'di ni de dag la gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore this method does not refute them.

original: ji ltar mu stegs pa dag bdag gi mtshan nyid tha dad par smra ba de ltar ni /
analyzed: ji ltar mu stegs pa dag bdag gi mtshan nyid tha dad par smra ba de ltar ni /
translated: Just as the tīrthikas speak of the characteristics of the self as being different from the aggregates,🔽the tīrthikas imagine a self that is a permanent enjoyer, not a creator,

original: za po rtag dngos byed po min pa'i bdag / yon tan bya med mu stegs rnams kyis brtags //
analyzed: za po rtag dngos byed po min pa'i bdag / yon tan bya med mu stegs rnams kyis brtags //
translated: and devoid of qualities and activity.

original: de dbye cung zad cung zad la brten nas //
analyzed: de dbye cung zad cung zad la brten nas //
translated: Based on slight variations in these,

original: mu stegs can rnams lugs ni tha dad 'gyur //
