analyzed: mu stegs can rnams lugs ni tha dad 'gyur //
translated: the systems of the tīrthikas become different.

original: zhes dbu ma la 'jug pa las smras pa yin no zhe na /🔽brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes dbu ma la 'jug pa las smras pa yin no zhe na / brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is stated in Candrakīrti’s Supplement to the Middle Way.

original: mu stegs pa dag bdag phung po las tha dad pa de'i mtshan nyid smra ba bden mod kyi /🔽de dag bdag rang gi ngo bos dmigs nas @112a * //
analyzed: mu stegs pa dag bdag phung po las tha dad pa de'i mtshan nyid smra ba bden mod kyi / de dag bdag rang gi ngo bos dmigs nas @112a * //
translated: We reply: It is true that the tīrthikas speak of the self as being different from the aggregates and of its characteristics.

original: de'i mtshan nyid smra ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid smra ba ni ma yin te /
translated: However, they do not speak of the characteristics of the self after observing the self by means of its own nature.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then do they do?

original: brten nas brtags pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin ma rtogs par skrag pas bdag ming tsam zhig tu ma rtogs shing kun rdzob kyi bden pa las kyang nyams te /
analyzed: brten nas brtags pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin ma rtogs par skrag pas bdag ming tsam zhig tu ma rtogs shing kun rdzob kyi bden pa las kyang nyams te /
translated: They do not understand that the self is mere name. They are frightened by the meaning of dependent imputation. They fall away even from the conventional truth.

original: log par rtog pa 'ba' zhig gi sgo nas rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba tsam gyis bslus bas bdag yongs su rtog par byed la /
analyzed: log par rtog pa 'ba' zhig gi sgo nas rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba tsam gyis bslus bas bdag yongs su rtog par byed la /
translated: The self is imagined on the basis of mere false imagination and mere fallacious inference.

original: de'i mtshan nyid kyang smra bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid kyang smra bar byed pa yin te /
translated: And it is said to have the characteristic of being a speaker.

original: las dang byed pa po brtag pa la sogs pa dag tu bdag dang nye bar len pa gnyis phan tshun ltos pa'i grub pa yin par gsungs pa na kun rdzob tu yang de dag gi dgag pa mdzad pa nyid yin no //🔽ji ltar me long brten nas su //
analyzed: las dang byed pa po brtag pa la sogs pa dag tu bdag dang nye bar len pa gnyis phan tshun ltos pa'i grub pa yin par gsungs pa na kun rdzob tu yang de dag gi dgag pa mdzad pa nyid yin no // ji ltar me long brten nas su //
translated: In the examination of action and agent, etc., when it is said that the self and the appropriated are established in mutual dependence, this is a refutation of them even conventionally.🔽Just as a reflection appears🔽in dependence on a mirror

original: rang bzhin gzugs brnyan snang mod kyi //🔽de ni yang dag nyid du na //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzugs brnyan snang mod kyi // de ni yang dag nyid du na //
translated: and a face,

original: cung zad kyang ni yod min pa //
analyzed: cung zad kyang ni yod min pa //
translated: but is not at all real,

original: de bzhin phung po rnams brten nas //
analyzed: de bzhin phung po rnams brten nas //
translated: so, in dependence on the aggregates,

original: ngar 'dzin pa ni dmigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa ni dmigs par 'gyur //
translated: the conception of “I” occurs,🔽but there is no self at all.

original: rang gi bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan bzhin //
analyzed: rang gi bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan bzhin //
translated: Just as a reflection of a face🔽appears in a mirror,🔽but is not at all real,🔽so, in dependence on the aggregates,🔽the conception of “I” occurs,

original: yang dag tu na de 'ga' 'ang med //
analyzed: yang dag tu na de 'ga' 'ang med //
translated: but there is no self at all.

original: ji ltar me long ma brten par //
analyzed: ji ltar me long ma brten par //
translated: Just as a reflection of a face

original: rang bzhin gzugs brnyan mi snang ltar //🔽phung po rnams la ma brten par //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzugs brnyan mi snang ltar // phung po rnams la ma brten par //
translated: Just as a reflection does not appear Without a basis, such as a mirror,

original: ngar 'dzin pa lang de dang 'dra //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa lang de dang 'dra //
translated: In the same way, without depending on the aggregates,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: There is no apprehension of “I.”

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i phyir yang 'bad pa mi brtsam mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i phyir yang 'bad pa mi brtsam mo //
translated: Therefore, we should not make an effort to teach it.

original: brten nas btags pa ma rig pa'i phyin ci log dang ldan pa rnams bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i gzhir gyur pa ni /🔽phung po lnga po 'di gang gi nye bar len pa nyid du snang ba 'di ci phung po'i mtshan nyid yod pa zhig gam /
analyzed: brten nas btags pa ma rig pa'i phyin ci log dang ldan pa rnams bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i gzhir gyur pa ni / phung po lnga po 'di gang gi nye bar len pa nyid du snang ba 'di ci phung po'i mtshan nyid yod pa zhig gam /
translated: The basis for the reification of a self by those who possess the error of ignorance, which is a dependent designation, is the five aggregates.

original: 'on te phung po'i mtshan nyid med pa zhig ces thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis rnam par dpyod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te phung po'i mtshan nyid med pa zhig ces thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis rnam par dpyod pa yin no //
translated: Those who desire liberation analyze, “What is the appropriated itself of these five aggregates? Is it that which has the characteristics of the aggregates or that which lacks the characteristics of the aggregates?”🔽When they analyze in every way, those who desire liberation do not observe it.

original: rnam pa thams cad du dpyad pa na thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis ma dmigs pa de'i phyir de rnams la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du dpyad pa na thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis ma dmigs pa de'i phyir de rnams la /
translated: Therefore,

original: bdag nyid yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: bdag nyid yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If the self does not exist,

original: bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could “mine” exist?

original: bdag ma dmigs pa'i phyir bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu phung po lnga po dngos po bdag gi ba yang shin tu ches dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag ma dmigs pa'i phyir bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu phung po lnga po dngos po bdag gi ba yang shin tu ches dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the self is not observed, the five aggregates, the basis for the imputation of the self, are also not observed.

original: ji ltar shing rta tshig na de'i yan lag kyang tshig pas mi dmigs pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor ba dag gis gang gi tshe bdag gi bdag med par rtogs pa de nyid kyi tshe phung po'i dngos po bdag gi ba yang bdag med par nges par rtogs🔽par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar shing rta tshig na de'i yan lag kyang tshig pas mi dmigs pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor ba dag gis gang gi tshe bdag gi bdag med par rtogs pa de nyid kyi tshe phung po'i dngos po bdag gi ba yang bdag med par nges par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as when a chariot is burned, its parts are also burned and not observed, in the same way, when yogis realize the selflessness of the self, they also definitely realize the selflessness of the aggregates, the basis for the imputation of the self.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ngar 'dzin las byung phung po rnams /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin las byung phung po rnams /
translated: The aggregates arise from the conception of “I.”

original: @112b ngar 'dzin de ni don du brdzun //🔽gang gi sa bon brdzun pa de'i //
analyzed: @112b ngar 'dzin de ni don du brdzun // gang gi sa bon brdzun pa de'i //
translated: The conception of “I” is false.🔽How can the birth of that which arises

original: skye ba bden pa ga la zhig / phung po de ltar mi bden par //
analyzed: skye ba bden pa ga la zhig / phung po de ltar mi bden par //
translated: from a false seed be true?🔽Seeing the aggregates in this way as untrue,

original: mthong nas ngar 'dzin spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong nas ngar 'dzin spong bar 'gyur //
translated: one abandons the conception of “I.”

original: ngar 'dzin pa dag spangs nas ni //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dag spangs nas ni //
translated: When one abandons the conception of “I,”

original: phyis ni phung po 'byung mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: phyis ni phung po 'byung mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad do //
translated: the aggregates will not arise again.

original: ji ltar nyi ma so ga'i zla ba tha ma dang / 'tsham pa /
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma so ga'i zla ba tha ma dang / 'tsham pa /
translated: The sun in the last month of summer🔽is like a great firebrand🔽that is slightly obscured by clouds🔽and is slightly dimmed by smoke.🔽The sun in the last month of summer is like a great firebrand that is slightly obscured by clouds in the middle of the sky and is slightly dimmed by smoke.

original: nam mkha' sprin dang bral ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs gnon par byed cing cung zad nur bar gyur pa'i 'od zer me ches gsal ba'i me stag rgya chen po dang 'dra ba /🔽sa'i dkyil 'khor ches je rtsub tu gyur pa gdung bar byed pa lhur len pa dag la brten zhing sa phyogs ches ji rtsub tu gyur pa dang phrad de /
analyzed: nam mkha' sprin dang bral ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs gnon par byed cing cung zad nur bar gyur pa'i 'od zer me ches gsal ba'i me stag rgya chen po dang 'dra ba / sa'i dkyil 'khor ches je rtsub tu gyur pa gdung bar byed pa lhur len pa dag la brten zhing sa phyogs ches ji rtsub tu gyur pa dang phrad de /
translated: The sun in the last month of summer is like a great firebrand that is slightly obscured by clouds in the middle of the sky and is slightly dimmed by smoke.🔽The sun in the last month of summer is like a great firebrand that is slightly obscured by clouds in the middle of the sky and is slightly dimmed by smoke.🔽The sun in the last month of summer is like a great firebrand that is slightly obscured by clouds in the middle of the sky and is slightly dimmed by smoke.🔽The sun in the last month of summer is like a great firebrand that is slightly obscured by clouds in the middle of the sky and is slightly dimmed by smoke.

original: mthong ba phyin ci log la ltos nas chu dang 'dra ba'i smig rgyu dag dmigs pas skye bo yul thag ring ba na gnas pa rnams la shes pa chu shin tu dang ba'i rnam pa can skye bar byed kyi /🔽de dang nye bar gyur pa rnams la ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: mthong ba phyin ci log la ltos nas chu dang 'dra ba'i smig rgyu dag dmigs pas skye bo yul thag ring ba na gnas pa rnams la shes pa chu shin tu dang ba'i rnam pa can skye bar byed kyi /🔽de dang nye bar gyur pa rnams la ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: The sun in the last month of summer is like a great firebrand that is slightly obscured by clouds in the middle of the sky and is slightly dimmed by smoke.🔽The sun in the last month of summer is like a great firebrand that is slightly obscured by clouds in the middle of the sky and is slightly dimmed by smoke.🔽The sun in the last month of summer is like a great firebrand that is slightly obscured by clouds in the middle of the sky and is slightly dimmed by smoke.

original: 'dir yang / ma rig pa'i phyin ci log dang ldan pas so so'i skye bo bdag dang bdag gi ba'i dngos po ji ltar gnas pa de nyid mthong ba las rgyang ring du gnas pa rnams la /
analyzed: 'dir yang / ma rig pa'i phyin ci log dang ldan pas so so'i skye bo bdag dang bdag gi ba'i dngos po ji ltar gnas pa de nyid mthong ba las rgyang ring du gnas pa rnams la /
translated: Here also, ordinary beings who possess the error of ignorance see the reality of the self and entities connected to the self just as they are.

original: bden par snang ba bdag dang phung por sgro btags pa brdzun pa'i don 'di nyid ni dngos po'i de nyid mthong ba dang nye bar gnas pa rnams la mi snang ngo //
analyzed: bden par snang ba bdag dang phung por sgro btags pa brdzun pa'i don 'di nyid ni dngos po'i de nyid mthong ba dang nye bar gnas pa rnams la mi snang ngo //
translated: But for those who are far from seeing the reality of things, the false meaning of the self and the aggregates, which appear to be true, is superimposed.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: thag ring nas ni mthong ba'i gzugs //
analyzed: thag ring nas ni mthong ba'i gzugs //
translated: A form seen from far away

original: nye ba rnams kyis gsal bar mthong //
analyzed: nye ba rnams kyis gsal bar mthong //
translated: Is seen clearly by those nearby.

original: smig rgyu gal te chu yin no //
analyzed: smig rgyu gal te chu yin no //
translated: If a mirage were water,

original: nye ba rnams kyis cis mi mthong //
analyzed: nye ba rnams kyis cis mi mthong //
translated: Why wouldn’t those nearby see it?

original: ji ltar ring ba rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: ji ltar ring ba rnams kyis ni //
translated: Just as those far away

original: 'jig rten 'di ni yang dag mthong //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni yang dag mthong //
translated: See this world as real,

original: de ltar de dang nye rnams kyis //
analyzed: de ltar de dang nye rnams kyis //
translated: So those nearby

original: mi mthong mtshan med smig rgyu bzhin /
analyzed: mi mthong mtshan med smig rgyu bzhin /
translated: Do not see it, as it is signless like a mirage.

original: ji ltar smig rgyu chu 'dra ba //
analyzed: ji ltar smig rgyu chu 'dra ba //
translated: Just as a mirage resembles water

original: chu min dong du ma yin pa //
analyzed: chu min dong du ma yin pa //
translated: But is not water and not a pit,

original: de bzhin phung po bdag 'dra ba //
analyzed: de bzhin phung po bdag 'dra ba //
translated: So too, the aggregates are like the self.

original: de dag bdag min don du min //
analyzed: de dag bdag min don du min //
translated: They are not the self, nor is the self their object.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: This is explained.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ma dmigs pa de nyid kyi phyir don dam ma mthong ba dang nye ba'i rnal 'byor pa ni nges par /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ma dmigs pa de nyid kyi phyir don dam ma mthong ba dang nye ba'i rnal 'byor pa ni nges par /
translated: Because the self and the self’s are not perceived, the yogī who has not seen the ultimate, is certainly

original: bdag dang bdag gi zhi ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi zhi ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of the pacification of the self and the self’s,

original: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med 'gyur //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med 'gyur //
translated: there is no grasping “I” and “mine.”

original: bdag la phan pa ni bdag gi ste /
analyzed: bdag la phan pa ni bdag gi ste /
translated: The benefit of the self is the self’s.

original: bdag gi ba'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi ba'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the five aggregates of the self’s.

original: bdag ste ngar 'dzin pa'i yul dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i yul bdag gi ba phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po zhi ba ste /
analyzed: bdag ste ngar 'dzin pa'i yul dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i yul bdag gi ba phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po zhi ba ste /
translated: The pacification of the self, the object of the grasping “I,” and the self’s, the object of the grasping “mine,” the things such as the aggregates,

original: ma skyes shing ma dmigs pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa @113a * //
analyzed: ma skyes shing ma dmigs pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa @113a * //
translated: the yogī, because of not perceiving the self and the self’s,

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: does not grasp “I” and “mine.”

original: gal te 'ga' zhig de ltar ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur pa rnal 'byor pa de re zhig yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig de ltar ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur pa rnal 'byor pa de re zhig yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If someone says: Is there not the yogī who in this way does not grasp “I” and “mine”?

original: de yod na bdag dang phung po yang grub po zhe na /
analyzed: de yod na bdag dang phung po yang grub po zhe na /
translated: If that exists, then the self and the aggregates would also be established.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med gang /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med gang /
translated: That which is without grasping “I” and grasping “mine”

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Does not exist.

original: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med par //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med par //
translated: That which is without grasping “I” and grasping “mine”

original: gang gis mthong bas mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gis mthong bas mi mthong ngo //
translated: Is not seen by anyone.

original: bdag dang phung po dag rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin dang / gang zhig ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ba de dag las tha dad pa'i dngos po gzhan yod par ga la 'gyur /🔽gang gis de ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par mthong ba des /
analyzed: bdag dang phung po dag rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin dang / gang zhig ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ba de dag las tha dad pa'i dngos po gzhan yod par ga la 'gyur / gang gis de ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par mthong ba des /
translated: Since the self and the aggregates are not observed in any way, and since they are by nature different from those things, how could there be any other thing that is without grasping “I” and grasping “mine”?🔽It should be understood that one who sees that such a nature does not exist, is without grasping “I” and grasping “mine.”

original: de kho na nyid mi mthong ngo zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mi mthong ngo zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: He does not see reality.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /🔽nang gi bdag nyid stong par ltos //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis / nang gi bdag nyid stong par ltos //
translated: The Bhagavān said:🔽Look at the inner as empty.

original: phyi rol gyur pa'ang stong par ltos //
analyzed: phyi rol gyur pa'ang stong par ltos //
translated: Look at the outer as empty.

original: gang zhig stong nyid sgom byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig stong nyid sgom byed pa //
translated: And also:

original: de yang 'ga' zhig kyang yod min //
analyzed: de yang 'ga' zhig kyang yod min //
translated: There is no one who meditates on emptiness.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And also:

original: gang dag zhi zhing rab zhi'i chos sems pa'i //
analyzed: gang dag zhi zhing rab zhi'i chos sems pa'i //
translated: Those who think of the peaceful and utterly peaceful Dharma

original: byis pa de dag lam ngan zhugs pa yin //
analyzed: byis pa de dag lam ngan zhugs pa yin //
translated: Are childish beings who have entered a bad path.

original: chos rnams stong pa yi ge med pa yin //
analyzed: chos rnams stong pa yi ge med pa yin //
translated: The Dharma is empty and without letters.

original: de dag yi ge med par yi ges bstan //
analyzed: de dag yi ge med par yi ges bstan //
translated: It is taught through letters, but is without letters.

original: gang dag zhi zhing rab zhi'i chos sems pa'i //
analyzed: gang dag zhi zhing rab zhi'i chos sems pa'i //
translated: Those who think of the peaceful and utterly peaceful Dharma

original: sems pa de yang nam yang 'byung ma yin //
analyzed: sems pa de yang nam yang 'byung ma yin //
translated: Do not think at all.

original: spros kun sems kyi rnam par rtog pa ste //
analyzed: spros kun sems kyi rnam par rtog pa ste //
translated: All elaborations are mental constructions.

original: de phyir chos rnams bsam yas shes par gyis //
analyzed: de phyir chos rnams bsam yas shes par gyis //
translated: Therefore, know that phenomena are inconceivable.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And also:

original: phung po'i rang bzhin dben zhing stong pa nyid //
analyzed: phung po'i rang bzhin dben zhing stong pa nyid //
translated: The nature of the aggregates is empty and isolated.

original: byang chub rang bzhin dben zhing stong pa nyid //
analyzed: byang chub rang bzhin dben zhing stong pa nyid //
translated: Enlightenment is empty and isolated by nature.

original: gang spyod de yang rang bzhin stong pa ste //🔽ye shes ldan pas shes kyi byis pas min //
analyzed: gang spyod de yang rang bzhin stong pa ste // ye shes ldan pas shes kyi byis pas min //
translated: The one who practices is also empty by nature.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is known by those with wisdom, not by the childish.

original: de'i phyir de ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar /
translated: Therefore, it is like this.

original: nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la //
translated: In regard to the internal and the external,

original: bdag dang bdag gi snyam zad na //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi snyam zad na //
translated: the thought “I am” and “mine” ceases.

original: nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing //
translated: The appropriation ceases,

original: de zad pas na skye ba zad /
analyzed: de zad pas na skye ba zad /
translated: and through its cessation, birth ceases.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can no //
translated: All afflictions have the view of the transitory collection as their root.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun 'byung ba can no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun 'byung ba can no //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is their source.🔽The view of the transitory collection is their cause.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can no zhes mdo las gsungs la /🔽'jig tshogs la lta ba de yang bdag dang bdag gi ma @113b dmigs pas spong bar 'gyur zhing de spangs pas kyang 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa zhes bya ba ste
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can no zhes mdo las gsungs la / 'jig tshogs la lta ba de yang bdag dang bdag gi ma @113b dmigs pas spong bar 'gyur zhing de spangs pas kyang 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa zhes bya ba ste
translated: This is stated in the sutras.

original: nye bar len pa bzhi spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa bzhi spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, that view of the transitory collection is eliminated by not observing “I” and “mine.” Through its elimination, the four appropriations cease: the appropriation of desire, the appropriation of views, the appropriation of morality and asceticism, and the appropriation of the theory of a self.

original: nye bar len pa zad pas ni yang srid pa'i mtshan nyid can skye ba zad par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: nye bar len pa zad pas ni yang srid pa'i mtshan nyid can skye ba zad par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Through the cessation of appropriation, birth, which is characterized by rebirth, ceases.

original: ; gang gi phyir skye ba ldog pa'i rim pa 'di de ltar rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: ; gang gi phyir skye ba ldog pa'i rim pa 'di de ltar rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since this process of the reversal of birth is thusly established,

original: las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
translated: therefore, liberation is through the exhaustion of karma and afflictions.

original: zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: This is the point.

original: 'di ltar nye bar len pa zad na de'i rkyen can srid pa yang mi 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar len pa zad na de'i rkyen can srid pa yang mi 'byung la /
translated: In this way, if appropriation is exhausted, then existence, which is conditioned by that, will not arise.

original: nye bar len pa dang srid pa 'gags na skye ba dang rga shi la sogs pa yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang srid pa 'gags na skye ba dang rga shi la sogs pa yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: If appropriation and existence are stopped, how could birth, aging, death, and so on come to be?

original: de ltar na las dang nyon mongs pa zad pas thar bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de ltar na las dang nyon mongs pa zad pas thar bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Thus it is established that liberation is through the exhaustion of karma and afflictions.

original: 'o na ni las dang nyon mongs pa rnams gang zad pas zad par 'gyur brjod dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni las dang nyon mongs pa rnams gang zad pas zad par 'gyur brjod dgos so zhe na /
translated: Well, then, it must be said through the exhaustion of what karma and afflictions are exhausted.

original: brjod pa / las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
analyzed: brjod pa / las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
translated: Karma and afflictions arise from conceptuality.

original: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
analyzed: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
translated: They arise from mental fabrication.

original: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur /
translated: Mental fabrication is stopped by emptiness.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo tshul bzhin ma yin par gzugs la sogs par rtog pa la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo tshul bzhin ma yin par gzugs la sogs par rtog pa la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: For childish ordinary beings who conceive of form and so on in an improper manner, afflictions such as attachment arise.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug rnams //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug rnams //
translated: It is said that attachment, aversion and delusion

original: kun du rtog las 'byung bar gsungs //
analyzed: kun du rtog las 'byung bar gsungs //
translated: arise from conception.

original: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / brten pa nyid las kun du 'byung //
analyzed: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / brten pa nyid las kun du 'byung //
translated: They arise from the pleasant, the unpleasant and error.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.🔽A sūtra also says:

original: mdo las kyang 'dod pa khyod kyi rtsa ba ni //
analyzed: mdo las kyang 'dod pa khyod kyi rtsa ba ni //
translated: Desire, I know your root:

original: shes te kun tu rtog las skye //
analyzed: shes te kun tu rtog las skye //
translated: You arise from conception.

original: khyod la rtog par mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: khyod la rtog par mi 'gyur ba //
translated: I will not conceive of you,

original: de phyir nga la mi 'byung ngo //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de phyir nga la mi 'byung ngo // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore I will not arise.

original: de ltar re zhig las dang nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa las byung la /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig las dang nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa las byung la /
translated: Thus karma and affliction arise from conception.

original: rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang spros pa sna tshogs pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang spros pa sna tshogs pa /
translated: And those conceptions arise from various conceptual elaborations.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa /
translated: They are habituated from beginningless samsara.

original: shes pa dang shes bya dang / brjod bya dang / rjod byed dang / bum pa dang / snam bu dang / shing rta dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dang / brjod bya dang / rjod byed dang / bum pa dang / snam bu dang / shing rta dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang /
translated: man, woman, gain, non-gain,

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: happiness, suffering, fame, lack of fame, praise, blame, and so on.

original: 'jig rten pa'i spros pa de yang ma lus par stong pa nyid kyis te /🔽dngos po @114a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i spros pa de yang ma lus par stong pa nyid kyis te / dngos po @114a * //
translated: And that worldly proliferation is completely stopped by emptiness.

original: thams cad stong pa nyid du lta bas 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad stong pa nyid du lta bas 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: By seeing all things as empty.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: gang gi phyir dngos por dmigs pa yod na ni ji skad bshad pa'i spros pa yod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos por dmigs pa yod na ni ji skad bshad pa'i spros pa yod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because when the apprehension of things exists, the proliferation as explained above will exist.

original: mo gsham gyi bu mo ma dmigs par ni chags pa can dag de'i yul can spros pa 'jug par mi byed do //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu mo ma dmigs par ni chags pa can dag de'i yul can spros pa 'jug par mi byed do //
translated: But when the son of a barren woman is not apprehended, the lustful do not engage in the proliferation of the object of that .

original: spros pa ma bcug par ni de'i yul can tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spros pa ma bcug par ni de'i yul can tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without the proliferation of conceptualization, the subject, the incorrect conception, does not occur.

original: rnam par rtog pa ma bcug par yang nga dang nga yi zhes mngon par zhen pa las nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma bcug par yang nga dang nga yi zhes mngon par zhen pa las nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Without the proliferation of conceptualization, the mass of afflictions, which has the view of the transitory collection as its root, does not arise from the conception of “I” and “mine.”

original: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can ma bskyed par ni las dag byed par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can ma bskyed par ni las dag byed par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Without the mass of afflictions, which has the view of the transitory collection as its root, karma is not created.

original: las dag mi byed pa rnams ni skye ba dang rga shi zhes bya ba'i 'khor ba nyams su myong bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las dag mi byed pa rnams ni skye ba dang rga shi zhes bya ba'i 'khor ba nyams su myong bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not create karma do not experience birth, aging, and death, which is called “saṃsāra.”

original: gang gi phyir de ltar stong pa nyid spros pa ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can la brten nas spros pa dang bral bar 'gyur zhing spros pa dang bral bas kyang rnam par rtog pa ldog cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar stong pa nyid spros pa ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can la brten nas spros pa dang bral bar 'gyur zhing spros pa dang bral bas kyang rnam par rtog pa ldog cing /
translated: Because in this way, one who relies on emptiness, which has the characteristic of the pacification of all proliferations, becomes free from proliferations. And because one is free from proliferations, conceptualization is reversed.

original: rnam par rtog pa log pas las dang nyon mongs pa ldog la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa log pas las dang nyon mongs pa ldog la /
translated: Because conceptualization is stopped, karma and afflictions are stopped.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa ldog pas skye ba ldog pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa ldog pas skye ba ldog pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because karma and afflictions are stopped, birth is stopped.

original: stong pa nyid kho na spros pa thams cad log pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kho na spros pa thams cad log pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, emptiness alone has the characteristic of the cessation of all conceptualization, and so is called “nirvana.”

original: ji skad du brgya pa las /🔽mdor na chos ni mi 'tshe bar //
analyzed: ji skad du brgya pa las / mdor na chos ni mi 'tshe bar //
translated: As the Catuhfi śataka says:🔽In brief, the Dharma taught by the Tathāgatas

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs //
translated: Is nonviolence.

original: stong nyid mya ngan 'das pa ste //
analyzed: stong nyid mya ngan 'das pa ste //
translated: Emptiness is nirvana.

original: 'dir ni de gnyis 'ba' zhig go //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir ni de gnyis 'ba' zhig go // zhes bshad do //
translated: Here these two are alone.

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la ji skad du bshad pa'i stong pa nyid rtogs pa yod par khong du ma chud nas /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la ji skad du bshad pa'i stong pa nyid rtogs pa yod par khong du ma chud nas /
translated: The master Bhavaviveka, not understanding that the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have an understanding of emptiness as it has been explained,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: says:

original: 'phags pa nyan thos 'du byed kyi tshogs gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i dang can bdag dang bdag gi tha med pa la nges par lta ba la yang /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos 'du byed kyi tshogs gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i dang can bdag dang bdag gi tha med pa la nges par lta ba la yang /
translated: Even noble śrāvakas who definitely see the collection of conditioned states as momentary and perishable, without self or mine,

original: bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa 'di dag ni chos tsam du zad do zhes bya bar lta ba skye ste /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa 'di dag ni chos tsam du zad do zhes bya bar lta ba skye ste /
translated: see that “self” is a nonentity and that arising and disintegration are mere phenomena.

original: 'di ltar bdag ni ngar 'dzin pa'i yul yin pas de med na de yang mi 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni ngar 'dzin pa'i yul yin pas de med na de yang mi 'byung la /
translated: In this way, since the self is the object of grasping “I,” if it does not exist, that also does not occur.

original: de med pa kho na'i phyir 'ga' la yang nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po med pas nga yir 'dzin pa med 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med pa kho na'i phyir 'ga' la yang nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po med pas nga yir 'dzin pa med 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not exist, it is tenable that no one has grasping “mine” because there are no internal or external things.

original: tha snyad kyi brdar @114b bya ba ma gtogs par /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi brdar @114b bya ba ma gtogs par /
translated: Except for the conventional term,

original: nga la ni ngar 'dzin pa med cing nga yir 'dzin pa med do zhes bya bar rang gi ngo bo nges pa skye bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: nga la ni ngar 'dzin pa med cing nga yir 'dzin pa med do zhes bya bar rang gi ngo bo nges pa skye bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: the thought “I do not have grasping ‘I’ and grasping ‘mine’” does not arise.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'du byed skye ba med par lta ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi spyod yul la gnas pa rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'du byed skye ba med par lta ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi spyod yul la gnas pa rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos pas /
translated: What need is there to mention the bodhisattvas, the great beings, who abide in the domain of nonconceptual wisdom, who see compounded phenomena as unarisen?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / nga dang nga yir 'dzin med gang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / nga dang nga yir 'dzin med gang //
translated: That which is free from grasping at “I” and “mine”

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te // zhes gsungs so //
translated: does not exist.

original: zhes de skad du smra'o //🔽slob dpon 'di ji ltar rnam pa de lta bu'i yul la /
analyzed: zhes de skad du smra'o // slob dpon 'di ji ltar rnam pa de lta bu'i yul la /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: slob dpon gyi lugs kyi rjes su 'jug ba ma yin pa de ltar ni dbu ma la 'jug pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi lugs kyi rjes su 'jug ba ma yin pa de ltar ni dbu ma la 'jug pa las /
translated: How is it that the master Nāgārjuna does not follow the system of the master Candrakīrti with regard to such topics?🔽This has been explained in the lines:

original: ring du song bar de blo 'ang lhag par 'gyur zhes bya ba der bstan zin pas /
analyzed: ring du song bar de blo 'ang lhag par 'gyur zhes bya ba der bstan zin pas /
translated: On the ground Gone Far Beyond, their minds become superior.

original: yang de sun dbyung ba la 'bad bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang de sun dbyung ba la 'bad bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore one should not strive to refute him.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: For this very reason the Bhagavān said:

original: rab 'byor nyan thos kyi byang chub thob par 'dod pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor nyan thos kyi byang chub thob par 'dod pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, even those who wish to attain the śrāvakas’ awakening should train in this perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob par 'dod pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob par 'dod pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, even those who wish to attain the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha should train in just this perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o zhes rgya cher gsungs shing //
analyzed: rab 'byor bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o zhes rgya cher gsungs shing //
translated: Subhūti, even those who wish to attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment should train in just this perfection of wisdom.🔽And also:🔽Those who think, “I will become a hearer of the Well-Gone One,”

original: gzhan yang / gang dag bde gshegs nyan thos 'gyur bar bya snyam dang // rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin chos rgyal 'gyur 'dod pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang dag bde gshegs nyan thos 'gyur bar bya snyam dang // rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin chos rgyal 'gyur 'dod pa //
translated: or who wish to become a pratyekabuddha or a Dharma King,

original: bzod pa 'di la ma brten thob par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: bzod pa 'di la ma brten thob par mi 'gyur te //
translated: will not attain it without relying on this patience.

original: dper na tshu rol pha rol 'gro ngogs mi mthong bzhin //
analyzed: dper na tshu rol pha rol 'gro ngogs mi mthong bzhin //
translated: It is like not seeing the near shore or the far shore.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say this:

original: gal te de ltar nang dang phyi'i dngos po ma dmigs pa'i phyir nang dang phyi la nga dang nga'i snyam pa'i rtog pa rnams ma skyes pa de de kho na nyid yin no zhes rnam par gzhag na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar nang dang phyi'i dngos po ma dmigs pa'i phyir nang dang phyi la nga dang nga'i snyam pa'i rtog pa rnams ma skyes pa de de kho na nyid yin no zhes rnam par gzhag na /
translated: If you posit thatness as the non-arising of the thoughts “I” and “mine” in regard to the internal and external, because internal and external things are not observed,

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
translated: then how do you avoid contradicting the following statement of the Bhagavān?

original: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin gyi //
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin gyi //
translated: You are your own protector

original: gzhan ni su zhig mgon du 'gyur //🔽bdag nyid legs par dul bas ni //
analyzed: gzhan ni su zhig mgon du 'gyur // bdag nyid legs par dul bas ni //
translated: Who else will be your protector?🔽The wise attain heaven

original: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
translated: Through properly disciplining themselves.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: gnag dang dkar po'i las ni 'jig mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gnag dang dkar po'i las ni 'jig mi 'gyur //
translated: Black and white karma is not destroyed.

original: bdag gis byas pa myong bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa myong bar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: It is experienced by the one who created it.

original: las dang 'bras bu 'pho bar 'gyur ba'ang min //🔽rgyu dang rkyen med par yang @115a * //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu 'pho bar 'gyur ba'ang min // rgyu dang rkyen med par yang @115a * //
translated: Karma does not pass to another.

original: 'byung ba min //
analyzed: 'byung ba min //
translated: It does not arise without causes and conditions.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs pa de dang ji ltar mi 'gal /
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs pa de dang ji ltar mi 'gal /
translated: How could you avoid contradicting these extensive statements?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: 'di na bdag gam sems can med //
analyzed: 'di na bdag gam sems can med //
translated: Here there is no self or sentient being.

original: chos 'di dag ni rgyu dang bcas //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni rgyu dang bcas //
translated: These phenomena possess causes.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /🔽bdag gzugs ma yin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du / bdag gzugs ma yin /
translated: And similarly,🔽the self is not form,

original: bdag gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin /🔽gzugs la bdag med /
analyzed: bdag gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin / gzugs la bdag med /
translated: the self does not possess form,🔽form does not exist in the self,

original: bdag la gzugs med /
analyzed: bdag la gzugs med /
translated: the self does not exist in form,

original: de bzhin du bdag rnam par shes pa ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag rnam par shes pa ma yin /
translated: and similarly, the self is not consciousness,

original: bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa ma yin /🔽rnam par shes pa la bdag med /
analyzed: bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa ma yin / rnam par shes pa la bdag med /
translated: the self does not possess consciousness,🔽consciousness does not exist in the self,🔽and the self does not exist in consciousness.

original: bdag la rnam par shes pa med ces bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba de skad du yang /
analyzed: bdag la rnam par shes pa med ces bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba de skad du yang /
translated: And similarly, all phenomena are selfless.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir ma gsungs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir ma gsungs /
translated: Why did the Bhagavān not say this?

original: de'i phyir da ji ltar lung gong ma lung 'di dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir da ji ltar lung gong ma lung 'di dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how can this scripture not contradict the above scriptures?

original: de'i phyir 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i dgongs pa btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i dgongs pa btsal bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, here we must seek the intention of the Bhagavān’s teaching.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni spyir gsung rab las /🔽bdag go zhes kyang btags gyur cing //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni spyir gsung rab las / bdag go zhes kyang btags gyur cing //
translated: The Bhagavān generally said in the scriptures:🔽“The self is imputed,

original: bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur //
analyzed: bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur //
translated: and selflessness is also taught.”

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
translated: The buddhas have taught that neither

original: bdag med 'ga' med ces kyang bstan //
analyzed: bdag med 'ga' med ces kyang bstan //
translated: a self nor selflessness exists.

original: 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning here is as follows.

original: 'di na gang dag lta ba ngan pa'i rab rib kyi ling tog mthug bos blo'i mig ma lus par bkab pas dngos po'i rnam pa 'jig rten pa'i lta ba dri ma med pa'i yul las ma 'das kyang ma mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: 'di na gang dag lta ba ngan pa'i rab rib kyi ling tog mthug bos blo'i mig ma lus par bkab pas dngos po'i rnam pa 'jig rten pa'i lta ba dri ma med pa'i yul las ma 'das kyang ma mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: Those whose eyes of intelligence are completely covered by the cataracts of bad views do not see the aspects of things that are the objects of the stainless worldly perspective.

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa la gnas pa kho na yin bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung zhes bya ba'i de kho na nyid tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa lhur len pa /🔽rtsa ba dang chan dang phabs dang chu dang drod la sogs pa rdzas kyi khyad par yongs su smin pa tsam gyi rkyen las byung zhing /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa la gnas pa kho na yin bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung zhes bya ba'i de kho na nyid tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa lhur len pa / rtsa ba dang chan dang phabs dang chu dang drod la sogs pa rdzas kyi khyad par yongs su smin pa tsam gyi rkyen las byung zhing /
translated: They are confined to the level of conventional truth, and they are intent on following the mere reality of what is called earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: myos pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i nus pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i chang dmigs pa ltar /
analyzed: myos pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i nus pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i chang dmigs pa ltar /
translated: They are like those who observe beer, which arises from conditions that are merely the complete ripening of the specific substances of the base, the flour, the yeast, the water, the warmth, and so on.🔽Beer has the specific ability to intoxicate and render unconscious.

original: blo nur nur po la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po yongs su smin pa tsam las 'byung ba nyid du smra ba /
analyzed: blo nur nur po la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po yongs su smin pa tsam las 'byung ba nyid du smra ba /
translated: They say that the self arises from the mere ripening of the great elements, such as the embryonic nucleus, and so on.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' la skur ba 'debs par zhugs pa /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' la skur ba 'debs par zhugs pa /
translated: They are engaged in deprecating the past and the future.

original: 'jig rten 'di yang med legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yang med /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di yang med legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yang med /
translated: They say that this world does not exist and that the results of good and bad actions do not exist.🔽They say that there are no sentient beings who are born supernaturally and so on.

original: sems can rdzus te skye ba yang med do zhes bya ba @115b la sogs bas 'jig rten pha rol dang bdag la skur ba 'debs par byed pa /
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skye ba yang med do zhes bya ba @115b la sogs bas 'jig rten pha rol dang bdag la skur ba 'debs par byed pa /
translated: In this way, they deprecate the next world and the self.

original: de la skur ba 'debs pas 'bras bu khyad par du 'phags pa yid du 'ong ba mtho ris dang byang grol gyi khyad par 'phen pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
analyzed: de la skur ba 'debs pas 'bras bu khyad par du 'phags pa yid du 'ong ba mtho ris dang byang grol gyi khyad par 'phen pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
translated: They turn their backs on the special, excellent, and pleasant results that are projected by the self, such as the higher realms and the special state of liberation.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par mi dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa la zhugs pas dmyal pa la sogs pa'i g-yang sa chen por ltung ba la mngon du phyogs pa de dag gi yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta ba de dag bzlog par bya zhing
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par mi dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa la zhugs pas dmyal pa la sogs pa'i g-yang sa chen por ltung ba la mngon du phyogs pa de dag gi yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta ba de dag bzlog par bya zhing
translated: They are constantly and uninterruptedly engaged in creating nonvirtuous karma, and so they are headed for a great fall into the hells and other such realms.

original: gdul bya dman pa dang 'bring po dang mchog rjes su gzung bar bzhed pas gdul bya dman pa sdig pa mi dge ba byed pa rnams mi dge ba las bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gdul bya dman pa dang 'bring po dang mchog rjes su gzung bar bzhed pas gdul bya dman pa sdig pa mi dge ba byed pa rnams mi dge ba las bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: With the wish to guide those disciples who are of lesser, middling, and superior capacity, the Buddha, the Transcendent Conqueror, in order to turn those of lesser capacity who engage in negative, nonvirtuous actions away from nonvirtue,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi dbye bas tha dad pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su gshegs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi dbye bas tha dad pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su gshegs pa /
translated: in accordance with the dispositions of sentient beings, who are differentiated by means of the eighty-four thousand types of conduct,

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa bsgral bar thugs dam bcas pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa bsgral bar thugs dam bcas pa /
translated: vowed to liberate all sentient beings without exception,

original: sgrub pa lhur mdzad pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa lhur mdzad pa /
translated: and he is dedicated to the practice of that vow.

original: thabs dang mkhyen rab dang thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: thabs dang mkhyen rab dang thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: He is endowed with great means, knowledge, and compassion.

original: 'gro ba du ma'i dpe zla mi mnga' ba'i gnyen /
analyzed: 'gro ba du ma'i dpe zla mi mnga' ba'i gnyen /
translated: He is the peerless friend of many beings.

original: nyon mongs pa'i nad ma lus pa gso bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nad ma lus pa gso bar mdzad pa /
translated: He is the healer of all the diseases of the afflictions.

original: sman pa'i rgyal po chen po rnams kyis 'ga' zhig tu bdag go zhes kyang btags gyur zhing ste /🔽bzhag par gyur to //🔽rgyu med par smra ba dgag pa'i 'thad pa ni /
analyzed: sman pa'i rgyal po chen po rnams kyis 'ga' zhig tu bdag go zhes kyang btags gyur zhing ste / bzhag par gyur to // rgyu med par smra ba dgag pa'i 'thad pa ni /
translated: The great kings of physicians have sometimes designated him as the self.

original: byed pa po dang las brtag pa dang / rgyu med las kyang min zhes bya ba des dbu ma la 'jug pa las rgyas par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las brtag pa dang / rgyu med las kyang min zhes bya ba des dbu ma la 'jug pa las rgyas par shes par bya ste /
translated: The arguments refuting the assertion of causeless arising are to be understood in detail from the Madhyamakavatara, which says:

original: de dgag pa'i phyir 'dir yang 'bad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir 'dir yang 'bad par mi bya'o //
translated: Nor do they arise from a cause that is permanent.

original: gang dag dge ba'i las byed cing mi dge ba'i las las log pa /🔽bdag tu yang dag par lta ba mkhregs pa bya srad bu ches shin tu ring bas brtod pa ltar shin tu ring por phyin yang khams gsum las shin tu 'das nas /
analyzed: gang dag dge ba'i las byed cing mi dge ba'i las las log pa / bdag tu yang dag par lta ba mkhregs pa bya srad bu ches shin tu ring bas brtod pa ltar shin tu ring por phyin yang khams gsum las shin tu 'das nas /
translated: Those who perform virtuous actions and turn away from nonvirtuous actions,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer zhi bar 'gro mi nus pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer zhi bar 'gro mi nus pa /
translated: who are rigid in their correct view of the self, and who are bound by the very long thread of karma, are unable to go far beyond the three realms and proceed to the peaceful city of nirvana.

original: gdul bya bar ma de dag 'jig tshogs la lta bar mngon par zhen pa lhod par bya ba'i phyir dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dun pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ni /
analyzed: gdul bya bar ma de dag 'jig tshogs la lta bar mngon par zhen pa lhod par bya ba'i phyir dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dun pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ni /
translated: In order to loosen the strong adherence of those disciples of middling capacity to the view of the transitory collection and in order to generate in them the aspiration for nirvana,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur to //
translated: the transcendent conquerors also taught that there is no self.

original: gang dag sngon goms pa'i khyad par gyis zab mo'i chos la lhag par mos pa @116a * //
analyzed: gang dag sngon goms pa'i khyad par gyis zab mo'i chos la lhag par mos pa @116a * //
translated: Those who, due to the special predispositions from previous habituation, have a special interest in the profound dharma

original: rjes su 'brel pa'i sa bon yongs su smin par gyur pa thob pa mya ngan las 'das pa la nye bar gnas pa bdag la chags pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa'i sa bon yongs su smin par gyur pa thob pa mya ngan las 'das pa la nye bar gnas pa bdag la chags pa dang bral ba /
translated: and who have attained the fully ripened seeds that are connected to that interest, who are close to nirvana, who are free from attachment to a self,

original: thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab kyi don gyi de kho na nyid mchog tu zab pa'i gting dpog par nus pa /
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab kyi don gyi de kho na nyid mchog tu zab pa'i gting dpog par nus pa /
translated: and who are able to fathom the depths of the profound and supreme reality that is the meaning of the scriptures of the Lord of Sages,

original: gdul bya mchog tu gyur pa de dag la ni lhag par mos pa'i khyad par nges par bzung nas /
analyzed: gdul bya mchog tu gyur pa de dag la ni lhag par mos pa'i khyad par nges par bzung nas /
translated: those supreme disciples, having ascertained the special interest,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
translated: the buddhas taught that there is no self.

original: bdag med 'ga' med ces kyang bstan te /
analyzed: bdag med 'ga' med ces kyang bstan te /
translated: It is also taught that there is no selflessness at all.

original: ji ltar bdag tu lta ba yang dag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag tu lta ba yang dag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the view of self is not correct,

original: de'i gnyen por gyur pa bdag med par lta ba yang /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gyur pa bdag med par lta ba yang /
translated: so the view of selflessness, which is its antidote,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: is also not correct.

original: de ltar na bdag 'ga' yang med la /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag 'ga' yang med la /
translated: Thus, there is no self at all,🔽and there is no selflessness at all.

original: bdag med pa yang 'ga' yang med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa yang 'ga' yang med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a sūtra says,

original: 'od srungs bdag ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig go //
analyzed: 'od srungs bdag ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig go //
translated: Kāśyapa, “self” is one extreme.

original: bdag med ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gnyis so //
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gnyis so //
translated: “Selflessness” is a second extreme.

original: mtha' de gnyis kyi dbus gang yin pa de ni gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
analyzed: mtha' de gnyis kyi dbus gang yin pa de ni gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
translated: The middle that is the center between these two extremes is without form, cannot be shown,

original: rten med pa /
analyzed: rten med pa /
translated: has no support,

original: snang ba med pa /
analyzed: snang ba med pa /
translated: is not manifest,

original: rnam par rig pa med pa /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa med pa /
translated: is not cognized,

original: gnas med pa ste /
analyzed: gnas med pa ste /
translated: and has no location.

original: 'od srungs 'di ni dbu ma'i lam chos rnams la yang dag par so sor rtogs pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di ni dbu ma'i lam chos rnams la yang dag par so sor rtogs pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Kāśyapa, this is called the middle path, the correct discernment of phenomena.

original: 'phags pa rin po che'i phreng ba las kyang //
analyzed: 'phags pa rin po che'i phreng ba las kyang //
translated: And the noble Precious Garland says,

original: de ltar bdag dang bdag med pa //
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang bdag med pa //
translated: Thus, self and selflessness

original: yang dag ji bzhin dmigs su med //
analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin dmigs su med //
translated: Are not apprehended as they really are.🔽Therefore, the Great Sage refuted

original: bdag dang bdag med lta ba ni //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med lta ba ni //
translated: The views of self and selflessness.

original: de phyir thub pa chen pos bzlog / mthong dang thos sogs thub pa yis //
analyzed: de phyir thub pa chen pos bzlog / mthong dang thos sogs thub pa yis //
translated: The Sage said that seeing, hearing, etc.

original: bden min brdzun pa min par gsungs //
analyzed: bden min brdzun pa min par gsungs //
translated: Are neither true nor false.

original: phyogs las mi mthun phyogs gyur pas //
analyzed: phyogs las mi mthun phyogs gyur pas //
translated: Since the opposite of a position is not a position,

original: de dag gnyi ga don du min //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga don du min // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Neither of them is the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gdul bya'i skye bo dman pa dang bar ma dang mchog gi bsam pa tha dad pa nyid kyis bdag dang bdag med pa dang / de gnyi ga dgag pa'i sgo nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos bstan pa 'jug pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gdul bya'i skye bo dman pa dang bar ma dang mchog gi bsam pa tha dad pa nyid kyis bdag dang bdag med pa dang / de gnyi ga dgag pa'i sgo nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos bstan pa 'jug pa de'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because the teachings of the Bhagavat Buddhas are engaged in the refutation of both self and selflessness through the different dispositions of inferior, middling, and superior trainees,

original: dbu ma pa rnams la lung gis gnod pa med do //
analyzed: dbu ma pa rnams la lung gis gnod pa med do //
translated: The Madhyamikas are not faulted by scripture.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon 'phags pa'i lhas //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon 'phags pa'i lhas //
translated: For this very reason, the Acarya Aryadeva🔽says:

original: bsod nams min pa dang por bzlog / bar du bdag ni bzlog pa dang // phyi nas lta zhig kun bzlog pa //
analyzed: bsod nams min pa dang por bzlog / bar du bdag ni bzlog pa dang // phyi nas lta zhig kun bzlog pa //
translated: First, non-merit is averted, then the self is averted, and finally, all views are averted.

original: gang gis shes te mkhas pa yin //
analyzed: gang gis shes te mkhas pa yin //
translated: One who knows this is a wise person.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: @116b de bzhin du /
analyzed: @116b de bzhin du /
translated: And likewise,

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyang /🔽brda sprod pa dag ji lta bur //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyang / brda sprod pa dag ji lta bur //
translated: the master's own mouth🔽is like a grammar teacher

original: yi ge'i phyi mo 'ang klog 'jug ltar //🔽de bzhin sangs rgyas gdul bya la //
analyzed: yi ge'i phyi mo 'ang klog 'jug ltar // de bzhin sangs rgyas gdul bya la //
translated: who teaches the alphabet.🔽In the same way, the Buddha teaches the Dharma

original: ji tsam bzod pa'i chos ston to //🔽kha cig la ni sdig pa las //
analyzed: ji tsam bzod pa'i chos ston to // kha cig la ni sdig pa las //
translated: to the extent that disciples can bear it.🔽To some he teaches the Dharma

original: rnam par bzlog phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: rnam par bzlog phyir chos ston to //
translated: in order to turn them away from evil.

original: kha cig bsod nams grub bya'i phyir //🔽kha cig la ni gnyis brten pa //
analyzed: kha cig bsod nams grub bya'i phyir // kha cig la ni gnyis brten pa //
translated: To some he teaches in order to establish merit.🔽To some he teaches in order to establish both.

original: kha cig la ni gnyis mi brten //
analyzed: kha cig la ni gnyis mi brten //
translated: To some he teaches in order to establish neither.

original: zab mo khu 'phrig can 'jigs pa //
analyzed: zab mo khu 'phrig can 'jigs pa //
translated: To some he teaches the profound, frightening to the fearful,

original: stong nyid snying rje'i snying po can //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje'i snying po can //
translated: emptiness with the essence of compassion,

original: byang chub sgrub pa kha cig la'o //
analyzed: byang chub sgrub pa kha cig la'o //
translated: the practice of enlightenment.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo rnam pa thams cad du ma gzigs pa /

analyzed: yang ci'i phyir brjod par bya ba med ce na /

analyzed: gang gi tshe sems kyi spyod yul nyid mi 'thad pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: gang gi phyir ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa chos nyid de chos kyi ngo bo dang / chos kyi rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par gzhag pa de'i phyir de la sems mi 'jug go //

analyzed: sems mi 'jug na rgyu mtshan sgro 'dogs par ga la 'gyur la /

original: de med pa'i phyir tshig dag 'jug par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir tshig dag 'jug par ga la 'gyur te /

analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyis cung zad kyang ma bstan to zhes bya bar gnas so //

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //

translated: Unarisen and unceasing,

analyzed: zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: bshad pa ni snga ma kho na sbyar bar bya'o //

translated: “Santimati, from the night when the Tathagata fully and perfectly awakened to supreme and complete buddhahood until the night when, without attachment, he will pass into parinirvana, in between the Tathagata has not uttered even a single syllable.

analyzed: ; gsung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so // 'khrul 'khor las byas sil snyan ni //

analyzed: ji ltar rlung bskul sgra 'byung ba //

analyzed: 'on kyang sgra dag 'byung 'gyur ba //
translated: still, sounds do arise.🔽In the same way, the speech of the Buddha arises

original: de bzhin legs par sngar sbyangs shing //
analyzed: de bzhin legs par sngar sbyangs shing //

analyzed: 'di la rtog pa yod mi mnga' //

analyzed: ji ltar brag ca'i sgra nang dang // phyi rol gnas pa ma yin pa //
translated: Just as the sound of an echo Is neither internal nor external,

original: de bzhin mi yi dbang po'i gsung //
analyzed: de bzhin mi yi dbang po'i gsung //

original: nang dang phyi rol gnas pa yin //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gnas pa yin //
translated: It is neither internal nor external.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //

analyzed: 'dir kha cig dbu ma pa ni med pa pa dang khyad par med pa yin te //
translated: Here, some argue as follows: Madhyamikas are not different from nihilists,

analyzed: gang gi phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dang / byed pa po dang / 'bras bu dang / 'jig rten thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par smra ba yin la //
translated: because they say that virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, agents, effects, and the entire world are empty of essence.

original: med pa pa dag kyang de dag med do zhes smra bar byed pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa pa dag kyang de dag med do zhes smra bar byed pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Nihilists also say that these do not exist.

original: dbu ma pa ni med pa pa dang khyad par med do zhes rgol par byed do //
analyzed: dbu ma pa ni med pa pa dang khyad par med do zhes rgol par byed do //
translated: Therefore, Madhyamikas and nihilists are not different.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
