original: dbu ma pa dag ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba smra ba yin la /
analyzed: dbu ma pa dag ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba smra ba yin la /
translated: Madhyamikas say that things arise dependently.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa thams cad rang bzhin med par smra bar byed do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa thams cad rang bzhin med par smra bar byed do //
translated: Because they are dependently arisen, we say that this world, the next world, and so on are essenceless.

original: med pa pa dag gis ni de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi sgo nas 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa dngos po med par rtog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa pa dag gis ni de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi sgo nas 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa dngos po med par rtog pa ma yin te /
translated: The nihilists do not conceive of the nonexistence of the next world, and so on, by means of the emptiness of essence that is the dependent origination of all things.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /🔽'jig rten 'di'i dngos po'i rnam pa rang bzhin gyis dmigs nas de 'jig rten pha @118a * //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / 'jig rten 'di'i dngos po'i rnam pa rang bzhin gyis dmigs nas de 'jig rten pha @118a * //
translated: What then?

original: rol nas 'dir 'ong ba dang / 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro bar ma mthong nas 'jig rten 'dir dmigs pa'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'i dngos po gzhan la skur pa 'debs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rol nas 'dir 'ong ba dang / 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro bar ma mthong nas 'jig rten 'dir dmigs pa'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'i dngos po gzhan la skur pa 'debs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Having observed the nature of things in this world, they do not see that they come to this world from the next world, nor that they go from this world to the next world. Therefore, they repudiate other things that are similar to the things that are observed in this world.

original: gal te de lta na yang de dag gis dngos po'i rang gi ngo bor yod pa ma yin pa nyid la med pa nyid du rtog pa'i phyir re zhig lta ba 'di'i sgo nas mtshungs pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang de dag gis dngos po'i rang gi ngo bor yod pa ma yin pa nyid la med pa nyid du rtog pa'i phyir re zhig lta ba 'di'i sgo nas mtshungs pa yod do zhe na /
translated: But even if that is so, they are similar in this respect: because they conceive of the non-existence of the intrinsic reality of things as non-existence.

original: med de / dbu ma pa dag gis ni kun rdzob tu yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir la /🔽de dag gis khas ma blangs pa'i phyir mi mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: med de / dbu ma pa dag gis ni kun rdzob tu yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir la / de dag gis khas ma blangs pa'i phyir mi mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: No, they are not similar, because the Centrists accept that things exist conventionally,🔽but they do not accept that things exist ultimately.

original: gal te dngos po ma grub par mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma grub par mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are similar in that things are not established,

original: gal te yang dngos po ma grub pa mtshungs pa nyid yin pa de lta na yang rtogs pa po tha dad pas mi mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te yang dngos po ma grub pa mtshungs pa nyid yin pa de lta na yang rtogs pa po tha dad pas mi mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: then even if they are similar in that things are not established, they are not similar because the comprehenders are different.

original: 'di ltar dper na rku byas pa'i mi zhig la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na rku byas pa'i mi zhig la /
translated: For example, a man who has committed theft

original: gcig gis ni yang dag par mi shes bzhin du de dang mi mdza' bas sbud nas 'dis brkus so zhes de la log par smra bar byed la /
analyzed: gcig gis ni yang dag par mi shes bzhin du de dang mi mdza' bas sbud nas 'dis brkus so zhes de la log par smra bar byed la /
translated: is falsely accused by one person who says, “He stole this,” though he does not know it, because he is not friendly with him.

original: gzhan ni dngos su mthong nas sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan ni dngos su mthong nas sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: But another person accuses him after directly seeing it.

original: de la dngos po tha dad pa med mod kyang de lta na yang /
analyzed: de la dngos po tha dad pa med mod kyang de lta na yang /
translated: Although there is no difference in the things, nevertheless,

original: rtogs pa po tha dad pas gcig la ni der brdzun du smra'o zhes brjod la /
analyzed: rtogs pa po tha dad pas gcig la ni der brdzun du smra'o zhes brjod la /
translated: since the comprehenders are different, one is said to tell a lie there,

original: gzhan la ni bden par smra'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni bden par smra'o zhes bya'o //
translated: and the other is said to tell the truth.

original: gcig la ni yang dag par brtags pa na grags pa ma yin pa dang kha na ma tho bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gcig la ni yang dag par brtags pa na grags pa ma yin pa dang kha na ma tho bar 'gyur la /
translated: When one is examined, it is not renowned and is a misdeed,🔽but when the other is examined, it is not.

original: gzhan la ni ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo tha mi dad kyang dbu ma pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin rig pa rnams khong du chud pa dang smra ba na /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo tha mi dad kyang dbu ma pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin rig pa rnams khong du chud pa dang smra ba na /
translated: In the same way, here, although the nature of things is not different, when the Mādhyamika, who knows the nature of things as they are, comprehends and speaks,

original: med pa pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin rig pa ma yin pa dag dang lhan cig shes pa dang brjod pa dag mtshungs par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin rig pa ma yin pa dag dang lhan cig shes pa dang brjod pa dag mtshungs par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not the case that his knowledge and statements are the same as those of the nihilists, who do not know the nature of things as they are.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon dag ni ji ltar so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa gnyis kyi so sor ma brtags pa dang so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms dag btang snyoms su mtshungs pa dang / ji ltar dmus long dang mig dang ldan pa gnyis kyis yul phyogs nges par mtshungs kyang khyad par chen po yod pa de bzhin du med pa pa dag dang /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon dag ni ji ltar so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa gnyis kyi so sor ma brtags pa dang so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms dag btang snyoms su mtshungs pa dang / ji ltar dmus long dang mig dang ldan pa gnyis kyis yul phyogs nges par mtshungs kyang khyad par chen po yod pa de bzhin du med pa pa dag dang /
translated: Past masters say: Just as the indifference of both ordinary beings and āryas is similar whether it is nonanalytical or analytical, and just as a blind person and one with eyes are similar in ascertaining a place, but there is a great difference between them, so too there is a great difference between the indifference of those who do not exist and those who exist.🔽

original: dbu ma pa rnams la yang khyad par yod par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: dbu ma pa rnams la yang khyad par yod par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: Past masters say: Just as the indifference of both ordinary beings and āryas is similar whether it is nonanalytical or analytical, and just as the blind and those with eyes are similar in terms of the place they are going to, but there is a great difference between them, so too there is a great difference between nihilists and🔽Mādhyamikas.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here some say:

original: gal te de ltar /
analyzed: gal te de ltar /
translated: If that is so,

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa /
translated: then the unborn and unceasing

original: chos @118b nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs pa yin la /
analyzed: chos @118b nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs pa yin la /
translated: reality is the same as nirvāṇa.

original: de la ngag dang sems dag 'jug pa yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de la ngag dang sems dag 'jug pa yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: And speech and mind do not engage with it.

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: But even so,

original: de ma bstan na gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyis shes par mi nus pas /
analyzed: de ma bstan na gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyis shes par mi nus pas /
translated: if it is not taught, disciples are unable to understand it.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo rnams de la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir gdon mi za bar kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas ji zhig ltar de bstan pa'i rim pa zhig yod dgos pas de brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo rnams de la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir gdon mi za bar kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas ji zhig ltar de bstan pa'i rim pa zhig yod dgos pas de brjod par bya'o //
translated: In order to engage those beings who are to be tamed in that, one must rely on the conventional truth in some way or another. Since there must be some sort of sequence for teaching it, I will explain it.🔽Here, one should understand that the sequence of the teaching for entering into the nectar of reality of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, is as follows.

original: brjod pa / 'dir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi la 'jug pa'i bstan pa'i rim pa ni 'di yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod pa / 'dir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi la 'jug pa'i bstan pa'i rim pa ni 'di yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: This is stated:

original: gang 'di / thams cad yang dag yang dag min //🔽yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
analyzed: gang 'di / thams cad yang dag yang dag min // yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
translated: Everything is real and not real,🔽Real and not real,

original: yang dag min min yang dag min //
analyzed: yang dag min min yang dag min //
translated: Neither not real nor real.

original: de ni sangs rgyas rjes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas rjes bstan pa'o //
translated: That is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya'o // de la /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de la /
translated: With regard to that,

original: gang zhig gang gang la dga' ba //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gang la dga' ba //
translated: Whatever is the delight of whomever,

original: de yi de de sngar bshad bya //🔽nyams par gyur pa dam chos kyi //
analyzed: de yi de de sngar bshad bya // nyams par gyur pa dam chos kyi //
translated: That is what I will explain first.🔽Those who are corrupted are in no way

original: snod ni cis kyang ma yin no //🔽zhes bya ba dang / ji ltar kla klo skad gzhan gyis //
analyzed: snod ni cis kyang ma yin no // zhes bya ba dang / ji ltar kla klo skad gzhan gyis //
translated: Vessals of the true doctrine.🔽And:

original: gzung bar mi nus de bzhin du //
analyzed: gzung bar mi nus de bzhin du //
translated: Just as a barbarian cannot be addressed in a language other than his own,

original: 'jig rten pa yis ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yis ma gtogs pa //
translated: The world cannot be apprehended

original: 'jig rten gzung bar nus ma yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzung bar nus ma yin //
translated: except by the worldly.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang //
translated: And the Lord has said:

original: 'jig rten nga dang lhan cig rtsod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten nga dang lhan cig rtsod kyi /
translated: The world disputes with me,

original: nga ni 'jig rten dang mi rtsod de /
analyzed: nga ni 'jig rten dang mi rtsod de /
translated: but I do not dispute with the world.

original: gang 'jig rten na yod par 'dod pa de ni nga yang yod par bzhed do //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten na yod par 'dod pa de ni nga yang yod par bzhed do //
translated: Whatever the world accepts as existent, I too accept as existent.🔽Whatever the world accepts as nonexistent, I too accept as nonexistent.

original: gang 'jig rten na med par 'dod pa de ni nga yang med par bzhed do zhes bya ba'i lung las na thog ma kho nar re zhig bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gis na de ltar snod kyi 'jig rten dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten thog mar rlung gi dkyil 'khor nas srid pa'i rtse mo la thug pa /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten na med par 'dod pa de ni nga yang med par bzhed do zhes bya ba'i lung las na thog ma kho nar re zhig bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gis na de ltar snod kyi 'jig rten dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten thog mar rlung gi dkyil 'khor nas srid pa'i rtse mo la thug pa /
translated: Therefore, the Lord, in the beginning, first of all, taught the world the unmistaken origination, duration, and dissolution of the world of the environment and the world of beings, from the wind mandala up to the peak of existence,🔽which is the extent of the realm of space,

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' gtugs pa'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa phyin ci ma log pa rab tu dbye ba sna tshogs pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' gtugs pa'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa phyin ci ma log pa rab tu dbye ba sna tshogs pa dang bcas pa /
translated: together with the various classifications,

original: rgyu dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa /
translated: together with the cause,🔽together with the result,🔽together with the method,🔽and together with the person who experiences the result.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa /
translated: It has results.

original: ro myang ba dang bcas pa /
analyzed: ro myang ba dang bcas pa /
translated: It has enjoyment.

original: nyes dmigs dang bcas pa /
analyzed: nyes dmigs dang bcas pa /
translated: It has faults.

original: nye bar bstan pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen zhing thams cad gzigs pa 'di ni 'jig rten gyi byung tshul ma lus pa mkhyen pa yin no snyam du bdag nyid la 'jig rten gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir de'i lta ba la ltos nas /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa / bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen zhing thams cad gzigs pa 'di ni 'jig rten gyi byung tshul ma lus pa mkhyen pa yin no snyam du bdag nyid la 'jig rten gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir de'i lta ba la ltos nas /
translated: It is well taught.🔽The Bhagavat, who is omniscient and sees all, knows all the ways of the world.🔽In order to generate respect for the world in himself, he teaches the classification of things that are well known to the beings to be trained, in terms of their categories and their individual natures.

original: @119a * // gdul bya'i skye bo rang la grags pa'i dngos po rab tu dbye ba dang / rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par phye ba thos nas mos pa mngon par 'dod pa skyes pa la /
analyzed: @119a * // gdul bya'i skye bo rang la grags pa'i dngos po rab tu dbye ba dang / rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par phye ba thos nas mos pa mngon par 'dod pa skyes pa la /
translated: When they hear this, they develop the desire to have faith.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa ma rig pa'i rab rib can dag gis bden par brtags pa gang yin pa de nyid bden no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa ma rig pa'i rab rib can dag gis bden par brtags pa gang yin pa de nyid bden no zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says that the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on, which are imagined to be real by those who are afflicted with the cataracts of ignorance, are real.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gdul bya'i skye bo bcom ldan 'das la thams cad mkhyen pa yin no snyam du blo skyes pa la dus phyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gdul bya'i skye bo bcom ldan 'das la thams cad mkhyen pa yin no snyam du blo skyes pa la dus phyis /
translated: Therefore, the Lord has taught that the minds of those disciples who think that the Buddha is omniscient are later on

original: de dag thams cad yang dag min //🔽zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad yang dag min // zhes bstan to //
translated: not in accordance with reality.

original: de la yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni gang la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pa la bya na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni gang la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pa la bya na /
translated: Here, “in accordance with reality” means that which does not change into something else.

original: skad cig re re la 'jig pa'i phyir 'dus byas rnams la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: skad cig re re la 'jig pa'i phyir 'dus byas rnams la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa yin te /
translated: But conditioned things do change into something else, because they perish every moment.

original: de'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pas yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pas yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not in accordance with reality, because they change into something else.

original: 'ang gi sgra ni dang gi don te /
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni dang gi don te /
translated: The word “also” means “and.”

original: thams cad yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bstan pa sdud par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bstan pa sdud par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it summarizes the teaching that all things are both in accordance with reality and not in accordance with reality.

original: kha cig la ni 'di dag thams cad /🔽yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
analyzed: kha cig la ni 'di dag thams cad / yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
translated: Some people are taught that all these things

original: ces bstan to //
analyzed: ces bstan to //
translated: are both in accordance with reality and not in accordance with reality.

original: de la byis pa'i skye bo la ltos nas ni 'di dag thams cad yang dag pa yin la /
analyzed: de la byis pa'i skye bo la ltos nas ni 'di dag thams cad yang dag pa yin la /
translated: Here, in relation to the ordinary man, all these things are in accordance with reality.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes la ltos nas ni 'di dag thams cad brdzun pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes la ltos nas ni 'di dag thams cad brdzun pa ste /
translated: In relation to the knowledge of the noble ones, all of these are false,

original: 'di dag gis de ltar ma gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis de ltar ma gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not see in that way.

original: de kho na nyid lta ba la yun ring po nas goms pa sgrib pa cung zad tsam ma bkrol ba kha cig la ni /
analyzed: de kho na nyid lta ba la yun ring po nas goms pa sgrib pa cung zad tsam ma bkrol ba kha cig la ni /
translated: For some who have long been accustomed to seeing reality, but whose obscurations have not been completely removed,

original: de dag yang dag min min yang dag min zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de dag yang dag min min yang dag min zhes bstan te /
translated: it is taught that these are neither real nor unreal.

original: sgrib pa cung zad tsam po de yang spang bar bya ba'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo ba sangs dang dkar sham bkag pa ltar de gnyi ga yang bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa cung zad tsam po de yang spang bar bya ba'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo ba sangs dang dkar sham bkag pa ltar de gnyi ga yang bkag pa yin no //
translated: In order to remove those slight obscurations, both are refuted, like the blueness and whiteness of a barren woman’s son.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the Lord Buddha.

original: lam gol pa nas bzlog nas lam bzang po la 'god pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lam gol pa nas bzlog nas lam bzang po la 'god pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Teaching is the reversal from the wrong path and the establishment on the good path.

original: de ltar mthar gyis ston pa ni rjes su ston pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mthar gyis ston pa ni rjes su ston pa'o //
translated: Teaching in stages is subsequent teaching.

original: yang na gdul bya'i skye bo dang 'tsham par ston pa ni rjes su ston pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gdul bya'i skye bo dang 'tsham par ston pa ni rjes su ston pa'o //
translated: Or, teaching in accordance with the person to be trained is subsequent teaching.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bstan pa de dag thams cad ni de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi la 'jug pa'i thabs nyid du rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bstan pa de dag thams cad ni de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi la 'jug pa'i thabs nyid du rnam par gnas so //
translated: All of those teachings of the Bhagavat Buddhas are established as just the method for entering the nectar of reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni gsung de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi la 'jug pa'i thabs su ma gyur pa mi gsung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni gsung de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi la 'jug pa'i thabs su ma gyur pa mi gsung ste /
translated: The Tathagatas do not teach anything that is not a method for entering the nectar of reality.

original: nad dang rjes su @119b mthun pa'i sman nye bar sogs pa ltar 'dul ba'i skye bo rjes su gzung bar bzhed pas ji ltar 'tsham pa ltar ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: nad dang rjes su @119b mthun pa'i sman nye bar sogs pa ltar 'dul ba'i skye bo rjes su gzung bar bzhed pas ji ltar 'tsham pa ltar ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Just as medicine is applied in accordance with the disease, they teach in whatever way is appropriate, intending to guide those to be trained.

original: ji skad du brgya pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du brgya pa las /
translated: As it is said in the Catuhfi śataka:🔽Existence, nonexistence, both existence and nonexistence,

original: yod dang med dang yod med dang // gnyi ga min zhes kyang bstan te //🔽nad kyi dbang gis thams cad ni //
analyzed: yod dang med dang yod med dang // gnyi ga min zhes kyang bstan te // nad kyi dbang gis thams cad ni //
translated: and neither are taught.🔽Are not all of them called

original: sman zhes bya bar 'gyur min nam //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sman zhes bya bar 'gyur min nam // zhes bshad do //
translated: medicine in accordance with the disease?

original: gang la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa 'di dag ston pa'i de kho na nyid de mtshan nyid ci dang ldan pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa 'di dag ston pa'i de kho na nyid de mtshan nyid ci dang ldan pa zhig ce na /
translated: What is the reality of the teaching, that is, the reality for the sake of which these teachings are taught?

original: brjod par bya ba bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba bzlog pa ste /
translated: The object of expression is stopped,

original: sems kyi spyod yul bzlog pas so //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul bzlog pas so //
translated: because the domain of mind is stopped.

original: zhes 'di ni kho bo cag gis bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes 'di ni kho bo cag gis bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained by us.

original: gang gi tshe 'di de lta bu yin pa de'i tshe gzhan yang ci zhig drir yod //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di de lta bu yin pa de'i tshe gzhan yang ci zhig drir yod //
translated: When it is like that, then what else is there to ask?

original: de lta yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta yin mod kyi /
translated: Although that is so,

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad khas blangs pa ltar tha snyad kyi bden pa'i ngor sgro btags nas de'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad khas blangs pa ltar tha snyad kyi bden pa'i ngor sgro btags nas de'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
translated: nevertheless, just as worldly conventions are accepted, the characteristic of that must be expressed by superimposition in the perspective of conventional truth.

original: de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de brjod par bya ste /
translated: That will be expressed.🔽Not known from another, peaceful,

original: gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
analyzed: gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
translated: not fabricated by mental fabrications,

original: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
analyzed: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
translated: not different from the absence of conceptualization,

original: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
translated: that is the characteristic of reality.

original: de la 'di la gzhan las shes pa yod pa ma yin pas na gzhan las shes min te /
analyzed: de la 'di la gzhan las shes pa yod pa ma yin pas na gzhan las shes min te /
translated: Regarding that, since it is not known from another, it is not known from another.

original: gzhan gyis bstan pas rtogs par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pas rtogs par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not to be realized through being taught by another.

original: rang nyid kyis rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: rang nyid kyis rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: It is to be realized by oneself. That is the meaning.

original: ; ji ltar rab rib can dag gis skra shad la sogs pa'i ngo bo phyin ci log mthong ba na /
analyzed: ; ji ltar rab rib can dag gis skra shad la sogs pa'i ngo bo phyin ci log mthong ba na /
translated: When those with eye disease see the essence of falling hairs and so on,

original: rab rib med pas bstan du zin kyang /
analyzed: rab rib med pas bstan du zin kyang /
translated: even though they are shown that it is an error by those without eye disease,

original: rab rib med pa ltar skra shad la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma mthong ba'i tshul gyis rtogs par bya ba ji ltar gnas pa bzhin rtogs par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: rab rib med pa ltar skra shad la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma mthong ba'i tshul gyis rtogs par bya ba ji ltar gnas pa bzhin rtogs par mi nus kyi /
translated: they cannot understand the way things are, just as those without eye disease do not see the essence of falling hairs and so on.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what do they understand?

original: rab rib med pas bstan pa las 'di ni phyin ci log yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig tu ni rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rab rib med pas bstan pa las 'di ni phyin ci log yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig tu ni rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: They understand this much: “This is an error.”

original: gang gi tshe rab rib sel ba'i mig sman bskus pas rab rib med par gyur pa de'i tshe ni skra shad la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo de ma rtogs pa'i tshul gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rab rib sel ba'i mig sman bskus pas rab rib med par gyur pa de'i tshe ni skra shad la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo de ma rtogs pa'i tshul gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: When they apply the eye medicine that clears up their eye disease and they become free of eye disease, at that time they understand the essence of falling hairs and so on in a way that is not a form of nonunderstanding.

original: 'phags pa rnams sgro btags pa'i sgo nas de kho na nyid ston mod kyi de lta na yang de tsam gyis 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyis de'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs par mi 'gyur la /🔽gang gi tshe stong pa nyid phyin ci ma log par lta ba ma rig pa'i rab rib @120a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams sgro btags pa'i sgo nas de kho na nyid ston mod kyi de lta na yang de tsam gyis 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyis de'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs par mi 'gyur la / gang gi tshe stong pa nyid phyin ci ma log par lta ba ma rig pa'i rab rib @120a * //
translated: Although the noble ones teach reality by means of superimposition, still, to that extent, those who are not noble ones do not realize its intrinsic reality.

original: sel bar byed pa'i mig sman gyis blo'i mig dag la bskus par gyur pa na /
analyzed: sel bar byed pa'i mig sman gyis blo'i mig dag la bskus par gyur pa na /
translated: When the eye of the mind is anointed with the eye medicine of the unerring view of emptiness that removes the cataracts of ignorance,

original: de kho na nyid kyi ye shes skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe de kho na nyid de ma rtogs pa'i tshul gyis rang nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi ye shes skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe de kho na nyid de ma rtogs pa'i tshul gyis rang nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: the gnosis of reality arises, and at that time, reality is realized by itself in a manner of non-realization.

original: de ltar na dngos po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo gzhan las shes pa ma yin pa de ni de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo gzhan las shes pa ma yin pa de ni de kho na nyid do //
translated: Thus the intrinsic reality of things that is not known from another is reality.

original: de ni zhi ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de ni zhi ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: It is peaceful by nature.

original: rab rib med pas skra shad ma mthong ba ltar rang bzhin dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab rib med pas skra shad ma mthong ba ltar rang bzhin dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “free from intrinsic reality” is like the absence of seeing floating hairs due to the absence of cataracts.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not fabricated by mental fabrications.

original: spros pa ni ngag ste don rnams spro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa ni ngag ste don rnams spro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mental fabrication is speech, because it causes the proliferation of meanings.

original: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa ni ngag dag gis ma brjod pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa ni ngag dag gis ma brjod pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not fabricated by mental fabrications means not expressed by speech.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also free of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni sems kyi rgyu ba yin na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni sems kyi rgyu ba yin na /
translated: Conceptualization is the movement of the mind.

original: de dang bral ba'i phyir de kho na nyid de ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang bral ba'i phyir de kho na nyid de ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
translated: Since it is free of that, reality is free of conceptualization.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a sūtra says,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the ultimate truth?

original: gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na /
analyzed: gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na /
translated: If there is no movement of the mind at all,

original: yi ge rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yi ge rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs so //
translated: what need is there to mention words?”

original: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is free of conceptualization.

original: 'di la don tha dad pa yod pas na //
analyzed: 'di la don tha dad pa yod pas na //
translated: Since there is a difference in meaning here,

original: don tha dad pas te don so so ba'o //
analyzed: don tha dad pas te don so so ba'o //
translated: it is different in meaning, that is, it has a different meaning.

original: don tha dad pa med pa ni don tha dad pa min pa ste //
analyzed: don tha dad pa med pa ni don tha dad pa min pa ste //
translated: The absence of a difference in meaning is the absence of a difference in meaning.

original: don so so ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don so so ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are not different in meaning.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa bden pa gnyis la 'jug pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa bden pa gnyis la 'jug pa'i mdo las /
translated: As it says in the Sūtra on the Two Truths:

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said:

original: 'jam dpal don dam pa'i sbyor ba ni gang yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal don dam pa'i sbyor ba ni gang yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, what is the ultimate?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said:

original: lha'i bu dag don dam par na de bzhin nyid dang chos kyi dbyings dang / gtan ma skyes pa gang du mtshungs pa der don dam par mtshams med pa rnams kyang mtshungs so //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag don dam par na de bzhin nyid dang chos kyi dbyings dang / gtan ma skyes pa gang du mtshungs pa der don dam par mtshams med pa rnams kyang mtshungs so //
translated: “Divine son, ultimately, suchness, the realm of reality, and the utterly unborn are the same. Ultimately, the actions of immediate retribution are the same as that.

original: mtshams med pa rnams don dam par gang du mtshungs pa der ni lta bar gyur pa rnams kyang mtshungs so //
analyzed: mtshams med pa rnams don dam par gang du mtshungs pa der ni lta bar gyur pa rnams kyang mtshungs so //
translated: Where the actions of immediate retribution are the same ultimately, there views are the same.

original: lta bar gyur pa rnams gang du mtshungs pa der ni so so skye bo'i chos rnams kyang mtshungs so //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa rnams gang du mtshungs pa der ni so so skye bo'i chos rnams kyang mtshungs so //
translated: Where views are the same, there the qualities of ordinary beings are the same.

original: so so skye bo'i chos rnams gang du mtshungs pa der ni slob pa'i chos rnams kyang mtshungs so //
analyzed: so so skye bo'i chos rnams gang du mtshungs pa der ni slob pa'i chos rnams kyang mtshungs so //
translated: Where the qualities of ordinary beings are the same, there the qualities of those in training are the same.

original: slob pa'i chos rnams gang du mtshungs pa der ni mi slob pa'i chos rnams kyang mtshungs so //
analyzed: slob pa'i chos rnams gang du mtshungs pa der ni mi slob pa'i chos rnams kyang mtshungs so //
translated: Where the dharmas of the trainee are the same, there the dharmas of the non-trainee are the same.

original: mi slob pa'i chos rnams gang du mtshungs pa der ni yang dag par rdzogs @120b pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang mtshungs so //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i chos rnams gang du mtshungs pa der ni yang dag par rdzogs @120b pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang mtshungs so //
translated: Where the dharmas of the non-trainee are the same, there the dharmas of the Perfectly Awakened One are the same.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gang du mtshungs pa der ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gang du mtshungs pa der ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang mtshungs so //
translated: Where the dharmas of the Perfectly Awakened One are the same, there nirvāṇa is the same.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa gang du mtshungs pa der ni 'khor ba yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa gang du mtshungs pa der ni 'khor ba yang mtshungs so //
translated: Where nirvāṇa is the same, there saṃsāra is the same.

original: don dam par 'khor ba gang du mtshungs pa der ni don dam par kun nas nyon mongs pa yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: don dam par 'khor ba gang du mtshungs pa der ni don dam par kun nas nyon mongs pa yang mtshungs so //
translated: Where ultimately saṃsāra is the same, there ultimately affliction is the same.

original: don dam par kun nas nyon mongs pa gang du mtshungs pa der ni don dam par rnam par byang ba yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: don dam par kun nas nyon mongs pa gang du mtshungs pa der ni don dam par rnam par byang ba yang mtshungs so //
translated: Where ultimately affliction is the same, there ultimately purification is the same.

original: don dam par rnam par byang ba gang du mtshungs pa der ni chos thams cad kyang mtshungs so //
analyzed: don dam par rnam par byang ba gang du mtshungs pa der ni chos thams cad kyang mtshungs so //
translated: In the ultimate, where purification is the same, all phenomena are the same.

original: lha'i bu chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la yang dag par sbyor ba'i dge slong ni don dam par yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la yang dag par sbyor ba'i dge slong ni don dam par yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Divine son, a monk who is truly engaged in the equality of all phenomena is said to be truly engaged in the ultimate.

original: ji skad brjod pa bzhin du ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa bzhin du ma yin no //
translated: He is not as he is described.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The divine son said:

original: mnyam pa nyid gang du don dam par na rnam par byang ba'i bar du mnyam pa gang yin pa der don dam par chos thams cad kyang mnyam pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid gang du don dam par na rnam par byang ba'i bar du mnyam pa gang yin pa der don dam par chos thams cad kyang mnyam pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, you say that in the ultimate all phenomena are the same, up to and including purification.

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: don dam par ni chos thams cad ma skyes par mnyam pa dang / don dam par na chos thams cad ma byung bar mnyam pa dang / don dam par na chos thams cad gtan du ma skyes par mnyam pa dang / don dam par na chos thams cad dngos po med par mnyam pas /
analyzed: don dam par ni chos thams cad ma skyes par mnyam pa dang / don dam par na chos thams cad ma byung bar mnyam pa dang / don dam par na chos thams cad gtan du ma skyes par mnyam pa dang / don dam par na chos thams cad dngos po med par mnyam pas /
translated: “Divine son, in the ultimate all phenomena are the same in being unborn, all phenomena are the same in being unarisen, all phenomena are the same in being forever unborn, and all phenomena are the same in being unreal.

original: lha'i bu don dam par chos thams cad mtshungs so //
analyzed: lha'i bu don dam par chos thams cad mtshungs so //
translated: “Divine son, ultimately all phenomena are the same.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha'i bu don dam par ni gtan ma skyes pa nye bar bzung nas chos thams cad la tha dad du bya ba med do //
analyzed: lha'i bu don dam par ni gtan ma skyes pa nye bar bzung nas chos thams cad la tha dad du bya ba med do //
translated: Divine son, ultimately, when you apprehend that all phenomena are utterly unborn, there is no difference to be made between them.

original: lha'i bu 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: lha'i bu 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Divine son, it is like this:

original: kham pa'i snod kyi nang gi nam mkha' gang yin pa dang / rin po che'i snod kyi nang gi nam mkha' gang yin pa 'di gnyis nam mkha'i khams nyid yin te /
analyzed: kham pa'i snod kyi nang gi nam mkha' gang yin pa dang / rin po che'i snod kyi nang gi nam mkha' gang yin pa 'di gnyis nam mkha'i khams nyid yin te /
translated: The space inside a clay pot and the space inside a jeweled pot are both the element of space.

original: de la don dam par tha dad du bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de la don dam par tha dad du bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Ultimately, there is not the slightest difference between them.

original: lha'i bu de bzhin du don dam par gang kun nas nyon mongs pa de gtan mi skye ba nyid do //
analyzed: lha'i bu de bzhin du don dam par gang kun nas nyon mongs pa de gtan mi skye ba nyid do //
translated: Divine son, in the same way, ultimately, that which is afflicted is utterly unborn.

original: gang rnam par byang ba de yang don dam par gtan mi skye ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang rnam par byang ba de yang don dam par gtan mi skye ba nyid do //
translated: That which is purified is also ultimately utterly unborn.

original: don dam par na 'khor ba yang gtan mi skye ba nyid do //
analyzed: don dam par na 'khor ba yang gtan mi skye ba nyid do //
translated: Ultimately, saṃsāra is also utterly unborn.

original: don dam par na mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du yang gtan mi skye ba nyid de /
analyzed: don dam par na mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du yang gtan mi skye ba nyid de /
translated: Ultimately, even nirvana is not produced at all.

original: de la don dam par na tha dad du bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de la don dam par na tha dad du bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: In that regard, ultimately there is not the slightest distinction.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽don dam @121a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / don dam @121a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: par na chos thams cad gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: par na chos thams cad gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because ultimately all phenomena are not produced at all.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na don tha dad pa ma yin pa ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na don tha dad pa ma yin pa ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of reality is to be known as non-difference in meaning,

original: stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the single taste of emptiness.

original: 'dir phyi ma phyi mas bshad par yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir phyi ma phyi mas bshad par yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the later should be understood as explained by the later.

original: de ltar na re zhig 'phags pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig 'phags pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, that is the characteristic of reality for the noble ones.

original: 'jig rten pa'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the characteristic of reality for the worldly should be stated, taking the worldly perspective as authoritative.

original: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //🔽de ni re zhig de nyid min //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba // de ni re zhig de nyid min //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on something🔽is not that,

original: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
translated: nor is it something other than that.

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: Therefore, it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: ji ltar s'a lu'i sa bon la brten nas s'a lu'i myu gu 'byung ba ltar rgyu gang la brten te 'bras bu gang zhig 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar s'a lu'i sa bon la brten nas s'a lu'i myu gu 'byung ba ltar rgyu gang la brten te 'bras bu gang zhig 'byung ba /
translated: Just as a rice sprout arises in dependence on a rice seed, whatever effect arises in dependence on whatever cause,

original: de ni re zhig de nyid do zhes brjod par ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni re zhig de nyid do zhes brjod par ni mi nus so //
translated: it cannot be said that the effect is just that cause itself.

original: sa bon gang yin pa de ni myu gu ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon gang yin pa de ni myu gu ma yin te /
translated: The seed is not the sprout,

original: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dag gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dag gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that what is produced and the producer are one.

original: de'i phyir pha dang bu gnyis kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha dang bu gnyis kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, father and son would be one.

original: gcig yin pa'i phyir myu gu ltar myu gu'i gnas skabs su sa bon 'dzin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig yin pa'i phyir myu gu ltar myu gu'i gnas skabs su sa bon 'dzin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are one, like the sprout, the seed would be grasped in the state of the sprout.

original: yang na sa bon ltar myu gu yang 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na sa bon ltar myu gu yang 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, like the seed, the sprout would not be grasped.

original: de ltar na sa bon rtag pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na sa bon rtag pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the seed would be permanent,

original: mi 'jig par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'jig par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted as indestructible.

original: de'i phyir rtag par smra bar thal bar 'gyur bas nyes pa chen por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag par smra bar thal bar 'gyur bas nyes pa chen por 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, because it would follow that the self is permanent, a great error would ensue,

original: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that karma, effect, and so on would not exist.

original: de ltar na re zhig sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, first, it is not tenable to say that the seed itself is the sprout.

original: de las gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it different from that.

original: sa bon las myu gu gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon las myu gu gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: The sprout is not different from the seed,

original: sa bon med par yang myu gu skye bar yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sa bon med par yang myu gu skye bar yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it would follow that the sprout would arise even without the seed.

original: gal te gzhan ni gzhan las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te gzhan ni gzhan las gzhan //
translated: If one thing were different from another,

original: de tshe gzhan med par gzhan 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe gzhan med par gzhan 'gyur //
translated: then it would be different without another.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such statements as this occur.

original: myu gu'i gnas skabs na yang sa bon rgyun chad pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: myu gu'i gnas skabs na yang sa bon rgyun chad pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: And it follows that the continuum of the seed would not be interrupted even at the time of the sprout.

original: de'i phyir 'chol pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chol pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the error of confusion would ensue.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu gang zhig la brten nas 'bras bu gang zhig 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu gang zhig la brten nas 'bras bu gang zhig 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Because in this way, depending on a cause, an effect arises.

original: rgyu de 'bras bu yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rgyu de 'bras bu yang ma yin zhing /
translated: The cause is not the effect.

original: rgyu de las 'bras bu de gzhan pa yang ma @121b yin pa de'i phyir rgyu ni chad pa yang ma yin zhing rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar gzhag par yang nus pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de las 'bras bu de gzhan pa yang ma @121b yin pa de'i phyir rgyu ni chad pa yang ma yin zhing rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar gzhag par yang nus pa yin no //
translated: The effect is not different from the cause. Therefore, it is possible to posit that the cause is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa'i lhas /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa'i lhas /
translated: Āryadeva says:

original: gang phyir dngos po 'jug 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos po 'jug 'gyur ba //
translated: Because things engage,

original: des na chad par mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: des na chad par mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: they are not annihilated.

original: gang phyir dngos po ldog 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos po ldog 'gyur ba //
translated: Because things disengage,

original: des na rtag par mi 'gyur ro ;🔽; zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des na rtag par mi 'gyur ro ; ; zhes bshad do //
translated: they are not eternal.

original: mdo las kyang /🔽sa bon yod na myu gu ji bzhin te /
analyzed: mdo las kyang / sa bon yod na myu gu ji bzhin te /
translated: Also, a sūtra says:🔽Just as a sprout arises from a seed,

original: sa bon gang yin myu gu de nyid min //
analyzed: sa bon gang yin myu gu de nyid min //
translated: the seed is not the sprout.

original: de las gzhan min de yang ma yin te //
analyzed: de las gzhan min de yang ma yin te //
translated: It is not different from it, nor is it just that.

original: de phyir rtag min chad min chos nyid do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de phyir rtag min chad min chos nyid do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not eternal, nor is it annihilated.

original: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: Therefore, in the manner explained above,

original: sangs rgyas 'jig rten mgon rnams kyi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jig rten mgon rnams kyi //
translated: the teachings of the buddhas, the lords of the world,

original: bstan pa bdud rtsir gyur pa de //
analyzed: bstan pa bdud rtsir gyur pa de //
translated: which have become the nectar of immortality,

original: don gcig ma yin tha dad min //
analyzed: don gcig ma yin tha dad min //
translated: are not of one meaning nor of different meanings.

original: chad pa ma yin rtag ma yin //
analyzed: chad pa ma yin rtag ma yin //
translated: They are not of annihilation nor of permanence.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas klu chen po thugs rje chen po'i sprin chen po'i tshogs kyis phyogs kyi dkyil 'khor nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' gtugs pa bar mtshams med par khebs par mdzad pa /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas klu chen po thugs rje chen po'i sprin chen po'i tshogs kyis phyogs kyi dkyil 'khor nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' gtugs pa bar mtshams med par khebs par mdzad pa /
translated: The perfect buddhas, the great nāgas, with the great clouds of their great compassion, cover the entire expanse of the directions, the limits of space, without any gaps.

original: 'gro ba 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs mngon du rgyu'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shin tu ches tsha bas gdungs pa'i gdung ba nye bar zhi ba lhur mdzad pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs mngon du rgyu'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shin tu ches tsha bas gdungs pa'i gdung ba nye bar zhi ba lhur mdzad pa /
translated: They are intent on completely pacifying the torment of beings who are tormented by the very hot sun-disk of the mass of afflictions such as attachment.

original: rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par ji ltar 'tsham par spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa /
analyzed: rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par ji ltar 'tsham par spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa /
translated: They are the antidotes to the conduct of beings in accordance with their afflictions.

original: dam pa'i chos ston pa'i bdud rtsi'i rgyun dag 'bebs pas ji ltar 'os par gdul ba'i skye bo'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i lo tog gi myu gu skyes pa spel bas rjes su bzung bar bzhed pa /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ston pa'i bdud rtsi'i rgyun dag 'bebs pas ji ltar 'os par gdul ba'i skye bo'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i lo tog gi myu gu skyes pa spel bas rjes su bzung bar bzhed pa /
translated: They are considered to be the ones who nurture the sprouts of the crop of virtue of the beings to be trained, in accordance with their needs, by causing the stream of the nectar of the teaching of the sublime Dharma to descend.

original: rtag tu dam pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi'i char 'bebs pa /
analyzed: rtag tu dam pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi'i char 'bebs pa /
translated: They are the ones who always cause the rain of the nectar of the sublime Dharma to fall.

original: 'jig rten pa skyob pa med pa'i skyob pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa skyob pa med pa'i skyob pa /
translated: They are the protectors of the world that is without a protector.

original: mgon med pa'i mgon /
analyzed: mgon med pa'i mgon /
translated: They are the guardians of those who are without a guardian.

original: 'jig rten mgon po rnams kyi dam pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi rga ba dang 'chi ba gtan gcod pa de ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po rnams kyi dam pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi rga ba dang 'chi ba gtan gcod pa de ni /
translated: The nectar of the sublime Dharma of the Lords of the World, which is the definitive end of aging and death,

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gcig dang tha dad pa nyid dang bral ba dang / chad pa dang rtag par smra ba dang bral bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gcig dang tha dad pa nyid dang bral ba dang / chad pa dang rtag par smra ba dang bral bar shes par bya'o //
translated: should be understood in the manner that has been taught, as being free from identity and difference, and free from the proponents of annihilation and permanence.

original: nyan thos kyi chos kyi de kho na nyid bdud rtsi 'di la zhugs pa /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos kyi de kho na nyid bdud rtsi 'di la zhugs pa /
translated: Those who have entered this nectar, the reality of the Dharma of the Listeners,

original: thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa'i rim gyis rab tu zhugs pa rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa'i rim gyis rab tu zhugs pa rnams kyis ni /
translated: who have entered it through the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation,

original: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi phung po gsum gyi bdud rtsi nye bar spyad pa'i phyir nges pa kho nar rga shi zad pa'i ngo bo @122a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi phung po gsum gyi bdud rtsi nye bar spyad pa'i phyir nges pa kho nar rga shi zad pa'i ngo bo @122a * //
translated: Because they partake of the nectar of the three aggregates of ethics, concentration and wisdom, they definitely attain the state of the exhaustion of aging and death.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they partake of the nectar of the three aggregates of morality, concentration, and wisdom, they will definitely attain nirvana, the cessation of old age and death.

original: ci ste yang ji zhig ltar 'dir dge ba'i rtsa ba ma smin pa nyid kyis dam pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi 'di thos su zin kyang thar pa ma thob na ni /
analyzed: ci ste yang ji zhig ltar 'dir dge ba'i rtsa ba ma smin pa nyid kyis dam pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi 'di thos su zin kyang thar pa ma thob na ni /
translated: But if, somehow, they do not attain liberation here, because their roots of virtue are not yet mature, even though they have heard this nectar of the Dharma,

original: de lta na 'ang de dag skye ba gzhan du'ang sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs nyid las grub pa nges par gdon mi za bar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'ang de dag skye ba gzhan du'ang sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs nyid las grub pa nges par gdon mi za bar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: then in other lives, by the power of their previous causes, they will definitely and without doubt accomplish it.

original: ji skad du brgya pa las /🔽de nyid shes pas gal te 'dir //
analyzed: ji skad du brgya pa las / de nyid shes pas gal te 'dir //
translated: As Catuhﬁ śataka says,🔽Even if, through knowing reality,

original: mya ngan 'das pa ma thob kyang //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa ma thob kyang //
translated: One does not attain nirvana here,

original: skye ba phyi mar 'bad med par //🔽nges par thob 'gyur las bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba phyi mar 'bad med par // nges par thob 'gyur las bzhin no //
translated: In future lives, without effort,

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: One will definitely attain it, just like karma.

original: ci ste yang ji zhig ltar /
analyzed: ci ste yang ji zhig ltar /
translated: But if, somehow,

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
translated: When the perfect Buddhas have not appeared,

original: nyan thos rnams kyang zad pa na ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyang zad pa na ste /
translated: and when the śrāvakas have disappeared,

original: gyur pa'i tshe 'phags pa'i lam ston par byed pa'i rkyen ma tshang bas de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi ma thob par gyur pa /
analyzed: gyur pa'i tshe 'phags pa'i lam ston par byed pa'i rkyen ma tshang bas de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi ma thob par gyur pa /
translated: at that time, the condition of the teacher of the ārya path being absent, they do not obtain the nectar of reality.

original: de lta na yang sngon tshe rabs gzhan du de kho na nyid thos pa'i rgyu'i stobs kho na las 'jig rten 'di'i nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa dang bral yang rkyen rnam par dben pa rten pa tsam thob pa /
analyzed: de lta na yang sngon tshe rabs gzhan du de kho na nyid thos pa'i rgyu'i stobs kho na las 'jig rten 'di'i nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa dang bral yang rkyen rnam par dben pa rten pa tsam thob pa /
translated: Even so, by the power of the cause of hearing reality in other lives, they obtain the mere support of the condition of solitude, free from dependence on the teachings of this world.

original: rang 'byung rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni //
analyzed: rang 'byung rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni //
translated: The pristine wisdom of the self-arisen pratyekabuddhas

original: rten pa med las rab tu skye ba yin no //🔽rten pa med pa ni lus dang sems dag dben pa'am /
analyzed: rten pa med las rab tu skye ba yin no // rten pa med pa ni lus dang sems dag dben pa'am /
translated: arises from the absence of support.🔽The absence of support is the solitude of body and mind,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su mi tshol ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su mi tshol ba ste /
translated: or not seeking a spiritual friend.

original: rten med pa'i rgyu de las so //
analyzed: rten med pa'i rgyu de las so //
translated: From that cause of absence of support,

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba'i dus su rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba'i dus su rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because in the absence of a Buddha, the pratyekabuddhas realize reality,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sman pa'i rgyal pos gsungs pa dam pa'i chos de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi ji skad du bshad pa de 'bras bu yod par grub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sman pa'i rgyal pos gsungs pa dam pa'i chos de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi ji skad du bshad pa de 'bras bu yod par grub par shes par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the nectar of reality, the holy Dharma taught by the King of Physicians, the perfect Buddha, is not in vain.

original: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because this is so,

original: shes rab can rnams kyis srog dag kyang btang ste de kho na nyid btsal bar 'os pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab can rnams kyis srog dag kyang btang ste de kho na nyid btsal bar 'os pa yin te /
translated: the wise should seek reality even at the cost of their lives.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu dus bcom ldan 'das ma ji ltar btsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu dus bcom ldan 'das ma ji ltar btsal ba bzhin no //
translated: This is like the bodhisattva Sadaprarudita’s search for the Blessed Lady.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽In the Blessed Lady, the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines,

original: bcom ldan 'das ma yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa las /
translated: the Blessed One said:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu dus /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu dus /
translated: “Sadaprarudita, the bodhisattva, the great being,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ji ltar yongs su btsal ba lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ji ltar yongs su btsal ba lags /
translated: How should this perfection of wisdom be sought?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe @122b dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe @122b dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord replied to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu dus /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu dus /
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita,

original: sngon shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su tshol ba na /
analyzed: sngon shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su tshol ba na /
translated: when previously seeking this perfection of wisdom,

original: lus la ched cher mi byed /
analyzed: lus la ched cher mi byed /
translated: did not value his body,

original: srog la mi lta /
analyzed: srog la mi lta /
translated: did not care for his life,

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa dag la mi gnas par yongs su btsal to //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa dag la mi gnas par yongs su btsal to //
translated: and sought it without dwelling on gain, honor, or praise.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su tshol zhing 'brog dgon pa zhig tu phyin pa na bar snang las sgra thos par gyur te /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su tshol zhing 'brog dgon pa zhig tu phyin pa na bar snang las sgra thos par gyur te /
translated: While seeking the perfection of wisdom, he went to a great wilderness, and a voice was heard in the sky:

original: rigs kyi bu shar phyogs su song shig dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos par 'gyur gyi ci nas lus ngal ba yid la byed pa mi skyed pa dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa yid la byed pa mi skyed pa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu shar phyogs su song shig dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos par 'gyur gyi ci nas lus ngal ba yid la byed pa mi skyed pa dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa yid la byed pa mi skyed pa dang /
translated: Do not think about the fatigue of the body, do not think about sleep and dullness,🔽do not think about food, and so on, up to do not think about anything internal or external.

original: bza' ba yid la byed pa mi skyed pa dang zhes bya ba nas nang ngam phyi rol gang la yang sems smon par ma byed cig / rigs kyi bu g-yon du ma lta bar song shig /
analyzed: bza' ba yid la byed pa mi skyed pa dang zhes bya ba nas nang ngam phyi rol gang la yang sems smon par ma byed cig / rigs kyi bu g-yon du ma lta bar song shig /
translated: Son of good family, go without looking to the left,

original: g-yas su ma yin /
analyzed: g-yas su ma yin /
translated: without looking to the right,

original: shar du ma yin /🔽nub tu ma yin /
analyzed: shar du ma yin / nub tu ma yin /
translated: without looking east,🔽without looking west,

original: byang du ma yin /🔽steng du ma yin /
analyzed: byang du ma yin / steng du ma yin /
translated: without looking north,🔽without looking up,

original: 'og tu ma yin /
analyzed: 'og tu ma yin /
translated: without looking down,🔽and without looking to the intermediate directions.

original: phyogs mtshams su yang ma lta bar song shig / rigs kyi bu ji ltar bdag las ma yin 'jig tshogs las kyang ma g-yos pa dang / ji ltar gzugs las kyang ma g-yos pa dang / ji ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang /
analyzed: phyogs mtshams su yang ma lta bar song shig / rigs kyi bu ji ltar bdag las ma yin 'jig tshogs las kyang ma g-yos pa dang / ji ltar gzugs las kyang ma g-yos pa dang / ji ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang /
translated: Son of good family, do not move from the self, do not move from the perishable composite, and do not move from form, and do not move from feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pa las kyang ma g-yos pa de ltar song shig / gang 'di las g-yos pa de ni rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pa las kyang ma g-yos pa de ltar song shig / gang 'di las g-yos pa de ni rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever moves from this will fall away.

original: ci las nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci las nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What will they fall away from?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will fall away from the qualities of a Buddha.

original: gang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las nyams par gyur pa de ni 'khor ba la spyod do //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las nyams par gyur pa de ni 'khor ba la spyod do //
translated: Whoever falls away from the qualities of a Buddha will experience saṃsāra.

original: gang 'khor ba la spyod pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod de /
analyzed: gang 'khor ba la spyod pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod de /
translated: Whoever experiences saṃsāra does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rjes su mi 'thob po zhes bya ba'i bar nas /
analyzed: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rjes su mi 'thob po zhes bya ba'i bar nas /
translated: They will not attain the perfection of wisdom.

original: chu de dag mi snang bar byas nas kun tu chu btsal na chu ma rnyed do //
analyzed: chu de dag mi snang bar byas nas kun tu chu btsal na chu ma rnyed do //
translated: They disappeared, and when he searched everywhere for water, he could not find any.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu dus 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu dus 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita thought this:

original: bdag gi lus phug la khrag gis sa phyogs 'di chag chag gdab bo //
analyzed: bdag gi lus phug la khrag gis sa phyogs 'di chag chag gdab bo //
translated: “I will pierce my body and sprinkle this place with my blood.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sa phyogs @123a * //
analyzed: sa phyogs @123a * //
translated: The place🔽

original: 'di ni rdul che ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rdul che ste /
translated: “This place is dusty.

original: sa phyogs 'di nas rdul gyi khams byung bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags kyi lus la phog na mi rung na /
analyzed: sa phyogs 'di nas rdul gyi khams byung bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags kyi lus la phog na mi rung na /
translated: If the dust from this place were to settle on the body of the bodhisattva great being Dharmodgata, it would not be right.

original: bdag gi lus gdon mi za bar 'jig pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: bdag gi lus gdon mi za bar 'jig pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of this body of mine, which is sure to be destroyed?

original: bdag gi lus 'di lta bu'i bya ba la 'jig pa ni bla'i /
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di lta bu'i bya ba la 'jig pa ni bla'i /
translated: It would be better if this body of mine were to be destroyed for such a purpose.

original: nus pa med pa'i bya ba la 'dod pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i gzhis 'khor bdag na 'khor ba na bdag gi lus brgya stong mang po de lta bu'i gnas su zhig pa ni cir yang ma rung ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: nus pa med pa'i bya ba la 'dod pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i gzhis 'khor bdag na 'khor ba na bdag gi lus brgya stong mang po de lta bu'i gnas su zhig pa ni cir yang ma rung ngo snyam mo //
translated: Because of my desire for the impossible, and because of my desire for a wife, I have wandered in saṃsāra, and in saṃsāra, the destruction of many hundreds of thousands of my bodies has been of no use at all.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu dus mtshon rnon po blangs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu dus mtshon rnon po blangs te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva great being Sadāprarudita took a sharp knife,

original: bdag gi lus kun tu phug nas rang gi khrag gis sa phyogs de khor khor yug tu chag chag btab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu dus /
analyzed: bdag gi lus kun tu phug nas rang gi khrag gis sa phyogs de khor khor yug tu chag chag btab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu dus /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags mthong ma thag tu 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags mthong ma thag tu 'di lta ste ;
translated: as soon as he saw the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata, attained a happiness such as he had never before experienced,

original: dper na dge slong bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs pa'i dge slong rtse gcig tu yid la byed pa de bzhin du bde ba de lta bu thob po //
analyzed: dper na dge slong bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs pa'i dge slong rtse gcig tu yid la byed pa de bzhin du bde ba de lta bu thob po //
translated: just like a bhikṣu who has entered the first concentration, a bhikṣu who has one-pointed attention.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa ni 'di lta ste / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata taught the perfection of wisdom like this:🔽“All phenomena are the same as the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos thams cad dben pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad dben pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa nyid do //
translated: All phenomena are isolated as the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa g-yo ba med pa nyid do //🔽chos thams cad rlom sems med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rlom sems med pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa g-yo ba med pa nyid do // chos thams cad rlom sems med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rlom sems med pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is unmoving because all dharmas are unmoving.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not conceited because all dharmas are not conceited.

original: chos thams cad khengs pa med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khengs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad khengs pa med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khengs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not puffed up because all dharmas are not puffed up.

original: chos thams cad ro gcig pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ro gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ro gcig pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ro gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is of one taste because all dharmas are of one taste.

original: chos thams cad mu med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad mu med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is limitless because all dharmas are limitless.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba med pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is non-arisen because all dharmas are non-arisen.

original: chos thams cad 'gag pa med pa nyid las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'gag pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gag pa med pa nyid las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'gag pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is unceasing because all dharmas are unceasing.

original: @123b nam mkha' mu med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar dang / chos thams cad ma 'dres pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma 'dres pa nyid do //
analyzed: @123b nam mkha' mu med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar dang / chos thams cad ma 'dres pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma 'dres pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is unadulterated because all phenomena are unadulterated.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs su med pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs su med pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is non-apprehensible because all phenomena are non-apprehensible.

original: chos thams cad rnam par 'jig pa mnyam pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'jig pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par 'jig pa mnyam pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'jig pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the same in terms of the destruction of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad byed pa med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa byed pa med pa nyid do //🔽chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa byed pa med pa nyid do //🔽chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is non-action because all phenomena are non-action.🔽The perfection of wisdom is inconceivable because all phenomena are inconceivable.

original: slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: This is from the Clear Words composed by the master Candrakirti.🔽

original: bdag brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: bdag brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the eighteenth chapter, having  the refutation of the self, in the “Treatise on the Middle, ” called “Wisdom.

original: // /'dir smras pa ;
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa ;
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: “The nature of things definitely exists,

analyzed: de dus gsum du gdags pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de skad cig la sogs pa dag gis mngon par gsal bar byed pa yin te /

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: then it is said:

analyzed: dus kyis 'byung ba smin par byed // dus kyis skye dgu sdud par byed //

original: dus kyis gnyid log sad par byed //
analyzed: dus kyis gnyid log sad par byed //

original: dus las 'da' bar shin tu dka' //
analyzed: dus las 'da' bar shin tu dka' //

analyzed: zhes 'byung ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gnas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni yod pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the nature of time, which has such characteristics, exists,

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: de ltar na yang gang zhig skad cig la sogs pa dag gis mngon par gsal zhing gzung ba dus gnas pa yod pa ma yin no //

original: yang ci'i phyir dus gnas pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir dus gnas pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Why is time that exists as a permanent entity not manifested and apprehended by moments, etc.?

original: skad cig la sogs pa las tha dad par ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig la sogs pa las tha dad par ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //

original: gzhan yang dus 'di 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa zhig gam /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus 'di 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa zhig gam /
translated: Moreover, is this time that you assert to be the nature of a conditioned phenomenon?

original: 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa zhig yod par rtog grang na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa zhig yod par rtog grang na /

original: gnyi ga yang /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang /
