analyzed: skye dang gnas dang 'jig pa dag / ma grub phyir na 'dus byas med //
translated: Since arising, enduring, and ceasing are not established, the conditioned does not exist.

original: 'dus byas rab tu ma grub pas //
analyzed: 'dus byas rab tu ma grub pas //
translated: Since the conditioned is not established,

original: 'dus ma byas ni ji ltar 'grub //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni ji ltar 'grub //
translated: how could the unconditioned be established?

original: ces bya ba des 'dus byas brtag par bkag zin to //
analyzed: ces bya ba des 'dus byas brtag par bkag zin to //
translated: This refutes the examination of the conditioned.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na gang zhig gzung bar bya ba dus gnas pa yod pa ma yin no //🔽dus gang zhig de ltar mi gnas shing yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzung ba ma yin pa de ni ma bzung ba yin dang ji ltar skad cig la sogs pa dag gis gdags par nus zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na gang zhig gzung bar bya ba dus gnas pa yod pa ma yin no // dus gang zhig de ltar mi gnas shing yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzung ba ma yin pa de ni ma bzung ba yin dang ji ltar skad cig la sogs pa dag gis gdags par nus zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, in that case, the time that is apprehended does not exist.🔽Since time does not exist in that way and is not apprehended, how could it be apprehended by the instants and so on?

original: ma bzung dus ni ji ltar gdags //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma bzung dus ni ji ltar gdags // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the line: “How could time that is not apprehended be designated?”

original: de'i phyir dus med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore time does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: dus zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du grub pa rtag pa 'ga' zhig med pa ni bden te /
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du grub pa rtag pa 'ga' zhig med pa ni bden te /
translated: It is true that time does not exist as a permanent, single entity that is a different nature from form and so on.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But what is it then?

original: 'du byed gzugs la sogs pa dag la brten na brtags pa'i dus ni skad cig la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: 'du byed gzugs la sogs pa dag la brten na brtags pa'i dus ni skad cig la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya bar 'gyur te ;
translated: Time imputed in dependence on compounded phenomena such as form and so on is what is referred to by the terms “moment” and so on.

original: de'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore there is no fault.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is to be stated:

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: Even so,

original: gal te dus ni dngos brten te //
analyzed: gal te dus ni dngos brten te //
translated: if time depends on things,

original: dngos med dus ni ga la yod //
analyzed: dngos med dus ni ga la yod //
translated: how could there be time without things?

original: gal te de ltar dngos po la brten nas dus su 'gyur ro zhes rnam par 'jog na'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar dngos po la brten nas dus su 'gyur ro zhes rnam par 'jog na'o //
translated: If time is posited as that which is dependent on things,

original: gang gi tshe dngos po nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe nges par de'i rgyu @126a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe nges par de'i rgyu @126a * //
translated: when things do not exist at all, then definitely the time that is their cause🔽also does not exist.

original: can gyi dus kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: can gyi dus kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: dngos po 'ga' yang yod min na //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' yang yod min na //🔽zhes gsungs te /
translated: Since no things exist at all,🔽how could time exist?

original: gong du rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir dang / dgag pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: gong du rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir dang / dgag pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Because it has been extensively explained above, and because the refutation will be explained below.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When things do not exist in any way,

original: dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could time exist?

original: dus med pas de'i tshad du gyur pa dus kyi bye brag skad cig la sogs pa yang med do //
analyzed: dus med pas de'i tshad du gyur pa dus kyi bye brag skad cig la sogs pa yang med do //
translated: Since time does not exist, the temporal distinctions such as the instant that constitute it do not exist.

original: de'i phyir tshad dang ldan pa nyid kyis dus grub par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad dang ldan pa nyid kyis dus grub par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how could time be established by possessing temporal measure?

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the essence of things does not exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'phags pa glang po'i rtsal gyi mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'phags pa glang po'i rtsal gyi mdo las /
translated: The Bhagavat also said in the Sthavira-nirgrantha-vyākaraṇa-sūtra:

original: gal te chos rnams rang bzhin 'ga' yod na //
analyzed: gal te chos rnams rang bzhin 'ga' yod na //
translated: If phenomena had any essence,

original: rgyal ba nyan thos bcas pas de mkhyen 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyal ba nyan thos bcas pas de mkhyen 'gyur //
translated: The Victor and his śrāvakas would know it.

original: ther zug chos rnams mya ngan 'das mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ther zug chos rnams mya ngan 'das mi 'gyur //
translated: Immutable phenomena would not attain nirvana,

original: mkhas rnams nam yang spyod pa med mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: mkhas rnams nam yang spyod pa med mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs la /
translated: And the wise would never engage in practice.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: chos ni stong phrag brgya dag bstan gyur nas //
analyzed: chos ni stong phrag brgya dag bstan gyur nas //
translated: Having taught hundreds of thousands of dharmas,

original: sangs rgyas 'bum phrag gang dag 'das gyur kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'bum phrag gang dag 'das gyur kyang //
translated: even though hundreds of thousands of buddhas have passed away,

original: chos dang yi ge dag la zad med de //
analyzed: chos dang yi ge dag la zad med de //
translated: the Dharma and the letters are not exhausted.

original: skye ba yod min des na zad pa med //
analyzed: skye ba yod min des na zad pa med //
translated: Since there is no arising, there is no exhaustion.

original: ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du //
translated: And similarly:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i dus kyi tshe //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i dus kyi tshe //
translated: At the time of the arising of the Tathāgata,

original: byams pa zhes bya'i rgyal ba 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: byams pa zhes bya'i rgyal ba 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: the Victor named Maitreya will arise,

original: sa 'di gser gyis bdal ba 'byung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: sa 'di gser gyis bdal ba 'byung 'gyur ba //
translated: and this earth will be covered with gold.

original: de tshe de yi 'byung de ga la yod //
analyzed: de tshe de yi 'byung de ga la yod //
translated: Where is that arising now?

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dus brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: dus brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the nineteenth chapter, having nineteen verses, called “the examination of time.”

original: // /'dir smras pa /🔽dus ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa / dus ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: 'bras bu 'byung ba la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung ba la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Time exists because it is a cooperative condition for the arising of effects.”

original: gang med pa de ni lhan cig byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin te mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: gang med pa de ni lhan cig byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin te mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: That which does not exist is not a co-originating entity, like the son of a barren woman.

original: de'i phyir dus ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, time exists,

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a co-originating condition.

original: 'di na myu gu gang zhig sa bon dang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang dus zhes bya ba rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa la brten nas skye ba ni /
analyzed: 'di na myu gu gang zhig sa bon dang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang dus zhes bya ba rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa la brten nas skye ba ni /
translated: Here, a sprout arises in dependence on a collection of causes and conditions, such as a seed, earth, water, fire, wind, space, and time.

original: sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa yod kyang dus kyi khyad par nye bas mi @126b skye ba yin no //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa yod kyang dus kyi khyad par nye bas mi @126b skye ba yin no //
translated: Even when the collection of causes and conditions such as the seed exists, the sprout does not arise due to the absence of a particular time.

original: phyi rol dag la ji lta ba de bzhin du nang gi bdag nyid la yang yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol dag la ji lta ba de bzhin du nang gi bdag nyid la yang yin te /
translated: Just as it is for external things, so it is for internal things.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: lus can rnams kyi las rnams ni //
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi las rnams ni //
translated: The actions of embodied beings

original: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
translated: do not perish even in a hundred eons.

original: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
analyzed: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
translated: When the assemblage and time are right,

original: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //🔽zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //🔽zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dus de la ltos pa yod pa de'i phyir gang zhig myu gu la sogs pa byung ba la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba dus zhes bya ba de yod pa yin no //

translated: Because time is dependent on that, therefore time exists as a cooperative condition for the arising of sprouts and so on.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We say:

original: gal te myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu 'byung ba nyid yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu 'byung ba nyid yod na ni /
translated: If the arising of the effect, the sprout and so on, existed,

original: dus lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: dus lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then time would be a cooperative condition.

original: yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not exist.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'dir sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa las myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu skye bar rtog pa na /🔽'bras bu tshogs pa la rnam par gnas pa zhig gam /
analyzed: 'dir sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa las myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu skye bar rtog pa na / 'bras bu tshogs pa la rnam par gnas pa zhig gam /
translated: Here, when you imagine that the effect, such as a sprout, arises from the assembly of causes and conditions, such as a seed,

original: mi gnas pa zhig de las skye bar rtog grang /
analyzed: mi gnas pa zhig de las skye bar rtog grang /
translated: do you imagine that the effect arises from the assembly that endures or from the assembly that does not endure?

original: gal te rnam par gnas pa zhig la rtog na ni /
analyzed: gal te rnam par gnas pa zhig la rtog na ni /

analyzed: de ni mi rung ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir //

original: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: If the effect exists in the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur zhing //
translated: And from the assembly itself, it arises.🔽

original: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //🔽ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni // ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
translated: If the effect exists in the assemblage,

original: zhes gsungs te ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs te ;
translated: how could it arise from the assemblage?

analyzed: gal te rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa las 'bras bu yod na ni /
translated: If the effect exists in the assemblage of causes and conditions,🔽how could it arise from that assemblage?

analyzed: de lta na gang zhig tshogs pa la yod pa de ji ltar des bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever exists in the assemblage cannot be produced by it,

analyzed: khar gzhong na yod pa'i zho ni khar gzhong gis bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: just as yogurt that exists in the yogurt-bowl is not produced by the yogurt-bowl.

original: gzhan yang gang yod pa de ni grub zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang yod pa de ni grub zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since it already exists,

analyzed: grub zin pa'i bum pa mdun na gnas pa ltar yang skye ba la ltos pa med pa yin no //
translated: it would not depend on arising, just like a pot that already exists and is present in front of us.

analyzed: gal te mngon par gsal ba'am rags par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is made manifest or gross,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: phyogs 'di la gong du lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la gong du lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This position has already been refuted above.

original: me ni gzhan las mi 'ong ste //
analyzed: me ni gzhan las mi 'ong ste //
translated: Fire does not come from another,

original: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //

analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba der lan brjod zin to //

analyzed: ci ste tshogs pa la 'bras bu med do zhes rtog na /

analyzed: de yang mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains why that is untenable:🔽If the effect arises from

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur zhing //
translated: The assembly of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
translated: And the effect does not exist in the assembly,

analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las @127a * // skye ; / zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi srid pas //
translated: For that very reason, it is impossible:

analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye // zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //

analyzed: tshogs la gzung du yod rigs na //

analyzed: ci ste dngos po rnams yod kyang /
translated: But if things exist,

original: shin tu phra ba dang / shin tu nye ba dang / shin tu ring ba dang / dbang po la rnyog pa chags pa dang / dbang po la gnod pa byas ba dang / lus can gyi rdzas kyis chod pa dang / lus mi snang bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: shin tu phra ba dang / shin tu nye ba dang / shin tu ring ba dang / dbang po la rnyog pa chags pa dang / dbang po la gnod pa byas ba dang / lus can gyi rdzas kyis chod pa dang / lus mi snang bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: then how is it that very subtle things, things very close, things very far away, things that are a disturbance to the sense faculty, things that harm the sense faculty, things that are obstructed by a substance of a sentient being, things that are invisible,

original: yid la ma bzung ba'i phyir phra rab dang / mig la gnas pa'i mig sman gyi thur ma dang / nyi ma'i 'gros dang / rab rib can gyi skra re re dang / long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i gzugs dang / sgra la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: yid la ma bzung ba'i phyir phra rab dang / mig la gnas pa'i mig sman gyi thur ma dang / nyi ma'i 'gros dang / rab rib can gyi skra re re dang / long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i gzugs dang / sgra la sogs pa dang /
translated: Because they are not apprehended, they are subtle, like the tip of an eye ointment stick that rests on the eye, the movement of the sun, the individual hairs of someone with cataracts, and forms, sounds, and so on, of the blind and deaf.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pas bar du bcad pa'i bum pa dang / grub pa dang lha dang sha za la sogs pa'i lus dang / yul gzhan yid la byed pa dang bcas pa'i yul gzhan ltar gzung du med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pas bar du bcad pa'i bum pa dang / grub pa dang lha dang sha za la sogs pa'i lus dang / yul gzhan yid la byed pa dang bcas pa'i yul gzhan ltar gzung du med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: They are like a vase obstructed by a wall and so on, the bodies of gods, siddhas, and flesh eaters, and like other objects not apprehended due to the mind attending to other objects.

original: 'on gang gis na 'di dag yod bzhin du mi dmigs par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: 'on gang gis na 'di dag yod bzhin du mi dmigs par 'gyur ba /
translated: But why are they not observed even though they exist?

original: ma bzung ba 'di dag yod pa nyid la rtag cing yod /
analyzed: ma bzung ba 'di dag yod pa nyid la rtag cing yod /
translated: These unapprehended things exist.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang / nye bar 'jal ba dang / lung rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir de dag yod pa nyid do zhe na /🔽'o na de dag ma dmigs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang / nye bar 'jal ba dang / lung rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir de dag yod pa nyid do zhe na / 'o na de dag ma dmigs so //
translated: They exist because they are apprehended by inference, by analogy, and by scripture.

original: zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: But then it should not be said that they are not observed.

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa dag gis dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa dag gis dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is perceived by inference and so on.
